['Recently had a rough mental breakdown moment and a weird thing happened in game... 
 Long story short...  My ENTIRE neighborhood is full of drama addicts.  We left the house for LESS than two hours the other day to go to a book store event.

Get a text from the FURTHEST neighbor from my house saying my two dogs have been barking non-stop ALL DAY and she has a headache.  I knew that wasn't true cause I had only left an hour and 40 minutes before the text.

Rush home right after texting her back saying I was on my way back cause if they are barking like crazy something must be wrong...  As I am driving she's having an imaginary conversation with me (I never text and drive so she was talking to herself for the most part.) and each message she was getting more and more aggressive.

Got to a red light and texted "Cool your jets.  Nearly there."

Cool your jets was her trigger phrase I guess.  She went nuts and now I've had to temporarily re-home my dogs cause she's crazy...

I am SUPER close to my dogs.  Had them both since they were puppies and they are 8 and 7 years old.  I broke down that night cause of the situation and just wanted to die.

Easiest way to kill myself without killing myself - Suicidal DBD rounds.

I played about 20 matches.  Enter the match.  Find the nearest pallet.  Down it.  Vault loudly non-stop.  Killer walks up.  Wave them towards me.  They hit me once.  Keep waving.  Down me.  Don't recover, don't hide.

In 20 matches...  I could have survived 19.  ONE killer hooked me.

The other 19 would stare at me for a bit...  Refuse to attack me after somebody healed me and I repeated the pallet nonsense.  Many of them carried me to the hatch and I didn't even go through it (because I wanted to die) and they let me bleed out.

Most interesting was the trapper that downed me, picked me up, and downed every other survivor while carrying me because I refused to wiggle.  He then put me down, hooked everyone, and took me to the hatch.

It was interesting to say the least.  Like, their goal is to kill you.  Sure.  But When they see that you REALLY want to die, they try to help you live and succeed...

Not sure if this is just a strange occurrence or a beautiful comment on suicidal people and strangers.  Like if you let people know you're feeling SO bad that you actually want to die, they do whatever they can to help you out and keep you alive.

(Middle school presentation ending)  

So...  Um...  Yeah.  

<BOLD> TL;DR - Was depressed.  Decided to kill myself in DBD over and over to work through the sadness.  But the more suicidal I was, the more the killers tried to help me survive.', 'I've always been a fan of saying "Bitch, I might be" to simple questions.

Are you tired?  Bitch, I might be.

Are you hungry?  Bitch, I might be.', "I guess it's a great time to be poor.  I can't contribute to the panic.

Couldn't afford toilet paper or soap right now if I tried.  Gotta ration what I have here at home.", 'If your pet/pets had dating profiles, what picture would they use and what would their caption be?']

['Ways to Demoralize The Undead??? 
 So. I‚Äôm in an undead heavy campaign that only recently got undead heavy. I‚Äôve had to change some things up about my character plan and was trying to find feats or abilities that would let me intimidate and demoralize Undead. 

I only found a bonus feat for Vampire Hunter, but the charisma cost is... a bit out of reach. 

Is there any way at all I can get my intimidation to work on undead???', "You‚Äôre misinformed on Atheism as a world view. Concretely, the only thing connecting all atheists is a lack of belief in a god. Whether they believe in scientific explanations or not is inconsistent and not pertinent to atheism. But let me explain your points from the most basic view of a lack of belief atheist. 

1. The universe had to come from somewhere.
2. Evolution is <BOLD> extremely improbable.
3. I can't find a good proof against the existence of absolute truths.
4. There are things in the universe that cannot be explained by naturalism/science.

1. Maybe that‚Äôs true. But so far any explanation regarding a deity making it doesn‚Äôt satisfy me in the way that would convince me. Maybe one did. But I‚Äôm never given a reason or explanation as to how that makes sense, and also never presented with proof of a god existing to do so beforehand. Furthermore, where would a god exist before the universe, in order to create it? I‚Äôm content with waiting for evidence and proof from people who study and investigate these ideas before claiming I know a god did so. 

2. How is it improbable? Furthermore, how is it being improbable matter when it has clearly happened? We‚Äôve had centuries to study evolutionary methods and development, and we are as certain that evolution is actively happening as we are about anything in science. Just because something is improbable doesn‚Äôt mean it won‚Äôt happen. Maybe you mean abiogenesis, the process with which life is formed first before evolution. And while we don‚Äôt know how that happened exactly, we know it <ITALIC> did. Whether a god did so remains to be seen or proven, so I won‚Äôt believe anything regarding that topic concretely until something is found out. 

3. That isn‚Äôt how proof works. Proof is for positive claims. Proof is for things that can be proven to be real. If you try and prove a negative there will be holes and excuses until you give up. For example, I‚Äôm a hyper intelligent octopus. You don‚Äôt believe me? Prove me wrong. If you find my account saying otherwise I could claim I was lying. If you find my house I could claim I forwarded the IP address. If you find my ‚Äúbody‚Äù I could claim I‚Äôm an octopus on the outside of the simulated world. Proving a negative is useless, so instead proof lies with the positive claim. It‚Äôs up to <ITALIC> me to prove I‚Äôm an octopus, and up to <ITALIC> you to prove that absolute truths and a god can exist. 

4. What‚Äôs your point? Saying there‚Äôs something science can‚Äôt explain doesn‚Äôt automatically push that onto a god. People thought viruses were once demons, but we learned. They thought lightning was Zeus, but we learned. And we‚Äôll keep learning. Attributing what we don‚Äôt know to a god stagnates our learning by presuming an explanation. I would rather not know and find out than assume to know on a guess or vague belief. ['Well I find a flaw in your misrepresentation of how you distinguish distinguish  gender based on genetics. If XX is woman and XY is male, what are the genders of XXY and XYY? Considering biological sex is not binary. 

Regardless, gender is not defined solely to biology.', 'I actually dont agree with this. You can be a perfectly valid ally to trans rights without having any romantic or even sexual relationship with trans people. I dont find my support for trans rights to be more "more evolved" than any other trans ally just because Im in a relationship with a trans woman. So yeah I dont think that was worded correctly. I think Perry is stroking the egos of a lot a men here in hopes that they can be more confident and open with who they are. I think the goal is to say to these men, "hey perhaps if youre open about yourself and actually TRY to have a meaningful relationship with a trans woman maybe this sexualized fetishization you have of them that you've developed over the years through your closeted secretive obsession will go away."   


Now I can understand and sympathize with the objections being made here. You'll always have bad faith actors. You'll always have fetishizers posing as allies who will use any buzzword in order to conceal their true intentions that they only want to objectify trans women. Chasers are gonna chase. My point is that your concerns for objectifying chasers would still exist regardless if the word "transamory" existed or not.  


 In a way I also wish that a word like ‚Äútransamory‚Äù didn‚Äôt need to exist, just like I wish the word "atheist" didnt exist either. There really shouldnt be a word to describe a non-belief  just like there isnt a word to describe people who dont have a particular hobby. Likewise why should there be a special word to describe a mere relationship between a man and a woman? Trans women are women right? And love is love correct? I wish it were that simple and easy, but unfortunately I don‚Äôt see us there yet. Cis and trans relationships are still scrutinized very much. Thats why many cis people are still quiet about their attractions. That wont change until there are more people open with their attractions and more trans acceptance from the general public.  

 

I understand that being in a relationship with a trans woman means I will not fit the heteronormative role most other cis men like me colloquially ascribe to. I know in most instances my relationship with my girlfriend will not be accepted at face value for what it is so I know I will find myself constantly trying to validate my relationship to others. In this respect I find the word ‚Äútransamorous‚Äù useful in making my cis friends and acquaintances understand my relationship with my girlfriend.   
 

Again I understand your concerns against the term though. I know you want to be seen as women and not as something ‚Äúother.‚Äù I know you certainly don‚Äôt want to be fetishized. Its obviously a word I would not use to describe myself if Im in a conversation with other trans people. I know trans women are women. I keep the term ‚Äútransamorous‚Äù at arms length sort of speak because of that. I want to respect the identities of trans women as women while being able to embrace my own identity of who I am without limiting my individuality and compelling myself to dissimulate or sublimate who I am and who I am attracted to.', 'A friend of mine said the same thing lol', 'Well I mean did you ever consider the fact that youre wrong ad that you are trying to argue from simplified version of a nuanced truth which was never expanded upon as you grew up?  


Now you want to appeal to an irrational concern of mistaking someones gender or a hyperbolic false equivalency of people thinking theyre a different animal. In the first case its ok to make a mistake at first try. It only becomes a problem when you continually misgender someone after they tell you which pronouns to use. The second case is just utter ridiculousness not worth any serious merit. Again look at ones gender not merely on a notion of feeling but also as an expression of ones self.']

I'm all about the fun here don't @me"]

['Recipe:

Turmeric rice: Add about a tablespoon of turmeric, a third of a can of light coconut milk (full fat‚Äôs probably fine, but since it‚Äôs being used as cooking liquid for rice I figured thinner is better), and four rice cups (the little cup of rice that comes with a rice cooker) of white rice to your rice cooker; add water to the fill line, and set the rice cooker to white rice. 

Tomato ‚Äútuna‚Äù: This is the star of the show. For full effect, start by peeling the tomatoes: start a pot of boiling water and prepare a bath of cold water. Once it‚Äôs really rolling, cut an X on the bottom of 2-3 plum tomatoes and dunk them in for about 45 seconds to a minute (you don‚Äôt want to cook them). Fish them out and dunk them in the cold water. Peel them from the X. After they‚Äôre peeled, cut them into quarters and scoop out the seeds. Then dice them.

If you‚Äôre not up to the whole mess of boiling, I get it! In that case, just dice them. It‚Äôs not as close to a marinated tuna bowl from a sushi bowl restaurant, but it still tastes good, and it makes this recipe 10000x easier. 

Either way, once your tomatoes are diced, put them in a bowl or wide mug (if your roommates used all the bowls and didn‚Äôt wash them), then add around a tablespoon each of sesame oil and olive oil, and a good pinch of salt. The salt isn‚Äôt just for flavor - it helps the tomatoes express extra juice - so don‚Äôt skip it and expect the same results! Refrigerate for at least half an hour, but it‚Äôll last longer than that if you want to prep it in the morning and eat it when you get home. Drain off the excess oil and juice (in my experience, more than half the oil drains off, so the 2 tablespoons isn‚Äôt as much as it looks like, but you need enough that it gets into all the tomatoes). 

Spicy mayo: You can buy this in the store, or make it yourself by mixing about 5 parts mayo, 1 part sriracha. A few drops of sesame oil can add a nice flavor. Vegan mayo will work fine! Avocado mayo will work fine! Low fat mayo will work fine! Don‚Äôt stress it!

Once you‚Äôve assembled these three ingredients, you‚Äôll want to take a bowl and add some warm rice, between 2/3 and 1 1/4 cups depending on how much you like rice (you don‚Äôt want it hot - if you‚Äôre microwaving pre-prepared or leftover rice, try ~30 seconds). Add the tomato, then add 1/2 of a small avocado, sliced thinly. After that‚Äôs done, top with the spicy mayo and some soy sauce. 

It‚Äôs not a perfect recreation of the marinated tuna sushi bowls I used to eat - but it‚Äôs closer than I thought I‚Äôd get! Oh, also, if you‚Äôre interested in sushi-like food, try out the book Sushi Modoki. The idea of using tomato for tuna was adapted from the fatty tuna recipe in there, though I‚Äôve changed the other ingredients.', 'Where I‚Äôm at it‚Äôs kind of a suburban middle aged upper middle class thing. No one I went to youth group/school with took it, but their parents sure did.

I think a lot of the attitude is like, we all saw what it did to Ben‚Äôs mom or whatever, so none of us wanted to touch em. Kids who abused pharmaceuticals, it was mostly opioids (and study drugs).', 'I hated Zarc, but I feel like The Doctor was even worse. He‚Äôs hyped up as this huge villain with mind control parasite breeding tanks to take over the whole world, but then Leo Akaba‚Äôs just like ‚Äúactually I only needed four of these ok bye now‚Äù and turns him into a card without even a duel or anything. Like what the fuck was up with that?', 'I always wanted to be like Yusei :p even had Stardust Dragon in my deck

Unfortunately, I still can‚Äôt ride a bike, let alone a motorcycle. But I have the guy part down!']

['That face when the guy you saved starts sacrificing you', "Huh, and I just started building a Dragunity deck, too. Nice to see them get some more love; I used to play them in Tag Force as Stardust's vacation home with his distant WIND Dragon relatives.

Hopefully they get some protection, a 1st turn option, and/or some way to play without their Normal Summon; while Ascalon <ITALIC> can do some heavy damage, they're very vulnerable as none of the Dragon-quips protecting them from anything.", "I love Scraps. They're one of my favorite decks IRL, probably even my most, and I was rocking them before completing my Crystrons (which is my next favorite). Unfortunately, they do lack quite a lot in terms of competitive viability. They don't have any protection, and their disruption is limited to their turn. Unlike other decks in a similar vein (e.g. Blackfeathers), they aren't as explosive, though they are quite resilient provided their floats and recovery don't get negated by stuff like Necrovalley.

I've been experimenting with an OTK-focused build that tries to bring either/both Synchro out and swing for game. My optimal hand is The Tricky, Scrap Goblin/Scrap Beast, Scrap Chimera, and Scrap Factory; pitch Goblin to SS Tricky, Normal Summon Chimera to revive the pitched Scrap, Synchro Tricky + Tuner, activate Factory, use Synchro's effect to destroy Chimera, SS Golem, then revive the Tuner again for another Synchro. The problem there is that it requires 4 non-searchable cards. I'm hoping they release Scrapyard somewhere down the line to make set Goblin+Factory more consistent, but I highly doubt it since pretty much every Scrap card save for Wyvern is already in the game.

As it stands, the most consistent game plan is to tough it out and win the resource game, hoping you at least break even as the turns go by. That's unfortunately easier said than done as many decks now can OTK consistently before you even get to set up, or have a much better grind game.", "Might be a basic answer, but I guess Rikkas could make use of it since it gives them free tribute fodder. Aromaseraphy Jasmine is also really good since you can link 2 Tokens into her, then tribute another Token for the Special Summon.

I actually tried to make a Rose Dragon deck recently with a similar game plan, but the issue was that it relied on my opponent to fill your field with Tokens first, so I had to hope that I don't let them combo so hard that I can no longer break their board after."]

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>", 'Woah, do you sleep there? Do they know?', "We played it safe and parked at a casino. Can't remember the name but I think it's on a native American reservation. 25 min southeast of Seattle iirc. Freecampsites said there was a 3 day limit but there were plenty of people who looked like they'd been camped there for the better part of the summer, so ymmv", "Hey, I did the same thing but in reverse order (converted a van, travelled for a year, ran out of $, started trucking). Kinda cheated by staying with my GF at her mom's place for a few months here and there+using her address for everything. 

The HVAC comment is important. Truck has forced air heat separate from the engine, and you can idle for A/C. You don't want to idle a van overnight, it's not built for that and the gas will add up fast. So going from truck to van is definitely a downgrade. If it's hot outside, it'll be like 20 degrees hotter in the van. Cold is much more manageable with sleeping bags/good socks but still a challenge. Vehicle life in general does wear on you, you will miss housed life but it sounds like you're no stranger to adverse conditions, so you'll probably be fine :)

Companies shouldn't mind you living in the truck one bit. I've heard my company has a couple folks doing this already. Personally I'm thinking of alternating - a year or two in the truck saving $, a year in the van coasting on those savings, rinse repeat. 

<SUBREDDIT> is a great resource if you haven't been there already. Good luck!"]

["Looking for good youtube tutorials for new players 
 A couple of months ago, some friends and I decided that we would like to play Dungeons & Dragons, so I decided to get the starter set (because we are all completely new to this hobby). 
It took a few months, but now we all finally had the courage to actually go and do it!

Since I had the starter set, enough hyper focus (and free time) to learn the rules, and some roleplaying experience through LARPing, it was decided that I would be the DM (and I am really scared, but also really looking forward to the first session!).

We are using the starter set, so the only thing the players needed to do, was to decide which character they wanted to be. We got together yesterday to do that. They chose their characters, gave them names, thought about their appearances, some of them boasted about their backgrounds while others (wisely) kept them secret and all that fun stuff.

Meanwhile I gave them some of the very, very basic information (which dice we would be using, what the stuff on the character sheet means, allignments and character flaws and all that). 

When we we're done with that, I showed them (part) of an episode of critical role, so they would have at least kind of an idea what we would be doing (although, since none of us are actual actors, I also told them we wouldn't be that good and it was all about having fun, so no pressure).

Now, since all my players are new and I am a new DM trying to understand all of this myself, do you guys and gals have any tips on some (short) tutorials that I could send my lovely players?", "Pardon my French, but holy fuck. It hurts how much I recognize this... I've only been out for a good two months, but my brain is making me doubt everything, all the time!", 'Yes, borrow it all you like! An actual in character scholarly guide would be so cool!', 'To be honest, I think (and my mother says this too) I was a pretty boring teenager. I never "acted out", was always the teacher's pet, got good grades- the whole shebang. However, I did have some minor depressive episodes, so you could say I directed all my frustration inwards, instead of outwards....

I <ITALIC> was a very moody pre-teen though. Between 11 and 13/14-ish, I had terrible moodswings, was basically constantly angry. I think only my immediate family got to see that though, as I was painfully shy around other people!']

['Sorry to hear about that. I hope tomorrow will be better <3', "What exactly do you need advice on? I want to help but I'm unsure of what exactly you need advice on", 'I could use some help 
 So I'm like 97.9% sure I'm trans. I know I feel a great deal of dysphoria, and there is more evidence supporting me being trans than me being cis.

The problem is that I can't stop forcing myself to imagine scenarios where I'm a girl. I know it feels wrong, and I know I hate it. I know I want to be a guy, but I can't stop thinking about the what-if's. It feels like every time I think I know who I am and what I want, there's some doubt. It's so frustrating. 

I could imagine these scenarios for hours and it still wouldn't change anything. I have a doubt, and I'm right back to square one. It's becoming exhausting but I don't know how to stop.

Another thing is, when I see the word "girl" or "female" I just get confused. I don't know what that is or what that means anymore. I don't feel connected with it at all. It feels wrong. But if I see the word "guy" or "boy" I know immediately that's what I want.

I can't really explore anything irl (like cut my hair, get a binder, buy new clothes, etc) because my parents aren't accepting at all (I'm 15 btw). I constantly feel stuck, and I don't know what to do. I don't want to be a burden to my friends or anyone else, so I don't really talk about it with anyone. But it's so hard to discern my feelings, and I don't think I can do it on my own anymore. I feel like I don't know who I am anymore. Like I've lost myself.

These are my most distressing feelings at the moment. I don't think I could write down everything I'm feeling in one post. So has anyone felt something similar? Any and all advice is very much appreciated. And I apologize if any of this is triggering or sounds stupid. Thank you.', "I'm late but I wanna give euphoria. You are a beautiful girl and I hope you achieve your goals. Remember you are loved and valid. Stay safe in quarantine!"]

['Friendly advice to anyone investigating the LDS religion: If you allow yourself to be assimilated, they will "cling on" to you forever.', 'Try thinking of the church as an annoying but necessary part time job you have to have in return for food, board and family relationships. Many believing teens do the bare minimum. During church meetings make an experiment to listen for things you agree with and reject everything else. 

You are entitled to the privacy of your own thoughts and feelings. You csn set boundaries that others aren't allowed to cross. Graduating high school early should help both the extra time at church and the mission dilemma. The busier you are with school snd extracurricular the less time you'll have for church things outside of Sundays. You csn also tell your parents when you turn 18 that you feel a prompting and very inspired to finish another year of college and gain more maturity before a mission. If you are really afraid they will cut off funding, put off telling them you're not going on a mission for as long as you can using that method. 

Lastly, I would consider sitting your parents down and telling them that you've been thinking about how you only have a few last years to be with them at home before leaving to embark on life independently and that your goal is to create happy memories with them that you will all look back on for the rest of your lives. Tell them you want to be a "good" person and you don't want this time to be filled with fighting. Point out that it's a natural stage teenagers go through to start to establish and crave independence from their parents, but you want them to know you love and appreciate them. 

You can always share your thoughts about the church here and maybe with a trusted nevermo or Exmo friend if you have one. 

Good luck! This time feels like forever, but it will definitely pass.', 'Let's take a moment of silence for all the memories we weren't allowed to make because of strict and unbendable rules like "Keep the Sabbath Day Holy." üò•', 'I would say to gently comment honestly when they or others say things you either don't understand or don't agree with. You don't need to be confrontational or argumentative. If they say, "It's not a sin to have same-sex attraction. It's only a sin to act on it," you could reply by saying something like, "That sounds like a really hard thing to ask people to do. I wonder how many straight people would be willing or even able to live their lives that way." I would suggest just making little comments here and there as the opportunity arises that might help them think without even realizing it.']

['Advice? 
 So, I went to a local salon to get gel nails, but I'm pretty sure they used acrylic, because it was a powder and not like builder gel. He said it was "gel powder", but I'm not convinced. Does such a thing exist? He was otherwise amazing, so I don't mind too much. I just don't want to pay extra for gel and get acrylic anyway.

Sidenote: Can you put regular polish over gel? I got a neutral tone, cuz I change it pretty often. Just don't want to ruin them.

Much appreciated!', 'She married some guy, had a kid, got divorced, and got kicked out of her family for getting divorced (even though HE divorced HER for another woman). All before she hit 22.', 'Weird thoughts from a weird dream. 
 I just woke up, and feel like I must share the oxy-codone induced weirdness that just transpired in my head. So, here goes (I'll try my best at spelling). Question in bold at the end.

The US was having some type of series of disasters (wildfires and smallish earthquakes, I think.) And there was this Fire Chief who went to England to get a reward and also get help from them. But while he was there, people in the US lined the streets and stuff with memorials. But, he wasn't dead. Just in England.

Then there was a break where I was in a huge grocery store buying stuff, but instead of a normal set-up, the produce was along the wall in the back right corner. The bathrooms were back there, too. Then there were 2 of those low stand-alone freezers in the aisle with the frozen food specials, and then on the wall (after the freezers, though) it transitioned into a full frozen section, starting with ice cream. I remember seeing Strawberry Chocolate Chip ice cream (that should be a thing.) And, they had a TV up in the corner with the news on.

Anyway there was this really nice tall old guy in the grocery store, and he was talking to his wife about the memorials and fire chief and stuff. He was kinda wierd, but I liked him.

So then the Queen decided she wanted to come to America for whatever reason, but instead of taking her own plane, she was going to fly a different airline. She was trying to figure out which when there was some kind of red carpet fundraiser event (still in England) for the fires. She saw Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, and decided that he was a ruffian, and she didn't want to talk to him.

But, then Mike Tyson just walks up and starts talking to her in his Mike Tyson way. But she decides he's okay, and they talk for a while. Then Mike Tyson decides he's going to be the one to show her around the US, and SHE AGREES. They were still at the Gala when I woke up, though.

I had to leave my home because of the rioting - I‚Äôm fortunate to have family in the boonies - and obviously I‚Äôm not fond of it, but I think it was inevitable.

This is probably a weird stance, but humans are basically fucked up wild animals who lived by the motto ‚Äúeat fruit sling poop‚Äù for millions of years before deciding to have complex language and social norms. But we haven‚Äôt gotten away from it. Anyone who works with animals will tell you when they‚Äôre miserable and scared and cooped up they behave in erratic, bizarre ways, often dangerous to them. Now everyone‚Äôs been cooped up for months because of COVID and everyone is miserable and scared for about a zillion reasons, so it‚Äôs just unavoidable. Not everyone has that particular personality trait, but a lot of people do. If you‚Äôve never been truly desperate you don‚Äôt know if you‚Äôd feel that way too. 

That doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs good, but you‚Äôre never going to convince the entire population not to riot, just like you‚Äôll never convince them to form an anarchocommunist/anarchocapitalist utopia. You can only make a world where people don‚Äôt want to riot very much, and do what you can to support people who are hurt by riots. There are funds being put together by community members to help people who are losing their homes and businesses, which will do a lot more to help than making memes on Reddit and Twitter. (I‚Äôve donated the spare money from my paycheck.)

And that‚Äôs ignoring the problem of people coming in from other parts of the state and to a lesser extent out of state (MPR pulled arrest records for Friday and found only half of people arrested in Minneapolis were from Minneapolis). Which just makes things worse.', 'Autism hadn‚Äôt been recognized as a distinct condition - the word was in use, but it was more like catatonia in the severely schizophrenic, unlike how we use it today. Different living conditions meant that many symptoms were less in play than they were now, and children were held to lower developmental and intellectual standards, so less disabling cases of autism were not considered notable; more disabling cases were grouped together with every other more disabling developmental condition.

Generally there was more trust in the medical establishment back then too... or at least, mass scale vaccination efforts were much more successful in their early days. I think people were more in tune with the consequences of disease back then.']

["It took my family members 5 years to immigrate from the UK to Canada back in the 1980s and 2000s WITH family sponsorship.

It is a very long process.

Do you have any work experience in a trade? Or medical field or accounting? If so, you may be eligible to apply for skilled worker.

<LINK>

If not, you would have to try the provincial nominee program. They only allow a few people to apply per month. You're young, and speak English, and write English, so that gives you some points. 

Ontario isn't terrible, it just isn't as fantastic as people think. 

Yes, they cover the surgery, but not the added extras. For example, they Will remove my breasts, but won't cover the surgeon to make it look like a male chest. Plus travel costs, hotel stay if needed, pain meds, loss of income from work.", 'Everyone has their own style.

Bright coloured hair usually makes me think female. (When not in a punk hairstyle). So your hair reads female to me.

Beanies usually read male to me. But being pick I think it evens out.

Chest definitely female.

Your face reads more masculine. If in your style maybe some make up? 

Overall I would say more androgynous', "Does it have to be from that website? 
Amazon let's you ship to a post office or otther pick up locations.", 'Hello, fellow autistic here.

I didn't understand gender and sex until I was a lot older than I should. (I blame that partially on the autism, and partially on poor education system)

Gender is hard to explain, it's what's between your ears, while sex is what's  between your legs.

Being called a girl didn't feel right. But when someone "mistakenly" called me a boy, it felt right.

Like you know when you're out in public and tense and uncomfortable? Then you go home to your room and relax. You feel safe and peaceful. 

Being called the right gender is like being at home (as another comment said)

I can't speak for cis people or non binary people, (or really other trans people either), but it just feels right. 

Or what if people started calling you a dog instead of a person. You would say no, I'm a person. But they call you a dog and make you wear a collar and eat from a bowl. Society thinks you're supposed to be a dog and treats you as such. But in your head you know you're a person. 



Don't know if this helps any.']

['Disclaimer: 

This specific stitch is the non-binary flag. I understand the confusion between the ace/enby colors thanks to the filter. Thankfully I‚Äôm an enby ace, so it works out! 

Hello all my fellow enby and/or ace stitchers!', 'I got kicked from a FB group for disagreeing that we could ‚Äústeal‚Äù the initialism nb (non-binary) from POC who use nb (non-black). Can any other POC enbies weigh in? 
 I just think it‚Äôs a little silly to claim that <ITALIC> only POC are allowed to use the letters nb. 

Someone else brought up the idea of ED meaning both Eating Disorder and Erectile Dysfunction. It‚Äôs just how acronyms (in this case an initialism) work.

You take the first letters of a string of words to shorten it so you don‚Äôt have to say the whole string of words every time. Sometimes those words are going to overlap with other ones that share the same initials. That doesn‚Äôt mean one community is stealing it from another. 

Thoughts? Any other POC want to chip in? Am I just being unreasonable here? Is this just another way to cause drama between minority groups??', 'The dreaded ‚Äúwell, what do we call you?‚Äù question. (POSITIVE :D) 
 So, when I came out to my brothers, one of the only questions was, ‚Äúso, what does [niece] call you?‚Äù At the time, she was barely talking yet, so it didn‚Äôt seem like a pressing problem. I suggested she call me Mimi. My youngest sibling called me Mimi growing up, as a simplified version of my birth name, but I adore it as a title. So my brother agreed I would be Mimi Parker to my niece. 

That was the last I heard about it until this past Friday. I don‚Äôt get to see my niece very often, and when I do she‚Äôs usually a little shy. I assumed she hadn‚Äôt quite taken to me due to the lack of social time we‚Äôve had together (and she‚Äôs only 2 next month. We haven‚Äôt built a strong relationship yet due to that + the already mentioned lack of time together). I honestly didn‚Äôt even think she knew me well enough yet to associate me with a name/title.

Then, I saw her and my brother on Friday. And she called me Mimi out of the blue! I just about died. I‚Äôm officially Mimi, and she‚Äôll tell me ‚Äúhi, Mimi,‚Äù and ‚Äúbye, mimi!‚Äù And gods it‚Äôs just so adorable. 

Just wanted to share, and hey, do any of y‚Äôall have other titles than auntie/uncle/etc.?', 'I stole a flannel my boyfriend has never even worn. It‚Äôs mine now, bi-atch üòà', 'Thank you so much for all your kind words and advice! I‚Äôve had ultrasounds done, though never on this particular area. 

The needle sounds like the scariest part. I hate needles. But I can handle it, if it means finding out for sure what‚Äôs wrong. Thanks again, it helps knowing others have been through it too.']

["Moving around in LD but also not paralyzed? 
 I can move around in my dream and it certainly feels absolutely real. However there's always this other level, where if I knew I had to, I could open my real eyes and just get up.

I've definitely experienced sleep paralysis before so I know it's a thing with me. Over the past few years I've been focusing on how to get out of sleep paralysis so I don't experience anything scary. Lately if I ever get the feeling I will use it to start an LD.

Anyways, just curious if anyone else seems to not be paralyzed but still be able to move freely in some thrid-eye way in their LDs", 'If they want the public to think it is Melania, theyd probably ask her to look miserable', 'Observation: Vibrations is Qi 
 You know when you sit really still, even while awake, sometimes if you sit super still for a couple seconds, a wave of energy passes over your whole body. I'm not sure what this energy or feeling is, but my best guess is Qi.

When I've been able to induce and LD and vibrations begin, I realized I was doing the same thing that I do when trying to feel this "rush" of energy while awake.

If I'm too awake and try to induce an LD, I feel the energy wash over me, and see some minimal flashing visuals in my vision. But if I'm at just the right point to fall into an LD, the vibrations will begin, get stronger, and slowly transition into an LD.', 'I imagine you have to "unwind" it right? Is there a way to add a stop so you can just spin it backwards really fast to make keep it from going negative? Or...can you incorporate the spring from a tape measure and rewind it automatically??']

["Just because I have relationship issues (hence why I'm on this sub and in therapy and try my best) doesn't mean I'm a bad person. In fact, I'm a good person and a really good girlfriend too. I am actively trying to seek support.", 'I am a woman who never writes a female protagonist, is this wrong? 
 I'm a woman/female. I for some reason can't write as a female protagonist. Every story I've written has had a male protagonist. It feels natural to write in that voice. I strongly believe that females/males don't have inherently different writing styles -- gender norms most likely have an influence, though.

However, I've been told that my writing style is more "male"... and maybe this is why? I hope it's not underlying misogyny that I can't write female protagonists. Every time I try to I just don't feel connected and I feel bad about it. I'm trying to force myself but I don't feel excited. I also tend to write in a very dry, satirical, non-poetic voice. I'm pretty bad at imagery. I don't know if that has something to do with it (back to the gender norms of writing thing)?

TLDR; Is it wrong that I never write in the female voice? Anyone else?', 'I think sometimes we try to recreate the trauma that happens to us to take power. idk.', 'Thanks, I have now established with him that he and I are gonna talk about why this is a hard time of year for me, so hopefully we do']

['But wait. I need to see the rest get fed.', "Overwhelmed by vet bills 
 Today I had to take my cat to the emergency vet because of what I thought was respiratory distress, and turned out to be pancreatitis. The bill ended up being 200 more than the initial estimate because of the change in diagnosis. This left me with 850 dollars I have to pay (probably more, because he needs to go to his regular vet on Monday).

This also comes on the heels of losing my other cat last month to renal failure. 

Currently, I have only a very part time job (one day a week), and I'm trying to get other work, but it's not going well. 

I was able to pay the last round of vet bills thanks to some very wonderful friends, but as this is happening so soon after that loss, I don't have hope that they'd be able to come through like that again. 

I can provide proof of the vet bills if needed. 

Thank you.

Edit: I wanted to edit to add a bit more info on the cat health, because I know it sounds a bit weird. They're both senior cats, she was 15, and it was acute renal failure. The vet process I went through with her got me two more months before she just couldn't do it anymore. He's 14 1/2, and this just started happening in the last couple of days. I'm told that it looks like with the meds, he could bounce back. 

I'm willing to answer any other questions.

Thank you again, for taking the time to read.

Edit 2: 375 of this has been covered.", 'LOOK HOW SAD THIS HUMAN IS. THE SADNESS OF THIS FELLOW HUMAN ENGAGES MY EMPATHY UPGRADE CHIP, MAKING ME FEEL ALSO SAD. SHE IS BEAUTIFUL. HE SHOULD CALL HER.', 'Your thoughts are most welcome, and I am honoured for the offerings.']

['Is transition that hard on parents 
 I don't mean to sound selfish but it seems that parents take their kids transition WAY too harsh. I mean yeah I guess your "losing" a son/daughter but you still have a kid like damn lol. Idk it just seems that some parents over-react and act like we're dying and never coming back. 

One classic line they say is "it's just so hard to accept that the baby girl/boy you gave birth to isn't gonna be here anymore". Like well yeah but would you rather have me miserable and bitter for the rest of my life?. It just seems a little selfish to me that's all. Anyone else feel this way?', 'Agreed, but then there's straight cis couples that break up alot for the sole reason of 1 partner wants to start a family and have kids and one doesn't. Regardless if biologically their able to, just the overall choice. So there's that to consider. But that was just an option I threw out there. I do still believe the majority of the general population if their not completely hostile-y transphobic. They approach trans people as "Ok you can do whatever you want to your body and by law I have to call you he/she or else I'll get fired or sued, but your still Man/Woman to me regardless of what you look like or how many surgeries you get. I know its impossible to regulate thought but its still hurts.', 'You know I'm right. You choosing to dismiss the claims you made of the guy just shows you being dishonest and untruthful. And I'm always more than happy to have a civil conversation with someone about a topic/opinion, especially a trans topic. I had a conversation with a NB person about a month or 2 ago about if NB exists or not. I said no they said yes obviously but we were both respectful of each others opinions and we ended up agreeing to disagree. But you were disrespectful and rude, therefore you not being worthy of that civil and respectable conversation. And again, you playing the victim of "<SUBREDDIT> are totalitarians and can't handle someone with a different opinion than theirs" is a bunch of baloney.', "Just some friendly advice from your favorite Hard-left liberals: Don't forget to know your genders!"]

['Typed up a coming out letter to my mom, any feedback? I plan to give it to her after the new year (not the whole letter, just an excerpt)', "I don't go to pride mostly because its so much at once. I'm ok with wearing some rainbow socks and chilling at the gay bar.", "CMV: Most of Tyler Perry's movies and tv shows are predictable and tasteless. 
 Tyler Perry is a director/writer/actor and all those things. He's made famous movies like the Madea movies (Madea goes to jail, Diary of a mad black woman etc.) And tv shows on the OWN network like (The Haves and the Have not's, If Loving You is Wrong). He is a multi-threat I'll give him that most definitely. But I find all his movies, stageplays and tv shows are basically the same. The plot is always either Infidelity, Affair, Murder, Unwanted/Unexpected pregnancy, Racism, Sexism, Financial problems, Gang-related, etc. After awhile they just get boring, predictable and not interesting to watch anymore. I know he aims for drama thats not it. I just feel like he needs to widen the plot and maybe dial back a bit on the stereotypical hardships. I don't absolutly hate him, but I do feel if he's able to buy a 330 acre movie studio lot, hes able to either hire better writers, or write better himself.

Edit: I WANT to like his work, but its just hard to because of the tasteless stereotypical plotlines", "(I'm speaking on for the U.S. since that's where I live)

I'd take a ton of funding from the military and the space exploration program and I'd also start taxing major Religious institutions like Mega-churches and such. ["Anyone know any feminine clothes that a guy who wants to go MtF can wear without being super duper obvious? 
 Sorry if the title is discombobulated, I didn't know how to word it XD. I just want some low-key feminine clothes that I can wear as a guy with broad shoulders and masculine features that will allow me to get more and more used to feminine clothes. Thanks!", "I need advice. 
 So I've already posted in <SUBREDDIT> but I wanted to see what people thought on here. I'm 17 and I don't know what to do. When I was 11 or 12 I somehow found crossdressing. Ever since then, I've felt like I just don't belong as a male. I've played football, I do track, I work out all the time in an effort to be masculine, but in the end I always feel like I just don't belong. I've had the thought of being female for the past 4-5 years, but only in this past year has it really gotten serious. My parents have discovered me crossdressing multiple times since I was 12, and every time they ask me if I'm gay, to which I reply no (even though I do wanna try taking a dick) and if I want to be female, to which I also reply no. My parents are extreme Christians and I don't know what they'd do if they found out I wanted to be female. I've been buying pink clothes and accessories in order to feel more feminine, but in the end I always feel uncomfortable in my male body. I used to be able to crossdress, but now that I've hit puberty and have a blocky masculine body I can't do it anymore. I'm trying to wait until college to actually do anything but the pull in my head is getting really bad. Can anyone give me some advice?

Sorry for the long ass paragraph I didn't expect it to be that long :/", 'ikr? I picked them up while I was shopping bc I really wanted a pair of Air Maxes. My bf (21) and I (20) had been seeing each other for a month when we were sent home due to COVID-19. I don't have a great home life and I struggle with depression and anxiety. We've been dating LD for 2.5 months now.

My best advice is to make plans, and keep them. Plan to visit each other and work out all the details. My bf and I and going camping and we are meeting at a site in the middle, a 2.5 hour drive for each of us. We also do our best to send texts to each other throughout the day. Even if it's just 5 or 6 texts, it makes a big difference. We also hop on a zoom call together once or twice a week. 

I'm sure he is just as upset/sad/annoyed as you are about the pandemic. I know my bf is. Communication is very important when you are in a LDR. It can also be really difficult. Just remember why you are doing this in the first place :)"]

['I basically just said "hey, do you have any advice for someone who wants to come out?" and let the assumptions carry it from there =p', 'You'd be protecting future trans people from ending up being hurt by his inappropriate "care".  We already have to deal with so much societal invalidation, we don't need someone we are supposed to be able to be vulnerable in front of attacking us in that moment.

Simply reporting exactly what he is doing is good enough.  You don't need to make any requests for him to get fired or anything like that.  He has the ethical responsibility to give proper care, and he isn't.  It's the licensing board that acts on it, not you.  If he wants to have a job doing this, he should be doing the right thing and helping people, not actively hurting them.

I'm a bit worked up, bad therapists just really make me upset.  Mine is phenomenal, and she has helped me so much and I want everyone to have that experience.', "The highway chase is all the action a movie needs. It's fantastic.

The first movie is a masterpiece. Second and third both have great moments, but I feel like they drag in parts and introduce some unnecessary b-plots.  I think they would have benefited from being cut down to a single 2.5 hour runtime sequel (same runtime as the original) instead if dragging it out into 3 movies.", 'Maybe try ordering your panties online?  I've never felt super comfortable buying <ITALIC> any undergarments in public, even just buying boxers as a boy.

As for other clothes, I don't think you will get a second thought.  Everyone will assume you are buying a gift for your gf if you are presenting male.

Being able to actually try on womens clothes is another leap of faith.  I've only done it while presenting full female (I'm still completely pre transition, so I don't think I pass if anyone sees my face), but I live in a very accepting city so people usually gave me a "good for you" smile.  It still made me super shy and I didn't know how to react, but it was nice to feel safe.

You could also try doing something like a clothes subscription box to get female clothes to try on in private if you aren't comfortable doing it in public yet.

It may also be worth going to stores that are generally worked by younger staff if you area isn't as accepting.  The younger generation tends to be more accepting even if your area as a whole isn't.']

['OP, I‚Äôm glad you‚Äôve come to terms with your sexuality. Congratulations. My first question is, who have you come out to? Any family, or just your friends?

Back in the 8th grade I was having a major identity crisis and I was not sure if I was bi because I though girls were pretty and I was jealous when they had boyfriends. See I wasn‚Äôt scared that I would be labeled as liking girls but more that guys wouldn‚Äôt date me because they thought I was only into girls. Eventually I decided I was bi. 

It is now my senior year of high school and I still have not dated a girl or done anything with a girl (if you know what I mean) besides quick kisses, and although that may be the case I still identify as bi because girls are still attractive to me.

['Being referred to as "them" instead of "he/him" 
 I came out recently at work.

One co-worker is referring to me as "them" or "they", etc. 

It's annoying to me because I'm a binary trans man. He/him.

Everyone else is using he/him with the occassional slip up. (It's new to everyone, so it'll take a bit to get used to it)

Do you think she'll eventually switch over, or how long should I wait until I say something?

We have a history, so part of me is wondering if this is her way of "complying" without "complying".  Or if she's genuinely getting used to it still.', "Those who have been disowned or no contact with family; how do you handle holidays? 
 Christmas is coming, and it's bringing a sense of dread as it's my last one with my family.

I was told if I insist on transitioning I won't be allowed to attend any family events. 

I have a massive family, and every holiday brings days of dinners and activities.

It's going to be hard. But not being me will be harder. 

How do you handle your holidays?", "Not sure if this helps any, but androderm patches cost $90 without insurance in my area of Ontario, not sure if it's the same throughout the province.

Once the gender specialist approved, my family doctor prescribed my T with no issues.

I'm also aware that planned parenthood subscribes T with informed consent. And there are some LGBT health places in cities that help as well. (No personal experiences with them)", "I just switched to gel after having allergic reactions to the patches (the adhesive decided to hate me after 4 months little issues)

I have bad eczema and super sensitive skin.

So far (it's been less than a week), no issues. 

I find it dries my skin out. What I've been doing is apply the gel at night, and then in the morning put mosturizing cream on.

But no rash or flare ups like that patch gave me."]

I'm not ready to put myself in any way, shape or form", 'Having those thoughts is normal. To feel resentment is natural when you\'ve been hurt a lot. I feel it too towards my bullies and I\'m obviously not proud of it, but I\'ve accepted that they may even deserve it. I know you\'ve been taught (as we all were) to feel like "family is family" and all that crap, but a person who has done harm to you on purpose doesn\'t deserve your love or unconditional respect. You are more than probably a beautiful, loving and caring person whose depression and external negative reinforcement has had an impact on day to day behaviour and thinking, but you have to remember that depression, bullying and other bad things that may have happened to you doesn\'t define you. So don\'t think you\'re turning into a worse version of yourself, because the moment you can say you feel happy and accept yourself, that day you\'ll see who you really are to the fullest. ["Hmm...

Thanks. This gives me inspiration for my ideas. I'll try to make them all useful in standard mode", 'What two-handed weapon, do you think, would be the most powerful, if it was wielded in just your right hand? 
 Transformed Whirligig Saw? Holy Moonlight Sword? Hunter Axe?

If you like, you can make up your own movesets for each one handed transformed weapon.', 'Death is a far better motivator than any politician on the TV screen. 
 It takes the Ioss of your Ioved ones to make you reaIise the true severity of Covid-19, and actuaIIy take this virus seriousIy.

It's just some shitty virus, nothing's gonna happen to him! It's not like he's gonna go to hospital one day and end up 6 feet under the next, is he? Stop worrying so bloody much."

Do the ones closest to you really have to lose their lives just so you'll understand? Or is that still not enough for you to change your ways?', "Think of any weapon in the game. What would you change about that weapon? 
 It can be anything, from the appearance, the moveset, the damage and scalings, blood gem types, etc. Let your inner creative beast out! 

I would give the Beastcutter a new move where, when it was transformed, you could lash an enemy with it, hook onto their face/chest, and pull them very quickly towards you. They'd fall flat on their face, allowing you to pelt them with attacks while they're down. This would be for small enemies though, like Yharnamites, Hunters, crows or small beasts (like the ones in Old Yharnam that are afraid of fire) 


If they were larger, heavier enemies, like the Church Giants, gigantic beast bosses like Vicar Amelia or Great Ones like Ebrietas, then you could lock onto a specific bodypart, launch the hook at that part and fly towards it. After landing onto it, you'd stay latched on while your stamina rapidly drained. Obviously the large monsters would be able to throw you off and launch you into the ground (doing some serious damage to your poor back).

Now, you would be able to do one of two things.

1. You leap off by pressing O (circle), and can press either R1 or R2 to do an aerial attack

2. You press L1 to untransform the Beastcutter; this turns it back to normal. Upon doing this, you slide back down, but drag the teeth across the Beast's flesh, dealing lots of damage as you descend further.


Basically, I want the Clutch Claw from Monster Hunter World, only less buggier and poorly designed. Beastcutter is in my 3 favourite weapons so this was my choice. Hunters Axe and the Whirligig Saw are too perfect to change.

Can't wait to see what you guys come up with :D"]

['Sounds Reasonable lol 
We are typically very chill people, we do our best to respect other people‚Äôs beliefs ((but there are bad apples in every bunch)) whether or not those beliefs are that deities do or do not exist.
Yeah we don‚Äôt have any ‚Äúreligious texts‚Äù to follow so we typically just try and do what feels right.', 'Cool survey! I‚Äôd love to see the results after it is completed.', '<QUOTE>

I didn‚Äôt, I‚Äôm going to edit my original post to clarify that the quotes were meant to be like ‚Äúair-quotes‚Äù as in here is an exaggerated example of the basic ideas of the comments I saw, this is just how I tend to write things and I didn‚Äôt even realize people may think that was supposed to be an actual quote. 

<QUOTE>

Okay so, many pagan faiths, and by that I mean the VAST majority of pagans do not sacrifice living things. That wasn‚Äôt nearly common as most people are lead to believe it is. A lot of the accounts of this Either come from christian propaganda that we were evil (this helped the crusaders to be supported)
Some wrote about how the Druids were ‚Äúcannibals‚Äù others told tall tales that they would ‚Äústuff people into a large brass figure of a man and light it on fire for their demon gods.‚Äù And other dramatic bs like that. (There is no archeological evidence that any of the druids were cannibals or that this freaky statue thing ever even existed.) 
One of the main principles of modern paganism  is a respect for the lives of all kinds of beings.

["Thank you So much for the links!

Assuming you have a car you might also be able to review resources (plenty on YouTube) on how to live in a car (it's actually pretty doable).

That has crossed my mind of a possibility.

Thank you again, your a Sweetheart!", "Why is there so many classifications of gender identity? 
 I'm curious why so many? There's probably more that's not on this list.   

<HEADING>  Agender 

Not having a gender or identifying with a gender. They may describe themselves as being gender neutral or genderless.  

<HEADING>  Bigender 

A person who fluctuates between traditionally ‚Äúmale‚Äù and ‚Äúfemale‚Äù gender-based behaviours and identities. 

<HEADING>  Cisgender 

A person whose gender identity and biological sex assigned at birth are the same. For\xa0example\xa0they were born biologically as a male, and express their gender as male.  

<HEADING>  Gender Expression

The external display of one‚Äôs gender, through a combination of how they dress, how they act and other factors, generally measured on scales of masculinity and femininity. 

<HEADING>  Gender Fluid

A mix of boy and girl. A person who is gender fluid may always feel like a mix of the two traditional genders, but may feel more man some days, and more woman other days. 

<HEADING>  Genderqueer

A gender identity label often used by people who do not identify with being a man or a woman, or as an umbrella term for many gender non-conforming or non-binary identities. 

<HEADING>  Intersex

A person born with a reproductive or sexual anatomy that doesn‚Äôt seem to fit the typical definitions of female or male. For example, a person might be born appearing to be female on the\xa0outside, but\xa0having mostly male-typical anatomy on the inside. 

<HEADING>  Gender Variant

Someone\xa0who either by nature or by choice does not conform to gender-based expectations of society  

<HEADING>  Mx.

Is a title (e.g. Mr., Ms., etc.) that is gender neutral. Pronounced miks, (similar to\xa0Ms) it is often the option of choice for folks who do not identify as cisgender. 

<HEADING>  Third Gender

A term for a person who does not identify with either man or woman, but identifies with another gender. This gender category is used by societies that recognise three or more genders,\xa0both contemporary and historic, and is also a conceptual term meaning different things to different people who use it. 

<HEADING>  Transgender

A person who lives as a member of a gender other than that expected based on sex assigned at birth. 

<HEADING>  Two-Spirit

Is\xa0an umbrella term traditionally used by Native American people to recognise individuals who possess qualities of both genders 

<HEADING>  Ze /\xa0Hir 

Alternate pronouns that are gender neutral. Pronounced /zee/ and /here/ they replace ‚Äúhe‚Äù and ‚Äúshe‚Äù and ‚Äúhis‚Äù and ‚Äúhers‚Äù respectively. Alternatively\xa0some people who are not comfortable/do not embrace he/she use the plural pronoun ‚Äúthey/their‚Äù as a gender neutral singular pronoun.", "Relocation? 
 Has anyone relocated from their community to protect their children form humiliation of their transgender parent?

I come from a very small community, I've lived here for many years and know a lot of people. This town frowns on transgender people, there are none here that I know of.

My therapist and doctor both said that It would be difficult for me to live here. I am more worried about the pain that I could cause my children then I am myself, I can live anywhere and still be happy just being me...

Just wondering if anyone else has had to deal with this, or if anyone has thoughts on this? Thank you, Hugs.", "Name Question... 
 I know it seem's like everyone ask's this question, but I'm older and just about ready to come out, and knowing there are very Loving members here I thought I'd ask

The two names I Love are: Lili and Daphne.

I like Lili because she sounds more like and adult name to me and a Beautiful name.. Also I was inspired by Lili Elbe's Life and wouldn't mine Honoring her name.

I like Daphne because she sounds innocent, loving, caring and I don't know of any one else named that, but also sounds like a younger person's name.

I Do love the both and might use one as a middle name.

Just asking if anyone has some input?

Hugs."]

["Welcome to the nb club! I would also try to SR, but since the Pok√©mon I want shiny are Absol, Shedinja, Ninetales, Noivern, Volcarona and Milotic, that isn't really an option for any of them. ["The simplest answers are usually the best ones. Thank you :)

Don't worry, I'm never going to stop fighting for LGBT rights, or correcting ignorant people. I've done that my entire life. 

Trans rights are human rights.", 'Much appreciated.

I only recently came out at work (HR delays caused delays in me coming out.) But there was speculation since I have some serious facial hair coming in LOL

A lot of these people I've known for over 5 years, so I know there will be a learning curve. But everyone (other than her) are trying. (She calls me Leee-aaa-um. And sometimes she, but mostly they. Never stumbles or corrects herself. And when I'm out of earshot refers to me as Leah, and she.)

All my other coworkers say "she, sorry he" or Leah, Liam, Liam" 
My personal favourite is "Leah, ah fuck, Liam" LOL

One of my co-workers was almost in tears because she kept messing up, and felt bad. (I told her it was okay, she was trying and that's all that matters.)

It's been just over a week, and there is slow progress. I know it'll take time.

It helps that there are some very vocal coworkers, who rarely mess up and push my name and pronouns whenever possible to get others used to them.', "Should I compromise on my name? 
 Looking for opinions here.

My parents would like me to change my name to something unisex to ease into transition. To make things easier for everyone.

I'm currently using Liam in certain circles. (Not changed legally)

But I would legally change it to the unisex name as soon as possible.

Anyone else ever done this?

I haven't really looked for unisex names.

It could be a positive because this way my parents are involved and not just me, so the name would have more meaning.", "Thanks for your reply!

I was thinking placebo as I'm also more confident and feel calmer, but know that wouldn't happen in 30min LOL 

That's why I thought I'd ask around here, as I didn't think there was anyway it would be this fast."]

['What are some of your favourite outfits for the villagers? 
 Got any specific outfits that you think just fit the animal really perfect? I would like to get some ideas for some of my villagers and thought some of you might have good ideas out here!!

Thanks in advance for any ideas!', 'I really love swimming too. 
At the beginning of grade 11, we could choose our sport course and i picked swimming. I thought to myself "I love it so much and i rarely get to do it, and i won't come out or transition before leaving school, so that won't make any problems."
Little did i know that my dysphoria would worsen this much. Now i'm stuck in a weekly class with 3 girls and 12 boys, feeling absolutely horrible. I take every chance i have to skip P.E. and swimming nowadays, it's sad. But when i don't, i begin to panic and have to pay attention to not lose my shit. 
I'd much rather had picked something else. Occasionally going swimming would have brought me more joy, even though i'm so dysphoric. It would have been choice, now i have to.

One and a half year until school is over. Not sure if i'll be able to mentally manage swimming this long.', "But you don't have to have a full market box all the time, where did this idea come from? I sell stuff when i have too much of it, or felt like collecting lots of fruits to sell. I would get crazy if i'd make myself fill the market box at all times. We're not responsible for providing everything at all times for our friends and this sounds like people feel like they HAVE to provide a lot at all times. 

This isn't supposed to be attacking, i just don't get it. It's nice to sell stuff for friends but who cares about whether or not you sell stuff at all times? It's useful, but you shouldn't think less of someone as a player when they don't sell lots of stuff all the time. ["I can see your points - maybe I'm a little harsh on Sardines, maybe I ranked Referee too highly... BUT... I did say I'd die on this hill so I cannot change a thing now :P  


In Sphinx, there just weren't any guest stars that I was excited to see on screen. That said, I have weighted the scores such that it doesn't impact the overall score too much because, of all the categories, guest star is the least important for me...", "Can't see Gove doing well enough with the general public. The other two are unknown to public at large and so stand a better chance.", "When coming up with my categories (and tbh they are that - they're categories which affect my enjoyment of the show) I came up with ones which could positively or negatively impact an episode.  
I completely agree with what you say about Death Be Not Proud, which is why it didn't score highly for guest stars, despite its big name actress. That said, Guest Stars mean the least to me in comparison to other categories.  
Humour and a Surprise are integral to the show though, so I'd definitely rate them higher than Guest Stars", "I'm in favour of socialised essentials (healthcare, police, fire service, education) and I would add to that list of essentials that we currently socialise here in the UK some further ones (public transport, postal service, basic utilities and broadband).
As for food, the most basic essential, I'd definitely be up for a basic provision of food being available to everyone, but I reckon that UBI is probably a better way of achieving that - that certainly does put power back into people's hands rather than the gov.

When it comes to non essential items, or luxuries, I'm very happy for the free market to do its thing - competition and innovation and all the wonderful things that gave us the world we have today. But when the free market is allowed to play fast and loose with people's basic needs - when commuting to work costs an exorbitant amount, when companies make profit off of the sick and dying, or the sick and dying can't afford to get well without selling their house, when you can only get a decent education if your wallet is big enough, or when you can't afford broadband and therefore cannot apply for jobs because everything is done online these days... At that point I say you need a basic level of provision for all that isn't based on your ability to pay.

That's what socialism means to me and to the vast number of left wingers in the UK. We're not advocating for Venezuela or a state provided sofa bed and armchair. :)"]

["WWII: Germany's Invasion Of Poland Is Repelled, Italy's Invasion Of Greece Fails And Russia Looses The Winter War 
 There are alternate histories discussion for each of the Axis/ Soviet invasions ending differently. But what if they all happened together? 

The Finnish manages to hold out and make gains against a post purge, disorganized Soviet military. With soviet resources tied up with Finland, Poland's eastern border is secure, potentially leading to them repelling the German invasion from the west. With no German aid, this causes the Italians to fail hard in their attempt to take control of the Hellenic republic.  

In mid 1940, Russia calls for armistice and peace. Italy surrenders to Greece. Germany withdraws the invasion of Poland and prepares to defend the eastern borders. How does this change events moving forward? Would Germany still be strong enough to take France and the remainder territory it took OTL if the Polish invasion failed? 

How would a defeat effect the reputation of Stalin's new regime among the rest of the USSR? How is the legitimacy of the communist revolution effected after being beaten back by one country? Are plans still made to resume war with Finland and invade Poland? 

How bad would the loss effect Italy? Would they stay in the war? Would this spark upheaval and revolt even sooner? And how would the Axis and USSR be viewed after losses to such comparably weaker nations?", "Fluke. 

Story about a dog who realizes that he is the reincarnation of a man and goes on a journey to find the wife and child from his past life, while unraveling the events that lead to his death. Very moving film and one of the few that brought me the closest to tears. 

Just don't watch the trailer. Completely misleading.", 'Shake It Off by Tailor Swift and Perfect Drug by Nine Inch Nails', "Go figure that all these popular anthro characters are from shows that deal with some thought provoking and mature themes. Something this generation can attest to. 

Who would of thought that of all the things to grow up, it'd be shows featuring cartoon animals?"]

["Nope! I'm a fully modern in terms of my mindset, just big into vintage fashion", 'It's a pagan religion, we try to reconstruct the ancient religion of northern bronze age europe

Meaning we believe in 3 entities, you can choose if you believe in all of them, or just one, or 2, whatever you like, they are:
- the gods (norse like Odin, thor)
- your ancestors
- the house wights (basically like spirits that guard your house)

We pray by giving offerings, an offering can be anything that you worked on, food you made, flowers you picked, woodwork that you made, anything
We give offerings at an altar, which we make ourselves, it usually consists of a small table with stuff that represents who were praying to, pictures of ancestors, small statues of the gods etc.

Sadly it often gets associated with Nazis, because a while ago some people hijacked the religion because.... northern europe, ancestor worship... you know

But real Heathens are not racist, and not Nazis, heck you dont even need to be European to believe in it, just like I could be muslim even if I'm white.

Contrary to other pagan religions, like Wicca, most heathens dont believe in "magick" but only the power of prayer (some people, not many, also pray to the runes, which sometimes gets compared to magick, but it's also just through the power of prayer kind of stuff), most Heathens also dont believe in new-age energy stuff, like magic crystals and healing power and that sort of stuff', 'AITA for ending a friendship when "I should know that he overreacts sometimes" ? 
 So I (f, 20) had a bad fight with my (now ex) best friend (m, 20).

It essentially boils down to him saying that I was studying wrong, and trying to force me to change what I was doing, I said no, we didnt speak for a few weeks and then he sent me a LONG message (it took 45 minutes to read it to someone) where he was essentially insulting me without being obvious that they're insults. I ghosted him after that.

 (example: "I can still come over and help you study so that you'll atleast pass" and "I know you've lost someone important and now you're confused" I havent lost anyone though, so he probabaly means himself) 

Anyway, now I talked to an old friend of mine and want to reconnect with him, we talked and had fun and then we talked about the fight, he is still friends with my ex best friend and he said something like "you know that he sends these messages when hes upset, that's just him, he overreacts, why havent you responded and forgiven him? You know he always does that it's just in the heat of the moment" my answer was "cause when someone thinks about me like that, that I'm stupid and that I NEED their help to pass, essentially looking down on me, I dont want them in my life, and that he thinks about me like that was clear after that message."

He just responded with "yeah, after all this time I forget that you were a bit "socially weird" (english isn't my first language and this sentence is hard to translate, it meant that I'm awkward, and dont know how to act in certain situations)


But now I'm wondering... maybe I should've forgiven him, cause I know he tends to act out and send these long texts (the friend I reconnected with has gotten multiple of those in the past too), but I was also really offended.

I made multiple AITAs about this before for example if it was okay for me to ghost him, for more in depth stuff about what he said specifically, look at those.

Thank you.', 'I speak german and english fluently/very well and very very very very shitty spanish lol, just had it for like 3 years in school 

I live in North Rhine-Westphalia (NRW)']

['Hopefully

Who do you want to see as Bond next?', 'People asked for a transform version of the card I used to come out, so I made a different version', "Hey, can I have some help? 
 I'm Aria, (14, AMAB) and I'm really confused about gender and stuff (Probably MtF). My parents think that trans stuff is just a phase but they don't know enough. I'm really stressed out about this and would love some help.




Thanks", "This Is Me 
 My name is Cullan. I am constantly pressured by society to conform. That's the thing I hate. We always have to do this, or do that, or go here, or learn that. We're told we have to be a certain way, that if we aren't, we aren't enough, that we aren't worth anything. This view is toxic. It drives home the point that you are just supposed to be normal, to fit in.\xa0  
What if you don't?\xa0  
You are persecuted for being who you are, for expressing yourself. You can't find a place. So instead, you try to compensate. You try to hide. You put yourself through endless agonies because you are afraid of what will happen. You torment yourself with visions of what you want and what you need. You can't understand who or what you are.\xa0  
There are voices in the back of our heads. You know of your conscience. You've heard it reprimand you for your morally incorrect actions. There's another. It's the voice of that part of your mind. The part that you try not to listen to but it creeps into your darkest dreams and deepest slumbers. It's your doubts. We all have doubts. They keep us centered and grounded. But the doubt that this is is much deeper. It holds down your worst fears and makes them real. You dream of what you want, and then it ends. Your doubt and your hatred creep in to fill its place. It's an impossibility, they say. It can't be done. You're just lying to yourself.\xa0  
We float alone on an island, unanchored in the ocean of our sorrow and desperation. We live for the simple things. The quiet reassurance of a friend, the mere touch of a partner, fearing that we will lose everything if we let our guard down.  
We can never truly relax. We know that horrible things can and will happen if we slip up in our facade for even one moment.

I can't live with that constant fear anymore. I won't let this run me down any longer. I refuse to accept this driving force.\xa0  
I am Aria. I am a girl. I am 14.\xa0  
Screw the consequences. I just don't care anymore."]
