['Hey buddy, seems like you‚Äôre in a really rough place at the moment. Wanna chat about it? Feel free to send me a dm <3', 'I dyed it dark purple before (using manic panic ) and it really didn‚Äôt suit me. I‚Äôm contemplating bleaching my hair first and then going for lighter/brighter colours, perhaps violet?', 'You‚Äôre 36???!! Wow. I would have said mid/late 20‚Äôs. Which is especially impressive after having 4 children! Hopefully I‚Äôll look as glowing as you after having kids.
Yes. You‚Äôre super pretty :)', 'Let me clarify. 

For as long as I can remember I have been incredibly anxious. As a child I would be terrified to leave the house and would self harm before I even know what it was (ripping out my hair, starving myself etc). 
My father was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer when I was 11 and because of this I started having counselling through Dove House Hospice. 
When I was 13 I became actively suicidal. My self harming became more serious, as I began using razor blades (on my thighs and feet- so don‚Äôt worry most honorable <USER> nothing attention seeking- god forbid). 
When my father passed in 2016, I was ruined. I stopped functioning. I stopped feeling. 
And you know what? I didn‚Äôt tell anybody. 
My therapists knew, my doctors knew, and that was it. 
My most of my friends didn‚Äôt even know that my dad had died, let alone I was planning on doing so too. 
I kept it too myself, I didn‚Äôt want to tell others because of the incredibly toxic ideas you‚Äôre perpetuating that if you share your troubles, you‚Äôre just doing it for attention. 

I believed that, and it almost killed me. 

Now I‚Äôm not sure about you, but I don‚Äôt care about meaningless internet points. But I do care about people. And I wanted to help- even just one person- have hope. 

The reason I have photos of me crying is not for karma whoring or attention seeking. As you will see. It‚Äôs been in my camera roll for over 10 months before I posted it- what‚Äôs the point in that? 

You see, my doubtful internet friend, that I would use photographs as a sort of self improvement journey. And I recommend it to everyone really. I was too depressed to write but my therapists wanted me to write down how I felt. I couldn‚Äôt. But it took a lot less thought to just snap a quick picture. 

I have endless photos like this, that show my slow progression into betterment. And before I deleted them, I thought hey, why not show some people that might need it? 

Plus its a huge achievement. I‚Äôm proud of myself. I‚Äôm happy. 

Are you?']

["Thanks! I'm definitely happy with the results of the weight I did lose. The month by month of my first 6 months can be seen here, including my starting point about a month before I actually started taking HRT: <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>", "This is somebody's fetish.
.
.
.
.
.
That somebody is me. This is my fetish.", 'I always knew I was "different," but I didn't legitimately start questioning my gender until an month before my 30th birthday. 

Here's the thing: if you were born in the 80s/early 90s like you and me (I was born in late 86), we still weren't at a place culturally where trans folx were taken seriously. Media representation of trans folx was still either a gross joke or a villainized psycho. We were JUST starting to see gay cisgender people on TV (Will and Grace, Ellen, etc.) and even that was controversial.

I'm not saying that queer people don't still experience discrimination and hate. I'm not saying that everyone in the US understands (or wants to understand) what being trans is, let alone all of the nonbinary trans identities. However, there's no denying that the way we talk about gender now, and really for the past 5-10 years, feels lightyears away from the 80s and 90s, which is when people who are in their 30s now were entering adolescence/early teen years. 

It seems easy to say in retrospect, but I've always said that had I been born 10 or even 5 years later, I would have come out so much sooner.', 'I love my budding bosom (33 years old, 6.5 months HRT)']

['Epilator 4 The Win! 
 I think I posted here before asking about epilators and finally got one. Its cheap but its sooo worth it. To all those wondering what it is and if it hurts: Its a device that acts like a high speed pair of tweezers so it works by rapidly pulling the hair out. It does hurt but its like razor burn with bee stings thrown in, it is a slow (like really slow) way of removing hair and only removes a small strip at a time. "But wait that sounds like it sucks! I'll just stick to shaving" you say? Well there is a couple of huge benefits  here especially if your early HRT or pre HRT and look like a wookie. When you finish up with it you will be the smoothest you have ever been, the pain goes away almost if not immediately after (like 5 min at most and i have chest hair that is only spaced about 1/8th of an inch apart), because the hair is being ripped out the effects stick around for days instead of hours, the hair comes back finer and without stubble, ingrowns are rare with skin scrub washes, and did I mention <ITALIC> smooooooth? I haven't done my entire chest yet because it is very slow (think snail crawl speed) but there isn't any real skin irritation. When I shaved I looked like I was having a bad allergic reaction. PSA out!', 'Same girl! I was using the wrong razor for this and really screwed my skin up. I just switched to a Gillette venus with the 5 blade extra smooth and sensitive skin blades and OMG!  So I tried shaving my chest a few times aaand It. Was. HORRIBLE! It was actually trying to ride up like underwear! I couldn't even enjoy my smoothness as I could see all the roots and feel them move as I move. I am basically a wookie hair wise. ['TIL: Euthymia is the psychological big word for a neutral mood.', 'Why I Chose Catholicism - from a former Evangelical 
 I just wrote a short love song for Catholicism for an obscure post in the bottom of AskReddit, and I thought I'd also share it here. The question was: "Why do you feel like your religion is right?"

As a former evangelical protestant who converted to being a Catholic over a ton of issues, there's a lot of things that make me very pleased with my choice. The fact that there is a massive amount of writing and history behind the vast majority of church ideas (No, "because, that's why" which I got all the time as a protestant) and many "rites" or varieties of worship, all with the same essential center point in Christ.

The fact that questions and dialogue were welcomed even on divisive matters, far more than I thought they would be, and that the average priest I encountered had acceptable and even profound answers, not to mention other devoted Catholics. There was an abundance of studied belief among devout practicing Catholics, not just blind acceptance.

I was pleased by the time and financial commitment to the social good so many Catholics have - a ton of devoted Catholics are in service and helping professions. The majority of us love science, rhetoric, and logic and use it in discussion, which often surprises people without a faith system who haven't met someone in a religious system that welcomes these things, though it's not as uncommon even in other religious systems as people with no religious background may have experienced. Devout Catholics take after Jewish people in their interest in discussions without easy answers.

The encouragement to care for the earth and each other and even ourselves with self-worth, and the acknowledgement that we are not naturally good.

Honestly, the list is pretty long.

All of these things suited me, but above all, I do believe in the God of the Bible, and that the Bible is an anthology of works that pertain to his acts and presence in the world, and the records of people in history that can help us today - and that there are thousands more saints throughout history whose record is added to that. If it were just the Bible, that would be one thing. But the record of many who like I do today, worshipped and strived to become the human they were created to be... That's inspiring. The Catholicism I chose makes me strive to be better, kinder, more aware of the needs and desires of others - not just Jesus. 

I had Jesus before Catholicism. He made me want to be better, but I didn't feel like I had a great path. Catholicism gave me the path to walk on. And I am grateful to the many thousands who packed it down. 

And to all of you on the journey with me, Peace be with you.', "Whichever side, but always close to the front so the chalice isn't empty before we get there...", "What is the biggest fear that you've completely overcome?"]

["Maybe, I'll attempt it and get back to you if I'm successful!", 'The most euphoric dream I've ever had 
 Hey, young pre-everything ftm here and I felt like I'm in fucking heaven.
I haven't posted on here yet, but hi; I'm here now!

It's kinda short but here's the story.

Last night I fell asleep, and suddenly appeared in a pale tann-ish room that kinda looked like the hospital Frodo Baggins was in while he recovered from the trip to Mordor.
I looked at myself lying down and I found that I was naked for some reason. Dreams are weird like that. But I saw that I actually had a peen. I just smiled to myself and thought "Right, I have this. This feels right." And I felt genuinely happy for once.
And then I woke up, obviously sad that I remembered I actually don't have a peen yet; but I'm so grateful for the euphoria it gave me.

It may not seem that much, but I'm super happy about it. It's the first dream I've had where I've seen that I have a peen and I felt super validated.

So yeah! That's that. Whoever made it this far, I'm happy you read my little story.

Tldr: I had a dream where I had a peen and felt super euphoric about it.', "Wow... I don't know why, but he kinda looks handsome to me..! But like, in the way where I just wanna hug him!", 'Or a big chested trans guy who layers up sports bras']

 I hadn‚Äôt spoken with him in 2 wks since the breakup. He was drunk and disorderly, I blocked him with no explanation, it was time. He‚Äôd been drunk too many times. 

I thought I was mostly over it, until I had a discussion about alcoholics with a a client at work. I texted my exes mom, who I‚Äôm close to, and asked him how A was. She told me exactly where he was in rehab, and I called.

He got back to me this morning.

I‚Äôm just so glad he‚Äôs not sleeping on park benches anymore. I‚Äôm glad he‚Äôs going out of his comfort zone. I‚Äôm glad he‚Äôs seeking therapy and psychiatry and is doing a real program. 

Fuck. I love him so much, Even after the ABUSE drunk him put me through. I‚Äôd sell my body parts if it meant he got better. I‚Äôd do anything.

It was cathartic. Of course, he was so happy I called. I need to be able to forgive, and for me that meant calling and talking to him. I know he never MEANT to hurt me, but that doesn‚Äôt mean he didn‚Äôt. I‚Äôm glad he‚Äôs giving this a chance. Knowing he was homeless before had my heart broken, and i worried every day for his well being.

At 23 I know real love. In a way I‚Äôm grateful for that. Our relationship may be over, but I know I can love again. I know who I am and what I am better now. Damn, if it meant never seeing or speaking with him again, and he‚Äôd never drink again, I‚Äôd 100% selflessly do that. 

I was an amazing influence on him, but that didn‚Äôt stop him from being an alcoholic. You can‚Äôt change people. It‚Äôs up to them.', 'Sulcata do pyramid a bit in the captivity. ['How big is the needle and do you have random spotting throughout the year', "Should I just try and get a hysto on my parents insurance and ask forgiveness later? What do I do? 
 Should I just get my hysterectomy on my parents insurance and beg for forgiveness later? I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any way I‚Äôm gonna be able to get insurance of my own

Will parents find out via bill I used their insurance for hysterectomy

<HEADING>  Hysterectomy for dysphoria

['Cis people disappear. Just for the day, the aren‚Äôt hurt or anything. Just gone, like an alternate reality', 'Okay. I‚Äôve decided I‚Äôm coming out as NB this weekend. What can I do if it goes bad and my mother misgenders me purposely or thinks it‚Äôs just a phase. I‚Äôm doing this because I physically cannot deal with not being out socially. Please leave advice', 'Hello Ellis, (if you still would like to go by that), there are a few things the helped me

*The gender wiki has a page on pronouns, and context on how they are used. There are some (ones- hehe, my pronouns) pronouns you wouldn‚Äôt even have heard of. For me, when you find the right one it will ‚Äòclick‚Äô, but another way to do it is what makes you least dysphoric. You may want two sets of pronouns (I use they/one) if one of them is harder to use, unknown, or hard to pronounce. I call this the cis-guard. But if you are only comfortable with abstract pronouns, don‚Äôt be afraid to insist people use them.

*If people are refusing to use your chosen name or pronouns, just don‚Äôt respond to them if that‚Äôs a choice. If possible say ‚Äòthat‚Äôs not my name/pronouns‚Äô. Be patient with distant family and strangers. If, when you‚Äôre old enough, people aren‚Äôt accepting and it‚Äôs hurting you don‚Äôt be afraid to cut people off.

*For names, go through baby lists, see what kind you like. Make a list, see if there is any themes. Any themes you find put into nameberry to see if you can find similar ones. 

*It‚Äôs okay to change you name, pronouns or identity. It‚Äôs fluid. It‚Äôs okay if you misgender or misname yourself, it‚Äôs normal.', 'That kind of takes away the dress aspect, but whatever helps you feel less dysphoric']

<SUMMARY> small but really powerful vibrator to position on my clit while having PIV sex?', 'I'm having an invalidating time. Could use advice 
 Hi! i'm AFAB but very genderqueer. Some days are femme, others I wear a binder and men's clothes and feel great.

["still a good Instagram vs reality. too often we compare our worst angle to influencers' best.", "I'm too lazy to link it l but it's in the top posts in the last month, I think it's the second top post", "Can PMS cause me to miss my period? 
 Ok, background. 

I'm fourteen, almost fifteen, and a few months ago, I was diagnosed with PMDD (premenstrual dysphoric disorder). For those of you that are lucky enough not to know what that is, it's basically PMS on steroids. I already deal with depression, anxiety, bi-polar, eating disorders, the list goes on, so the week before my period, I get super stressed, cry a lot, and usually come really close to hurting myself. (Don't worry, I'm seeking treatment. But for now, it is what it is.) 

This month, I got hit really hard. I was eating thousands of calories of chocolate and cookies and shit, and I would cry at the drop of a goddamn hat. But now, it's been two weeks, my PMS symptoms have pretty much ceased and I still haven't had my period. 

I'm not sexually active, so I know it's not pregnancy, and I'm not on birth control or anything of the sort. I know stress can affect your cycle, but can the stress of PMS cause my period to be late or cause me to skip it all together? Or is that too late in the cycle to affect it? And if PMS can't cause a late period, what else could it be? 

Thank you!", "I mean, honestly probably yeah. I'm a vegetarian and I'm pretty used to people not catering to me. I eat before I go places and I shut up and don't complain. 

But that's not really the point anyhow. Being vegan is a dietary restriction. It means that you quite literally can not eat certain foods for either moral or health reasons. Now, I know that may seem picky to you but it's a moral commitment similar to religion. 

Choosing to eat meat is perfectly valid but it is not a dietary restriction. It's more similar to liking a certain food. Let's say mac n cheese is your favourite food on Earth. You wouldn't demand every place you go serve mac n cheese, would you? Because you understand that that's a personal preference but not a restriction. You don't ONLY eat mac n cheese. You won't go hungry for the night if there's no mac n cheese available. You just kind of wish they served mac n cheese. So maybe you can make some before you go."]

['Anyone have experience with psych meds and BC?

Now, being sexually active and child-free (23 years old), I've been looking at maybe an IUD (if not being "fixed") as actual birth control and not just PCOS treatment.

 Decided to be brave and talk with my dad about my gender identity. He‚Äôs scared I‚Äôll go into the mens bathroom when I look like I don‚Äôt pass for male at all. ['"Who talks?" A commentary on Roblox chat systems 
 In Roblox, one of the key features of the platform lies in it's chat system. It gives players the capability to communicate and discuss with each other in-game. This chat system, however, was not always as available as it is now. 

In 2014, Roblox begin to experiment with letting all players chat. I remember being younger, and all of a sudden having a strange box full of a ton of messages from strangers appear in my top left corner. I had never even known this was a feature. All I knew, was Super Safe Chat.

The new chat, available to all players, was now dubbed Safe Chat (when regarding the new, younger players able to communicate). In those days, the filter was restrictive, but still lenient enough to warrant conversation. It was still new, and had much time to be improved on. 

Roblox was still small, having a third of active users now present today. When I found a server of people, I'd almost always type "Who talks?". It was the pseudo-replacement of "Wanna be friends?" as it immediately introduced you to the other players, and defined you as another one of them.

Over time, however, the use of "Who talks?" gradually declined, as people got increasingly familiar with the new chat system and you could see this as soon as you joined. This trend lasted for many years. However, it was soon to go south.

Roblox chat is a feature, it expands upon gameplay, and provides another input, this time, to the other players. When a feature goes unused or costs more than it gives, it is removed. This can be seen with the Forums, Tix, and others. I want you to go into a random game on the front page, and see how active the chat is. 

I recently tested this out, and went into Lifting Simulator 3. Not much to my surprise, the only chat was one person repeatedly spamming "NO KILL" over and over. By the time I had joined, however, this player had left and no new chats were being made. I say for 5 minutes, and only one message had been said.

I also went into Adopt Me for 3 minutes, and the only people chatting were two Russian people, back and forth, in Russian. The server had some odd 35 people in it.

The places where you see chat used frequently tend to be poor roleplaying games, or niche games with strong communities. But many of these don't bring in as much money as other games (think Lifting Simulator or Jailbreak). 

If this trend continues, we may see Roblox start to put chat in the hands of the developers, instead of providing it automatically. While unlikely this is something we must consider, because, today, when I ask "Who talks?", I get no answer.', 'Excuse me what? Please list, I have seen a lot of videos of the game and it seems absolutely lovely.', "It's just a custom skybox. He managed to balance lighting out right and put the sun in a nice position. Everything else is just handled by Roblox's water graphics.", "so, what kind of things do you do here. it's pretty simple to get the plane the player is walking on, it's simply their position relative to the sphere's center with a 90 degree angle. however, what things are you setting to give the illusion of gravity and smooth camera?"]

["Do what you normally do! You're more than just your gender identity, you have hobbies and interests and goals that can be unrelated! Improve or entertain yourself in other ways! :)", 'Are you asking why I included "I'm just doing it for attention" as a reason to be doubtful I really want to change genders? It's because I'm concerned I might just be latching onto this idea of being trans to alleviate other problems or to feed my desire for attention :/

This isn't as much a problem for me now, but when I was younger especially in high school/middle school I would do anything for attention. I used to want to be blind because a character in a book I read was blind and I thought it was cool...
Yeah, I've chilled out a bit since then, but still a bit of a residual concern haha', 'The best advice I can give (I've been doing daily voice exercises for 3ish months) is to keep going once you start! Even if it sounds like you're doing worse than you were a week ago, don't stop, keep chugging along.

 You can check my profile for my posts in Transvoice, where I recorded myself and asked people for their opinions. Between each recording was usually a period of getting slightly better, then much much worse. I do recordings of myself every day to track progress and some of those are me on the she of crying about how I was doing WORSE than I was a month ago. Still though, I kept practicing every day, and I can now recognize that I'm doing much much better than I was. Even if it doesn't seem like it, every failed practice or dip into your masculine voice does help you get better, until the voice you thought was "decent" a month ago sounds like crap to you now because your just so much better and you didn't even realize it.

I'm looking forward now to month 4 and 5 and continuing on, because the voice I have now which I think is "decent" will probably sound like crap to me by then, and I'll be even better. Just don't give up partway through, taking breaks and stopping are the only ways to truly not progress, even if it feels like your going backwards during your practice sessions.', "Also please give me any tips you think will help!! I've been doing this for almost 2 months and making any sort of progress has been difficult. Thank you!"]

['200 iq mutiny, trick CentCom into reassigning a new faptain', "The trials and tribulations of a Nanotrasen private Security Officer 
 I was working for a smaller security organization, we were regularly rotated between 4 stations. A local Food City supermarket was designated Sector Alpha-Niner, the Jiffy Lube was Bravo-Lima-Fiver, the local $1 store was Golf-16 and finally, the most coveted assignment, the local mall being Zebra-1.

Back then, before my corporate sponsorship, my gear was severely limited due to out of pocket expenses. I was armed with a Glock 17 <BOLD> (one of the first, given to me by Gaston Glock personally in honor of my former black-ops experiences) and a Remington 870P 14‚Ä≥ bbl holder loaded with 000 magnums. On this particular fateful day my team was assigned to patrol Sector Zebra-1, the mall.

It was an uneventful Saturday, until the unthinkable happened‚Ä¶

It was about 8:45PM, and the mall was closing and nearly empty. Me and my ‚Äôshadow‚Äô were sweeping quadrant 069E, the mall arcade, a known hot-spot for Asian gangs and their assorted thugs. The arcade was located at the far east end of the mall, next to the movie theater and the Orange Julius. I smelled trouble, and couldn‚Äôt spot any movement from the arcade, which was unusual due to the presence of a new Mortal Kombat arcade game. <BOLD> Those Asians love Mortal Kombat. 

I went to ‚Äúcondition red‚Äù and discreetly unholstered my Glock 17 loaded with Black Talons. I motioned to my partner to sweep right to flank the arcade, but he was already in motion sensing the trouble in my facial expression. My partner drew his S&W 1006 and went prone behind a potted palm tree. 

We crept towards the arcade, when the power suddenly cut out. It was an ambush! 

I could still see relatively well due to the full moon, shining through the building‚Äôs skylights, and years in a dark secret Albanian prison had honed my natural night vision to that of a tomcat. <BOLD> A gangster popped up from behind the Orange Julius counter with a full auto Kalashnikov equipped with a 75 round drum, and opened up in the direction of my partner, meanwhile two other perps popped up from behind the skee-ball machine armed with sawed down 12 gauges. Another two perps appeared on the upper level and brought down hell-fire on us from above. One had a Winchester Model 70 in .30-06 with a 10x scope and the other was laying down suppressing fire with a Mac-10 variant. The perps were all sporting cheap Russian night vision goggles.

I dove under a metal bench, and lined my Glock's sights on the AK bandit. A double-tap to the chest, and a quick follow-up to the head brought him down like a sack of potatoes. My partner had been hit in the leg by some buckshot but he kept fighting like a champ, he took out one of the shotgunners with a well aimed 10mm HP to the temple, while I started unloading into the glass partition that surrounded the upper level. 

When the sniper ran for cover I drew a bead on him, adjusted for distance, and dropped two into his abdomen. The Mac-man ran for it, at the sight of the bloody guts pouring out his partner‚Äôs stomach. I did a quick tactical reload, dropping the used magazine on the floor, then quickly grabbed the 870P from the harness on my back, and did some tactical combat rolls over to the movie theater, backflipping over the concession counter while simultaneously unloading the 5 rounds of 000 into the skee-ball machine. 

My partner was pinned down, I dumped my empty 870, and realized I couldn‚Äôt hit the remaining perp due to my the poor angle of attack. I had to act fast or my partner was done for. 

I leap over the counter again, and low crawled towards the arcade unseen. I crept behind the Ms. Pac-Man arcade cabinet, and when I heard the perp reloading, jumped up with my trusty K-Bar, and threw it into the perp‚Äôs arm, pinning him against the wall behind him.

When the smoke cleared, we had three dead perps, and two very scared prisoners. My partner was wounded but he would live to fight another day. The company goons came in fast by chopper, to cover up the situation. The two remaining perps were supposedly flown to a company-run detention center, and we never found out what happened to them, or why they made such a vicious attack. 

<BOLD> My belief is that they were planning to hijack the coveted Mortal Kombat arcade cabinet. 

The remaining mall customers and employees were paid off to cover their emotional distress and to keep their mouths shut. Later an unknown shadowy figure in an expensive blue uniform that was emblazoned with the Nanotrasen corporate logo came up to me as I was reloading my Remington 870 (in case of a second wave of gangsters) and offered me the job opportunity of a lifetime‚Ä¶

I don‚Äôt know if I made the right decision that day. <BOLD> I will always fondly remember the days of mall security, the expressions on the thankful patrons you saved from certain molestation in the mall bathrooms. The look of pain in the drooling face of the shoplifter you just choke-holded to unconsciousness.

Yes, my new job is more exotic, and the gear is better, but would I trade it all for one more day as a mall security rep? I don‚Äôt know the answer to that question.", "i remember there being an unironic pull request to add multiver to the traitor poisons kit, since 10 units of it would be enough to end someone's lungs", "when it's stealth ops and you pool all your money for a mech and you just strut down the halls and no one gives a second fucking thought about it"]

Then she cried and complained when we hadn't brought the baby over so she could "bless him" two days postpartum. She smokes in her house so I have never taken him in there, and for the first 6 months she complained so much about us "keeping him away" that other family members were blowing up my phone with nonsense, meanwhile she declined every invitation to come see us. My SIL has a new baby and now my son doesn't exist. It's as infuriating as it is relieving.', "ESH. 
Obviously your brother shouldn't have another baby. It's ridiculously irresponsible that he's even considering it. 

 You suck because you haven't called CPS. I have a 14 month old who is saying more than 30 words, using sign language, sorting shapes, singing etc. I'm not trying to brag, I'm just giving an example of what a child should be able to do. At 4 years old it is incredibly alarming that your nephew can't speak. It's also really alarming that neither child has been to the doctor. There's some serious neglect going on and you're choosing to ignore it. The same is going to happen to your niece, and it's going to impact their entire lives. Whatever is going on with your nephew sounds a lot more serious than ignoring ADHD (not to minimize what happened to you, my parents did the same to my older brother) and look how much that impacted your life. Please do the right thing and call CPS. Your niece and nephew deserve so much  better than what they're getting."]

['What MIL said to MY dear husband during the mother-son​ dance 
 So first of all MIL picked out "my wish" by rascal flats for the mother-son dance. You know, the one about hoping for the best for someone you love while they take on their life adventure. 

The whole time they danced she cried and was telling him she is losing her bAbY bOy. \*audible eye roll\* So he kept telling her "no, you have gained a family." But she would just keep saying the same thing. 

This lovely mother-son moment was immediately proceeded by FIL's "toast"

the dingbat that is my new FIL decided he was going to make a wedding toast on the spot, right after my little brother's emotional and awe-inspiring speech. I literally had my head in my hands crying and all of a sudden my FIL puts his hand on my shoulder and I look up to see he has a microphone in his hand.

oh no

mind you the last time MIL & FIL and I spoke (three years ago) is when he called me a variety of names and told husband that if you marry her you will be out of the will.

So, of course, he decided he needed to say something, with amplification, to my closest friends and family...

he starts stuttering a string of words with no logical sense or direction, then says "the first time (hellnomil) and I met... wait I don't remember..." and shoves the mic in my face. So I need to, on the spot, remember (which I did ) along with some bull about that's when we became family. (my maid of honor started cackling in the background at that one)

he takes the mic back, babbles some more, and then says "here is to MY bride and my son."

Edit: he wants drink this is just his personality 

the next morning he doubled down on it and said there is MY bride when he saw me in the morning.

on a funnier note, I played a game with my bridal party where I wouldn't point out my inlaws to them and they had to guess who they were based on the stories I've told them. MOH and her boyfriend picked them out of a crowd right away just by how they were interacting with other guests at the rehearsal', 'I live in the south and my cashier at TJs was a very attractive bearded man that was classical ‚Äúmanly man‚Äù I was talking to him and he was saying how his partner this and his partner that. And towards the end of our conversation he let it slip ‚Äúhis husband‚Äù and I saw a horrified look pass over his face like he made a huge mistake. 

I felt horrible for him. I positively affirmed the fact he had a husband is as sneaky of a way I could, ‚Äúomg that is the best! I‚Äôm so happy for you and your husband ‚Äú in response to what he was telling me. 

And I could tell he relaxed a bit (I had a cross on and I think that‚Äôs why he was worried)

But moral of the story my heart just aches for that guy every day. I can‚Äôt imagine having to be careful not to tell people about significant portions of my life because I‚Äôm afraid of their reactions (and anybody in the same situation) 

It kills me I‚Äôm just so hurt and sad üò¢', 'It feels worse than you would imagine! The flu swab has nothing on this guy. I don‚Äôt flinch for a flu swab and figured it was the same, nope not the same. Just so incredibly uncomfortable

Also I can feel it watching this video and it is making my toes curl', 'Ooohhhh 5g as in phones. I was so damn confused. I was like 5 grams of what????']

["He's on my island and his house feels out of place to me. Like I don't even think fences would fit...", "I also recently started paying for Origin Access and it's pretty good honestly", "[Discussion] I'm starting to question whether I fall under the non binary category (if genderfluid is considered NB) 
 Just a warning: I don't mean any harm by this post. I'm simply asking on others opinions. I'm sorry if it's offensive in any way

Recently I've started questioning if I fall under the NB category: more specifically, genderfluid. I did some research and there's definitely some days where I feel more masculine, more feminine and sometimes both at the same time. I'm starting to wonder if I'm genderfluid. Just to be clear, I'm fine with my genitals as they are (I currently identify as a guy and my bio sex is male and I have no issue with my bio sex at all) I'm just wondering if I am genderfluid or not.

I'm more in touch with my feminine side: as in, I feel more comfortable with feminine activities (like make-up clothing etc.) and I feel more feminine than masculine on more days as opposed to the opposite and I'm fine with mens clothes as well as womens.

I honestly have no clue and it kinda feels like I'm having an identity crisis right now. Any advice from non-binary/genderfluid peeps would be so grateful.

Thanks for reading this far. I kinda needed to get this out and I know this community is a safe space. Also, I am completely okay with people using she/her and he/him pronouns to refer to me so I have no clue if that's a factor in this.

Thanks again. I'm kinda having a mental breakdown so I'd appreciate a lot of support and advice on if I am genderfluid or not.

EDIT: forgot to mention, I've been playing out scenarios in my head where I declare that I'm genderfluid to people and it feels right to me. I have no clue if this means anything, it's all kind of scary for me", 'Attack helicopter jokes are overused shitty transphobic jokes']

["and it's way more lethal and spreads exponentially faster", 'feeling like a disgusting piece of shit for this. anyone else struggle with showers?', "that's valid. honestly the weirdest shit triggers me. I can't even eat certain foods anymore because I remember purging them (mac n cheese is the biggest. was my favourite as a kid and now the mere scent makes me cry)", 'I was just trying not to hurt anyone. 
 I've had depression and anxiety for as long as I can remember. When I was about eleven, it got really bad and I started taking it out as anger. But that just led to my mother growing more and more abusive. She only ever hit me once, but she threw things at me constantly. Even once I stopped being that angry little bitch, she continued the trend. 

Flash forward three years. I tried to kill myself in January, got out of mental treatment centers in February, and now it's March. 

We're at my cousin's house, which is about 3000 miles away and we'll be here for a week. 

We were at my cousin's birthday party and my mom had a lot to drink, which usually makes her happier, but this time it just pissed her off. She was flipping out over small shit and then when we got home she told me to take her purse upstairs. I did. Then she told me to get her phone from upstairs. I did. Then, she told me to get her glasses from upstairs. I did. Then she told me to bring her shoes upstairs and get my slippers for her to wear, which were in the basement. I brought the shoes up, but I didn't want to go all the way downstairs for a friggin pair of slippers so I just brought her a pair of her own. She started yelling at me about how I had been such a bitch all day-- All week, in fact. 

I went downstairs and packed my laptop and stuff so I could go outside and get the hell away from her. When I came back up, my mom wasn't there, but my aunt was. I told her to tell my mom how sorry I was, that I should've just gotten the friggin slippers. She said it was just because my mom had been drinking. But I knew that wasn't the reason. She was just like this. It's just how life goes. 

I realized I couldn't find my phone and while I was looking for it, my mom came back and asked me what the hell I was doing. I told her. She just said "Jesus fucking Christ", rolled her eyes, and stormed off. She muttered something else to my aunt, but I couldn't hear. I was mortified and by the time I finally found my phone, all I wanted to do was kill myself. 

Another small, but embarrassing thing that happened took place at that party. My mom and my aunt started fighting about whether or not we should be allowed to have a glass of wine. My mom said yes, my aunt said she was a bad parent, my mom relented. Then, my aunt started talking about how alcohol use early in life leads to alcohol abuse later in life. I made a joke about "What if I don't intend on living that long?" 

I didn't mean it or anything. I'm just used to making jokes like that with my friends and I didn't even think about it. She got all serious and started guilt-tripping me. I was so embarrassed. A while later, my mom came over and told me to apologize to her for being such a bitch. I refused my mom's orders for once. I was too mortified to do that. 

Now, here's where I should probably mention something. I have a condition called Premenstrual Dysphoria Disorder (PMDD). So, although I'm pretty much incapable of getting mad most days, about two/three days before my period, I just fucking lose it. And of course, I'm about two/three days away from my period. 

On days like this, I try to stay away from people as much as possible because hurting someone's feelings just makes me feel one thousand times worse. So, I went outside and sat in the side yard so no one could see me. 

I started off just crying, but it turned into sobbing and punching the ground. I was so done with life. I was begging God to just tell me what They wanted, what I had to do to make Them happy. I was so scared. And right as I was starting to calm down a bit, I looked up and saw someone in the window-- I now know it was my aunt, though that's what I figured originally anyways. 

I didn't think much of it. She knew I was going through a lot. I figured she probably wouldn't say anything. A while later my cousin came out to talk to me and, though she didn't really understand, I felt better. At least now I had someone to talk to. I wasn't just listening to the thoughts bounce back and forth through my head. 

I stayed out for a while after my cousin left and wrote a bit. I feel good. Hopeful. When I went back inside, it was still awkward, but I was okay. Again, hopeful. 

Later, my mom called me downstairs. She said that my aunt had seen me punching the ground. 

"Who the fuck does that at fourteen?" she asked. I have never felt so stupid in my entire life. I was just trying to find a way to take out my anger. I was just trying not to hurt anyone. But somehow this was worse. The suicide thoughts came back. 

After writing this, I feel a bit better. More sorted, I guess. Sorry, this was long. I just needed a safe space to be honest about my shitshow of a life. I still feel stupid and melodramatic, but I honestly don't care right now. It could've been a lot worse. I could have tried to kill myself again, like I wanted to. I'd say punching the grass a few times was probably a better option. 

Thanks if you actually read this. 

Peace & Strength, 

-KC

UPDATE: 

I just talked to my mom (and by talked, I mean was sucked into a conversation where I just nod and agree and imagine shooting myself through the skull), she said my aunt had called it "weird", "childish", and "immature". She had no right to judge me. Punching the ground isn't as bad as punching your kid, so my mom shouldn't be saying shit. And my aunt knew, too, so she shouldn't either. I'm so fucking done with people. I'm sorry I'm not who you want me to be! I'm fucking trying! I couldn't do it today! I wanted to die! Why don't you care about that?! I'm sorry I fucking embarrassed you! Why don't you ask me why, though?! I just wanted someone to give a shit. Once my cousin came out and actually made me remembered there was someone here that didn't fucking hate me, I felt a little better. That's all I needed. It's not that fucking hard. I dunno. ['I don‚Äôt think she‚Äôs ashamed of <ITALIC> you, unless there are other signs in private, just uncomfortable with the public affection. For some people, there‚Äôs nothing wrong, it‚Äôs just not their thing. (Maybe due to their personality, their preference, or maybe due to abuse, trauma, insecure attachment styles, etc.) And that‚Äôs ok, we have to accept people where they are, although it might be a dealbreaker for you, as I think it is for me. If it's a deal breaker for you, & she's not willing to have these types of discussions or compromise, you might have to walk away, OP. 

Rhetorical questions for thought:
Where do you live? Is it a conservative or progressive area? What are the attitudes on non-heteronormativity? How did each of you grow up? Did you know anyone LGBTQ+? How long have each of you known you are bi? What has been your romantic/sexual/intimate/sensual experience with other genders? Are each of you affectionate with friends or family?
Is it her first relationship at all, or same-gender relationship? Both of those bring challenges, but I think non-hetero relationships bring a unique extra layer. Things have gotten a little better these days, representation-wise, but many of us grew up with little-to-no representation of not only our identities, but the types of relationships & connections we can have as that person. We‚Äôre drowning in examples of heteronormativity all around us, but what does a girl/girl relationship look like? What does it feel like? How do people react when they see affection between two girls? Is it safe? What will my parents & friends think? Who opens the door?? Who pays for dinner?!? :p

And that can really fuck with you, having no baseline or reference points, not really being able to comfortably integrate your identity with the world yet. Even if you are in the most affirming, supportive environment ever, the first time is usually a bit of a trip, for anything. 

There is a saying in the polyamorous community, ‚Äúmove at the pace of the slowest camel‚Äù. This can backfire, of course, but in general.... you can‚Äôt force comfort or speed. What I‚Äôd encourage you to do, is be supportive of whatever she needs. Talk about it, but not in a way where it sounds like this is something wrong with her. Empower her thru consent. Consent is sexy, it is confidence-building, it is validating. Talk, in excruciating detail, about what she is and isn‚Äôt comfortable doing in private, & what she is and isn‚Äôt comfortable with in public. Is it situational? Does she want you to ask before you do anything so she can let you know if she‚Äôs feeling it at that time? If she says no, try with all your might not to take it personally. It‚Äôs not about you. But let her know that maybe she could say something reassuring at that time, if that would help you. ‚ÄúNo, I don‚Äôt want to hold hands right now. But I‚Äôm really glad we‚Äôre together, & I‚Äôm looking forward to cuddling later at home.‚Äù

Talk about this because you care about her, because you want to be supportive, because you want to know everything about her, because her needs & her comfort are important to you. But also let her know if physical affection is a need of yours, & ask if she‚Äôs willing to try to work towards it, in baby steps, at her pace. You‚Äôre allowed to have needs too. ‚ÄúMaybe when we go out to the movies tonight, could I try to hold your hand, in the dark?‚Äù Sometimes knowing in advance can take the edge off. 

Maybe explain how it makes you feel when she doesn't accept affection (phrase this like "I feel <BOLD-ITALIC> <ITALIC> , when you ." Trust that her intentions are not malicious. I bet she isn't trying to hurt you. Maybe she doesn't even know that's happening.) Explain what affection means to you, what you get from it. This may require some introspection on your part. Why is public affection important to you? Are you looking for external validation? Are you so overflowing with love/attraction/closeness that it bursts out of you? Would you be ok with only doing it in private?

Maybe there are other ways she can communicate those things (there are 5+ love languages), & you can learn to receive them.

I‚Äôm saying maybe a lot because I don‚Äôt know your situation or much about either of you. You‚Äôll have to figure out what the best approach is for you. Good luck!! üåàüåà', 'We also put up with their behavior because it is a confirmation of our fears. Avoidant and anxious are drawn to each other because it works both ways on this. Our fear is that our partner will be distant, won‚Äôt be there when we need them, will leave us, etc. An avoidant person‚Äôs unchecked behaviors confirm those fears for us. So in a twisted kind of way, it feels comfortable that we are right and we know what to expect.

As an anxious person, dating a secure or anxious person, can feel very different. We won‚Äôt get that same strong feeling of desperate longing for them, as we do with avoidants. It might feel a little boring & not engaging, because of the lack of conflict & chasing. They‚Äôre just there for you. So we might tell ourselves it‚Äôs not real love or we aren‚Äôt into them. But being with a secure person is a choice we have to make consciously & know that this is what healthy feels like. We will feel that lasting, gnawing draw towards our avoidant ex for a long time, but tell yourself that‚Äôs a draw towards familiar dysfunction, & you deserve better <3', "Super adorable. Also interesting about the language difference. I've been really interested lately in the idea that your native language impacts the structure of your brain/thoughts/perception. Like in English we don't refer to ourselves in gendered terms, only other people. I only speak English & Spanish. Spanish genders objects & others but not yourself. Maybe says something about where we derive our identity...", 'When it comes to knowing who you are, we aren't any smarter than you :) You are the expert on you!

Some points to consider on your journey of learning yourself:

1. Sexual orientation and romantic orientation are separate things. They are often aligned towards the same gender(s) for folks, so that's become the normative thought that they are the same. Our language reflects this, since most of the time, you only hear people labeling themselves with the sexuality label or with them combined together (i.e. gay, lesbian, homosexual, bisexual). But plenty of folks have differing orientations, & if we wanted to be clear we would describe them both: bisexual heteroromantic, homosexual, panromantic, asexual panromantic, etc.
2. There are indeed a few forms of asexuality that are like "I sort of feel this attraction, but don't want to act on it" (example: lithosexual/lithoromatic). There is also "aesthetic attraction", which is "I really like looking at them, they are so hot/attractive, I don't wanna do anything more than just look."
3. I also think @<DESCRIPTION> <LINK> also makes a very possible point about growing up in Society. This is a piece of why it can take some/many folks many years to figure out their sexuality. If we grow up being surrounded by only heterosexual models of relationships, it might take us longer to learn that we aren't heterosexual, because we don't have examples around to look at and be like, "I want that", "That feels right to me".']

['Daily Song Discussion - The Universal (The Great Escape) 
 Next song up is a classic and one of Blur‚Äôs most iconic songs, The Universal. It‚Äôs lyrics describe a dystopian future where everyone is on a Universal drug to ease their stresses and convince them that the world is fine. This dystopian imagery is also reflected in the music video, which pays tribute to Stanley Kubrick‚Äôs film A Clockwork Orange.

Musically the song is grand and very anthemic, featuring a soaring chorus to go along with horns that become especially triumphant towards the end of the song. The string section is perhaps the most important musical element, and yet it originally wasn‚Äôt even part of the song. The song was first attempted as a ska number during the Parklife sessions but was later resurrected by Alex, who said that the band had almost given up on the song when Damon came up with the string section. 

The song was released as the second single from TGE and reached no. 5 on the UK Singles Chart. It has been performed live frequently by the band since its release.

Talk about whether you like the song, what you‚Äôre first impressions were of it and if you changed your opinion on it over time. Share any memories associated with the song. Link any great live performances of the track. Discuss what you like and dislike about the track etc

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>', 'I do agree that the songs on 2 (and by extension Rock and Rock Night Club) have a tendency to sound very similar. 

Salad Days never struck me as sounding the same throughout though. Let My Baby Stay is a heartfelt acoustic number, Passing Out Pieces is a bouncy synth track and Chamber of Reflection is a dreamy, psychedelic synth driven song that was unlike anything Mac had made up to that point. I‚Äôve never been the kind of person to really mind when artists go for a uniform sound throughout their albums though, so maybe it‚Äôs just me.', "Daily Song Discussion - Yuko and Hiro (The Great Escape) 
 We‚Äôre finally at the final track of TGE, the kooky but charming Yuko and Hiro. The lyrics on the song focus on a Japanese couple, Yuko and Hiro, who work hard to ensure the success of the company they work for. The topic of alcohol is once again brought up in the song, as the song mentions that the couple drink together to ‚Äòhelp with relaxing‚Äô.

Musically the song contains a number of different elements. Graham‚Äôs guitar work is once again very abstract and jumps back in forth as the song goes on. The drum work meanwhile sounds like it‚Äôs coming from a drum machine, while a piano is what primarily accompanies Damon‚Äôs vocals.

Lyrical highlights: ‚ÄúI drink in the evenings, it helps with relaxing, I can't sleep without drinking, we drink together‚Äù

Musical highlights: Guitar work

Best performer: Damon, Graham

Talk about whether you like the song, what you‚Äôre first impressions were of it and if you changed your opinion on it over time. Share any memories associated with the song. Link any great live performances of the track. Discuss what you like and dislike about the track etc

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>", 'I believe that for Wings Over America and the soundtrack for Gives My Regards To Broad Street, the Beatles songs were credited as McCartney-Lennon. I don‚Äôt remember John or later Yoko expressing any displeasure about Paul doing that though']

['This Rainbow Dash Mysteriously Appeared At My Work Station. And When I Came Back From Lunch, Disappeared Just As Mysteriously.', 'Bandcamp Hosting Fundraiser On March 20th To Help Artists Effected By COVID-19 
   

Via Bandcamp-

"The Covid-19 pandemic is in full force, and artists have been hit especially hard as tours and shows are being canceled for the foreseeable future. With such a major revenue stream drying up almost entirely, finding ways to continue supporting artists in the coming months is now an urgent priority for anyone who cares about music and the artists who create it. The good news is that we‚Äôre already seeing many fans going above and beyond to support artists across Bandcamp.

<BOLD> To raise even more awareness around the pandemic‚Äôs impact on musicians everywhere, we‚Äôre waiving our revenue share on sales this Friday, March 20 (from midnight to midnight Pacific Time), and rallying the Bandcamp community to put much needed money directly into artists‚Äô pockets.

For many artists, a single day of boosted sales can mean the difference between being able to pay rent or not. Still, we consider this just a starting point. Musicians will continue to feel the effects of lost touring income for many months to come, so we‚Äôre also sharing some ideas below on how fans can support the artists they love and how artists can give fans new, creative ways to provide support.

It may sound simple, but the best way to help artists is with your direct financial support, and we hope you‚Äôll join us on Friday and through the coming months as we work to support artists in this challenging time.

<BOLD> Ethan Diamond  
<BOLD> Co-Founder & CEO  
<BOLD> Bandcamp

üì∑

<HEADING>  If you‚Äôre a fan

We recognize that plenty of music fans are also seeing their livelihoods disrupted by this virus, but if you‚Äôre lucky enough to be in a position to spare some funds (or find yourself in that position in the coming months), please consider sharing your good fortune by buying music and merchandise directly from artists on Bandcamp. This Friday, March 20th, Bandcamp‚Äôs share of sales will also go to the artists and labels you choose to support, and as always, it will reach them in 24-48 hours.

If you already have all the music and merchandise you want from your favorite artists, consider discovering new favorites via our editorial publication, <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> and let them make their own selections. 

Finally, most of the items on Bandcamp have an option to pay more than the asking price, and leave a note for the artist. A tip and words of support are always appreciated, but especially so now."

<HEADING>  If you‚Äôre an artist

Start by taking a look at <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> may be particularly useful right now, as you look to replace income you‚Äôve lost from canceled tours and shows.

We‚Äôre telling everyone with a Bandcamp fan account about Friday‚Äôs event, but please help us spread the word via your usual social channels. You can also use the <DESCRIPTION> <LINK> to message your followers about it.

Many of your fans are actively looking for ways to support you through this crisis. Even if you don‚Äôt have new music or merch, we know fans love live recordings and early demos, and this is a good time to dig those up and release them on Bandcamp. We‚Äôre also seeing artists offering music production services, as well as video hangouts, lessons, and gear tutorials (these can all be listed as merch items on Bandcamp). Over the coming weeks we‚Äôll collect examples of what‚Äôs working best and share those here, so if something is especially effective for you or you‚Äôre just excited about an idea, please [let us know](mailto:supportingartists@bandcamp.com).

P.S. Many others within the music industry are being impacted as well, including record store owners and staff, tour managers, event producers, venue staff, lighting and sound professionals, janitors, photographers, bartenders, security guards, and more. We encourage you to find ways to reach out and support those affected in your local communities.

P.P.S. Friday‚Äôs waiver does not include artist subscription payments or vinyl pressing campaign pledges. For more information on Bandcamp‚Äôs revenue share, please see our <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>.', 'What If King Charles XII Sued For Peace In 1700, Ending The Great Northern War Early And Involving Sweden In The War Of Spanish Succession? 
 So after securing the peace of Travendal from Denmark-Norway, repelling the invasion of Polish Lithuania and defeating Russia at the battle of Narva, many a diplomat and minister wrote to King Charles to sue for peace against the now defeated alliance and become an arbiter of the War Of Spanish Succession in the west. (Ignore the flair, it's outdated and updating flairs is broken on mobile)

As for your middle name, I'm not really sure what would make these colors, but maybe you could try something that makes a nice sky blue or lavender?", "Multiple strangers' deaths in the same form 
 Hi! This is my first post here, so please let me know if I did anything wrong.

Background info: I'm 20 years old, and recently realized I'm a trans woman. Currently living with my brother since my college campus is closed for the pandemic. 

In this dream, I was at some sort of large meal. I saw some people I recognized - friends, classmates, etc. - and a bunch of people I didn't recognize. Throughout it, there were people standing up, walking around, talking, and generally having a good time.

At one point, someone I didn't know stood up, started walking walking around, and tripped and fell. Somehow, both of their eyes were... Punctured? Crushed? I'm not sure. They were pronounced dead instantly (by one random person, not necessarily a doctor). Someone took charge, led a miniature funeral, and I'm not sure what happened with the body.

This same sequence happened two more times, both people dying in the same way, in the same spot. Both were strangers. The third time, the body was propped up, and I was able to see that the eyes were practically missing, just hollow, bloody sockets. I looked away, we said a quick prayer, and then my brother's alarm clock woke me up.

At one point between the second and third deaths, the serving table ran out of food and only had things like ketchup, Sriracha, salsa, and other red condiments. One of my friends tried putting a bit of all of them on his plate, mixing them together, and dipping a leftover french fry into it. I don't know how it was, because the third death happened as he was dipping the fry.

Edit: I didn't get a good look at the first two, but it seemed like the first was a man, and I'm not sure about the second. The third was a woman.

Edit: background info", 'For a minute I thought this said "I am the only cis person" and I was real confused until I realized it said trans <ITALIC> enough']

['Why has Unarmed not gotten nerfed <BOLD> at all since launch? 
 Unarmed weapons currently:

\- Have amongst the highest base damage (Powerfist/DCG) for melee weapons (not even counting the puncturing/extra claw mod). They might be the highest.  
\- Attack faster than both 1h/2h weapons (but do more damage). The difference is certainly more noticeable compared to 2h weapons but they are slightly faster than 1h weapons.  
\- Require \*\*SIGNIFICANTLY\*\* less perk investment compared to 1h/2h (3 vs 9) to fully optimize damage. This is because unarmed gets to double-dip in mutations with both Talons and Twisted Muscles.  
\- Allows the player to take \*\*BOTH\*\* of the top defense-related cards under strength \*\*WITHOUT\*\* compromising your damage output. In order to maximize your damage output for 1h/2h, you need to forgo some sort of offensive power (whether it be raw damage, armor penetration, or swing speed). Unarmed does not require any of this.  


My build (for a raw numbers comparison) for the two "end game" weapons for Unarmed and 1h (Powerfist + Shishkebab, respectively):  
\- 41 Str with Adrenal Reaction + Nerd Rage + All 3 Gladiator cards (60%) + Bloody Mess (15%). Both of these weapons are Bloodied.

Shishkebab (with extra flame jets mod) Damage:  
\- 543 (physical) + 303 (energy) = 846 total damage

Powerfist (with puncturing mod) \*\*without speccing into Iron Fist or having the Talons mutation\*\*:  
\- 1431 (physical) + 0 (energy) = 1431 total damage

\*\*That's right. With ZERO perk investment and its major damage booster (Talons) missing from my build, I can do nearly TWICE the damage with a Powerfist\*\*

By simply investing in the iron fist card:  
\- 1431 --> 1798 damage. \*\*It's important to note that while receiving this damage boost, I'm also able to take Blocker (45% damage reduction in melee combat) and Barbarian (+80 DR). So I do MORE than twice as much damage while also being FAR more survivable.\*\*

How is this a thing? I normally am a fan of buffing things that are underpowered as opposed to nerfing things that are powerful, but seriously? Even with a 100% buff to the 1h weapons you would be stuck at the \*\*SAME\*\* level of damage as an Unarmed player but without the two major defensive perks.

On a side note, fix the Shishkebab from doing split damage. Make it all physical and actually give it a fire DoT (a la FO3/FNV).

["Having children 
 This is mainly a question for later on in life, but I wondered how parents cope and work around their pain?

The wife and I don't plan on kids for another few years, but I'd most likely be the primary caregiver. I am in a wheelchair 50% of the time. Are there ways to hold a baby while wheeling in a wheelchair? Also how difficult is it to put aside your pain to tend to a baby?

Although I am finally slated for the Persistent Pain Clinic this month, my chair might be a part of me for life as I get worse (Post operative Neuropathic Pain from a surgery to decompress a nerve in my leg that was causing painful numbing), I just want an idea of how to be a parent despite my condition.

Any thoughts or personal stories are welcome. From mum's and dad's.", '[Request] New Wheelchair Australia 
 I have fibromyalgia, which gives me severe pain and fatigue. To get around in public I need a wheelchair, otherwise I am pretty much housebound. I do have a wheelchair, but the wheels are warped and the footrests keep coming off.

I am waiting for my disability claim to go through centrelink, but I have no guarantee when it will. We are trying to save for a chair, but for a decent one we need at least $1000 aud. Any help would be appreciated, but I understand either way. Thanks', "I did bump it, but I don't think it was enough to  cause the pain I'm in", 'Ross as the judge is such a good idea!']

['Hey, have you heard of/joined <SUBREDDIT> yet? We are currently at 398 members, just 2 away from 400! :)', 'Part 2 (A deep-dive into the multiple parallels between Glimmer and Cassandra):

After watching most episodes twice and thinking more about it, Glimmer and Cassandra have more similarities than people realize (imo).

Life experiences: Their beginnings/upbringings may be different, but what they have gone through as teenagers and young women are very similar. The way I see it, both Glimmer and Cass are women characters who are largely misunderstood, overlooked, underestimated, and underrated not just by the fans, but by other characters in their respective shows (just to name a few for both: Glimmer by Angella, Adora, Bow, and Castaspella; Cass by Rapunzel, Eugene, the Captain of the Guards, and Adira). Also, both are mainly known as ‚Äúsidekicks‚Äù to the main character: Glimmer to Adora and Cass to Raps. Largely due to this, both feel a need to ‚Äústep out of the shadows‚Äù and prove themselves. This can lead to far-reaching/dangerous consequences as we can clearly see in both series. For example, both are easily manipulated/gaslighted by shady figures: Glimmer by Shadow Weaver and Cass by Zhan Tiri. Basically, both Glimmer and Cass‚Äô actions are driven by good intentions, but can end up having bad impacts (a very relatable aspect to me). Finally, both Glimmer and Cass have wielded/used the full power of their in-universe‚Äôs version of the Moonstone, confirming they have strong affinities with the Moon/lunar-related powers.

Personality: Both Glimmer and Cass are brave, strong, tough, and smart women who are also temperamental/hot-headed and stubborn/headstrong. At their core, they are fighters who never give up. Both women have persistence, perseverance, and resilience that is unrivaled when compared to other characters. Case in point, Glimmer and Cass have that ‚Äústubborn courage‚Äù/‚Äúdeterminator‚Äù attitude as they are facing opponents in battle (which we see many examples of in both series): when the going gets tough, they will keep on fighting until they can‚Äôt any longer (this is a winning attitude in my book).

Physical appearance: Both Glimmer and Cass are fairly short women (around 5 feet tall or so) with short hair in a ‚Äúbob-style‚Äù. Additionally, both have/had ‚Äúunnaturally colored irl‚Äù hair. In five seasons of <ITALIC> SPoP, Glimmer has pink/purple hair with sparkles. Meanwhile, Cass‚Äô hair was turquoise blue at the end of S2 and during S3 of <ITALIC> TTS/RTA. Going even further, Cass and Glimmer have notable costume changes as their own series progresses, signifying dynamic character development. Cass does have more wardrobe/outfit changes than Glimmer, but my point still stands.

Sexual Orientation: Based on evidence throughout both series and posts by show staff on social media, it is safe to say that Glimmer and Cass are LGBT+ women. Glimmer appears to be bisexual because she has shown interest in both women (i.e., cuddling with Adora in a Mystacor spa, kissing Catra on the cheek, and hugging both women) as well as men (her friendship with Bow that became a romantic relationship as the hugs turned to kisses over time). Even though it was never confirmed in <ITALIC> TTS/<ITALIC> RTA itself, I think we can definitely infer that Cass is LGBT+. Now, whether Cass is lesbian or bisexual is currently up for debate, because while she has shown an interest in men (which may have actually been a ruse), she seems to be much more interested in women (specifically Rapunzel), even though it may be an intense unrequited/one-sided type of love.

As you can see, the parallels between Glimmer and Cass are numerous.

These are just the ones that I can remember off the top of the head.', 'This is a poll question. Just want to make sure that people who see this know (you may need to go back and come back again/refresh your screen).', 'Same here! Glad you found us and posted your thoughts/feelings about <ITALIC> She-Ra here! 

I found out about <ITALIC> SPoP because <ITALIC> Tangled fans in <SUBREDDIT> were talking about the show when comparing Cassandra to Catra. So, I finally gave it a chance back in Feb. and boy was I not disappointed! You are exactly right! This series is definitely one of, if not, the best of all time mainly because of its characters (development, relatability, etc.) and reasonable plots.

Glimmer is my favorite character because we have so much in common. Due to this, I can relate to her much more than any other character. Catra is my second-favorite character because of her development and story arc. In a nutshell, Glimmer and Catra are my two favorite characters because they are complex/complicated, dynamic, and relatable.']

["Welcoming discord server 
 Hello <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

Me and a couple of others have created a discord server primarily for LGBT youth. It's pretty small right now, so we're looking for members.

Older members of the community are also welcome, of course.

If you want to come over, here's an invite link: <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>", 'I have an Uro chain list, can you look it over? 
 Hello <SUBREDDIT>

I have been working on a cEDH list for Uro sometime now, and I have found a place where it looks pretty good to me. Can you people help me by looking it over?

Decklist: <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>', "I don't ship sokeefe because I want Keefe for my own", "Felt like I should share this here, not sure when I'm gonna use it tho. Is it ok? 
 My name is Cullan. I am constantly pressured by society to conform. That's the thing I hate. We always have to do this, or do that, or go here, or learn that. We're told we have to be a certain way, that if we aren't, we aren't enough, that we aren't worth anything. This view is toxic. It drives home the point that you are just supposed to be normal, to fit in.

What if you don't?

You are persecuted for being who you are, for expressing yourself. You can't find a place. So instead, you try to compensate. You try to hide. You put yourself through endless agonies because you are afraid of what will happen. You torment yourself with visions of what you want and what you need. You can't understand who or what you are.

There are voices in the back of our heads. You know of your conscience. You've heard it reprimand you for your morally incorrect actions. There's another. It's the voice of that part of your mind. The part that you try not to listen to but it creeps into your darkest dreams and deepest slumbers. It's your doubts. We all have doubts. They keep us centered and grounded. But the doubt that this is is much deeper. It holds down your worst fears and makes them real. You dream of what you want, and then it ends. Your doubt and your hatred creep in to fill its place. It's an impossibility, they say. It can't be done. You're just lying to yourself.

We float alone on an island, unanchored in the ocean of our sorrow and desperation. We live for the simple things. The quiet reassurance of a friend, the mere touch of a partner, fearing that we will lose everything if we let our guard down. We can never truly relax. We know that horrible things can and will happen if we slip up in our facade for even one moment. I can't live with that constant fear anymore.

I won't let this run me down any longer. I refuse to accept this driving force. I am Aria . I am a girl. I am 14.

Screw the consequences. I just don't care anymore.", 'I posted this on the 23rd or something. I regretted that.']

["I haven't consistently been on my meds in months and it's killing me 
 I'm supposed to be on 27mg concerta but I didnt have the energy to go out to actually turn in my prescription sheet for months. All the while I was surviving on the meds that I still had from previous scripts, now they're starting to run dry too. Last week, I finally gathered enough wherewithal to go to the pharmacy and... they wouldn't accept the script because my psych forgot to put a date on it.

I just really want to scream right now. I'm in the middle of a summer course where participation counts for 30 percent of the grade and I'm not confident I'll make it (considering the professor has called me out for using my phone in the past) and I'm already halfway through with less than three weeks remaining in the course. Shit like this is what makes me want to throw in the towel with education altogether. It's hard not to just resign myself completely and accept that it's too late to make any meaningful improvements. I'd have to be exceptionally lucky for any masters program to want me and I'd better kiss my dream of having a PhD goodbye. I feel like a fucking failure all because of things i could never take control of.

Sorry if this is incoherent, I need to get this off my chest ASAP. It's taking me all my effort to not scream as loud as I can. This is my only outlet.", 'Sorry for being late, but I had to come back to this.

This line of thought, almost exactly, is what led to me realizing I was nonbinary/a demigirl. I never completely let go of my "male" fashion sense. I still have, and wear on a regular basis, many of the shirts I wore as a guy. And, to put the cherry on top, I never really got into wearing dresses. Transitioning gave me euphoria, but I slowly realized that hyper-femme was not what suited me at all. Being a femme enby, however, just gives me freedom to be what I want to be. I get the euphoria of being female AND the comfort I had as my old self <ITALIC> (despite being AMAB and identifying as male before transitioning, I feel my pre-transition self was closer to masc nb then it ever was to being male)

There's nothing wrong with trying things out for yourself! I'm only sharing my experience because it reminded me of what I felt. But your journey is your own ;) and feel free to pm me if you want!', 'Janessa, but you can call me Jana or Nessa for short!

['Just thinking about the kids with bad homes who now cant go to school where they get 2 meals and 7 hours of enrichment a day', "Suffering from Whiplash in Albuquerque, New Mexico 
 So this accident happened a month ago, and I'm still experiencing neck and back pain. I have dash cam footage that clearly shows I'm not at fault, and you can hear audio of my 16-month-old son crying pretty hard, my 2 yo daughter was in there as well as my wife. she's also experiencing whiplash, and kids had some minor behavior changes, I'm also a bit more anxious when I drive.

Anyway, the insurance company is offering us like $2k. The claims adjuster wants me to sign a medical release form and says i can get more money from them if I do. I go to the VA for everything. My doctor has sent me to an acupuncturist for back pain in the past, but they did cupping. I haven't had problems with neck pain and headaches before, but I do have chronic back pain.

I have a lawyer who wants to represent me, and I'm debating whether or not I should sign with her. She says we can get more like 10k each, but says I need to go outside of the VA, she's telling me that the VA is bad, and I don't really agree with that, but I understand that she can't get an award from the VA since there's no copay.

My wife doesn't really want to bother with a chiro or massage therapist because we don't want to pay out of pocket, but we told the lawyer we could go get a referral from her doctor. The kids can't talk so they can't tell us much, but I guess we could get referrals for a child psychologist.

Anyway, I'm trying to figure out if this will all be worth it. What if I accrue all this medical debt then we don't get an award? And the kid that hit us, I don't want my lawyer to press this thing so hard that it makes the kid pay out of pocket, I could care less about Progressive insurance having to pay $50,000.

TL:DR Have dashcam, wife and I are suffering whiplash. 1yo and 2yo are mildly traumatized. How much can I expect from a personal injury settlement after medical bills and legal fees are paid?", "Im also a federal employee, unfortunately its difficult to make demands since we can't strike. This administrations leadership has been pathetically slow in responding to this emergency, just hoping it will go away instead of listing to science.

I work in a federal building, and i got all my stuff together for telework before the leadership told us we could, and my bosses accused me of overreacting and said i might get stopped by security. 

A few days later they told us to we could do exactly what i was called out for, but they told it to a hundred  people in a cramped conference room, one of whom had been exposed previously, the idiots... Now telework its mandatory, finally. Nothing wrong about being ahead of the curve to protect your family. We are federal employees, the bosses and the admin dont like us to be smarter than them, but they may at least respect it, and we have tenure. 

When this shitty admin is gone we need to put this country back together.", "I would argue that chihuahuas are the most aggressive breed but they're also the smallest breed. If they don't let you they're there they get crushed and die"]

['I might agree on most of the points. However I do think it's established that Bats would want to go in there (he was insistent on going into a generic Gas Station/he's generally pretty eclectic ) and Kevin Spacey DEFINITELY picked the tape because he knew her name was Deborah and wanted that manipulation/power. And of course Monica would make that connection, she's a hired gun who is paid to notice details, like most of them. I think those were pretty organic script moments. 

As for the unrealistic stuff, Edgar Wright has a movie about zombies with unexplained science and rules. But it's a fun movie that uses predetermined archetypes of monster flicks and paradigms within them to tell a subversive story that uses the "unrealism" and jarring tone to be funny. I found Baby Driver to be SUPER similar in that regard. Wright has a penchant for eschewing plot and realism for character beats and moments. It's a fairy tale movie and the movie has no problem admitting that. The side characters are larger than life, baby effectively has super powers, and the ending had a literal rainbow and sequences were shot black and white. Baby used an iPod! I think that a lot of the stuff that didn't work for you, and that's okay and we can have different opinions and wants out of certain movies, were deliberate choices by Wright and the editing team to tell a different and larger than life story, which is grounded in emotion instead of actual realism. 

EDIT: Okay I see what youre saying with pacing issues in the third act. And other than the unrealistic, character-over-plot stuff, I think the movie did lose itself in it's own spectacle towards the end, I agree.', "What was your first tattoo? ['I checked them out and that have some really pretty jewelry, thank you!', "I'm a former drug addict with way too many mental health issues. AMA 
 I suffer from depression, anxiety, and OSDD-1A. I am also autistic and have ADHD. When I was a kid, I had severe psychosis and sleep paralysis. I was a drug addict from ages 12 to 16 (I'm now 18), and picked up a drinking and self harm habit somewhere along the way.

I'm bored during this quarantine, so I will answer any questions.", "I think a septum is one of those piercings that universally look good on everyone, so I'd say definitely go for it. If you get it done with a horseshoe you can let it heal flipped up so that it doesn't get caught on anything. I've also seen some people getting their septum pierced with a curved barbell, which also doesn't stick out as much.", 'Thank you! I really love them, even though my parents say I look retarded and no one will ever take me seriously', "I started stretching my septum pretty recently. Personally I use the stacking method. Every few weeks, I check if I have a bit of space in my septum (there's a small Gap if I pull my rings forward), and if I do, I put in another 18g ring. After another couple weeks, I switch the 18g ring to a 16g ring. Rinse and repeat. It's recommended to stretch up to a 10g or so using normal techniques first (tapers seem to be fairly common for smaller sizes), but I started stacking straight away. It hurts a little to push the new ring through, but the pain is bearable and my eyes just mostly water a lot. My snoot is a bit sore the next few days, but it's nowhere near as bad as when I initially got it pierced.
As for the wait, I can't give you an exact time period, but I've had my septum pierced for about 8 months before I started stacking, so it definitely had time to fully heal.

It depends on the look you want though. If you want to wear multiple rings in your septum, this would be the way to go, but if you just want to wear a single piece of jewelry in a larger gauge, stacking isn't ideal, because the shape created by stacking is a different shape than the one created by using traditional methods.
These are just my experiences, in case that's something you'd be interested in doing."]
