['For the guys with kids of both sexes: Which kid was easier, the boy or the girl and why? And is it true that fathers love to spoil their daughters? 
 Just curious.', 'Yeah I agree too. The percentage is skewed because most "trans" people are just cis and hetero people with a kink for "being a lady with a dick" or "being a boy with a pussy"', 'Does anyone else feel the overall LGBT community can sometimes be a little selfish? 
 Sometimes when I'm scrolling through  Twitter and TikTok or even Instagram. I find like lgbt media like GLAAD or Out Magazine sometimes <ITALIC> obsess about everything lgbt (I know they center themselves about lgbt topics but let me explain).  

I was reading an article in Out Magazine about some anti-lgbt Christian organization set up some food bank stands at some park or rec center in Connecticut for Families struggling to buy groceries bc of COVID-19. Anyway some local lgbt center found out they were anti-lgbt and pretty much threw a fit at city hall or whatever and the state of Connecticut told the organization they had to leave. Idk if that organization moved somewhere else or something (it didn't say) but I just felt kinda bad. 

I mean yes they may not like or approve of gay/trans people but can't you just this 1 time with all this crap going on with COVID and people losing their jobs, can't you just let it slide. I mean their feeding families that can't afford groceries and homeless people. Why are you going to make their life harder just because you care about what a bunch of church people think about you?

Also when I go on Twitter and TikTok I see like 14 or 15 year old kids screaming about Trans rights or LGBT rights but when someone in the comments or replies and says something like 
"I agree with you but what about the fact that asians in America are facing intense racism and physical violence because their being accused of spreading coronavirus?" They delete the comment and block them. 

Idk I just feel like they need to stop being so forceful all the time. Yes, alot of people do suffer for being gay/trans. But if your some lucky teen/young adult and you had a overall not too bad of an experience when you came out/transitioned. Maybe just <ITALIC> SOMEtimes you take that activism and power towards someone else/another group who needs it. 

Just for clarification: I'm not coming after all gay and trans people. I'm coming for these so call "activists organzations". Like Trevor Project or GLAAD etc. I know their whole rhetoric is about all things LGBT, but again, why are you do you care what other groups of people think about you? If they aren't harassing you or anything just leave em. Like stop forcing every Tom, Dick, and Harry to agree with you. All they need to do at the very least is respect you. I personally don't care what a priest or whatever thinks of me.', "Anyone know a top surgery doctor (In NYC) that doesn't have a crazy long waiting list 
 Not planning it this second but when I do I'd like to know a good doctor. I live in NYC and I know the regulars like Dr. Bluebond Langner and Dr. Paul Weiss are really good but their waiting lists are like 2+ years which is NOT ok with me. Anyone know any surgeons in the NYC or even the Long island area to get the teet yeet slice. (Lol) I'd prefer a few months but no more than 1 year waiting list is still good. Btw I have pretty good insurance if that makes it any better."]

['Illya is very cute! Will keep her in mind for upcoming anime conventions =D.  Aiming for video game emphasis this time.', "I had a very similar experience.  Always told myself I didn't have dysphoria, but once I found euphoria, all of the dysphoria started to become much more clear and obvious.  It wasn't really that it wasn't there before.  It's that it was the norm and I couldn't recognize it was supposed to be different.", 'I actually meant more in person or people you know with calling out transphobic comments.  Trying to police anonymous corners of the internet is sort of a lost cause.

While I was still closeted, seeing my cousin call out my homophobic uncle gave me a lot of hope toward my own future.  So sometimes you might not even know you are directly affecting someone.', "I always thought I didn't have dysphoria before starting transition.  About three months into HRT was my first experience of crying about my body not being feminine enough.  Once you stop stacking more and more denial on top of a problem, you really start to uncover things you forgot were there.

So yes, what you are going through is totally normal in my experience."]

["To be fair, waving a hanky isn't as exciting to people now as it was 75 years ago. It's harder to make events unforgettable nowadays...", 'Honestly, I don't think anything associated with the Challenger disaster can correctly be called a "fun fact."', 'This is so sad. I'm sorry for your loss. My feeling is that in this situation time is your friend. I would just let your wife react and feel however she reacts and feels and focus on supporting her and showing love during this difficult time. 

Similarly to how people need time to adjust after missions but eventually return to their "normal" selves your wife will get through this time, at her own pace, and will eventually settle back into regular life. But she will remember how you treated her and acted during this time. You can come through this bonded more closely with her by doing thoughtful things and demonstrating unconditional love without judging her and her family's beliefs. When she is ready, she will trust you more because of your attitude now. 

It sounds like that's what you're already doing. I think she's lucky to have a husband like you.', "Ask her to listen to Bill Reel's Cognitive Dissidents podcast series. They are short and it's a series of only 12 or 13 but might open her eyes on using only emotion to confirm things. 

Or ask her to listen to even the first 10 episodes of A Year of Polygamy podcast series and have her pray for a confirmation that Joseph Smith was actually an evil person. Hopefully her own emotions will agree that he was."]

["I've never seen jojo but I can support this meme.", 'Depression or Dysphoria? 
 So I've had problems with depression pretty much my whole life. Like even in Kindergarten I  remember having days where I felt like I was some kind of unlovable freak. These days I'm on several antidepressants but I still have these episodes that seem to come out of nowhere. Like one minute I'm fine then the next I'm lying on the floor regretting my entire life, and then maybe a few hours later it will go away.

During these episodes my mind becomes consumed with thoughts like "I am completely and totally alone. Nobody loves me or even cares about me. If I were to drop dead right here, no one would even notice." Everything around me becomes just blurs and noises. If I'm working during one of these episodes it's like my body's on autopilot. I've had friends tell me I look like a zombie when this happens.

Physically it feels like my body suddenly becomes much heavier. Like I'm in my head and the rest of my body is just deadweight that I'm dragging around. Or like my body is actually just a costume  and I'm inside it and the costume is weighing down on me.

Since joining reddit I've seen a few people say that their depression turned out to actually be dysphoria. Is there any chance what I'm experiencing during these episodes is dysphoria?', "Ooh, those are much nicer than what I'm wearing. Mine are just plain fruit of the loom sports bras I bought off Amazon.", "Aawww, I was joking but I actually feel kinda bad now. I can't even be pretend upset with you. <ITALIC> I'm sorry."]

<HEADING>  Hysterectomy for dysphoria

I know they are gonna be upset when they found out and might even resent/do something about me using their insurance. Recently, I found out as a full time employee I could get health insurance. I'm not sure if it would cover hysto, should I look into switching?
2. Is there any way I can get a hysto on their insurance without them knowing?
3. I talked with my doctor about privacy she said it was more of an insurance question 
4. Bills are sent to their home (health insurance bills) 
5. I‚Äôm 21"]

['I have 4 now, my best grower is the dill', "Depression rant about my persistent pain 
 I might get a chance to take part in a program aimed at helping relieve my persistent pain, here in Australia. This sounds brilliant, right?

Well, there is only a 1 in 3 chance that it will have any effect on me at all. Also that maximum amount of relief is about 50% with an average of 30%.

I have Post Operative Neuropathic Pain from a surgery to decompress a nerve in my leg that was causing painful numbing. There is nothing that can magically sure me. I take pregabalin and Gabapentin daily as well as panadol osteo when the pain is especially bad. I'm unable to take codeine or Endone as it causes dreadful heartburn that makes me feel like I'm having a heart attack. Plus, there aren't any medical marijuana trials for persistent pain being conducted. (Trying to stay away from illegal means as there is a lack of regulation and I'm only interested in CBD, not THC).

I bought a shower chair just last week as I'm getting progressively worse, despite being on the highest dosage I can. Everything is spiralling around me and I just feel pathetic. My 27th birthday is next week and I can barely walk around my own home from the pain. I barely sleep. I'm pushing myself to keep up with uni as it is my only outlet and I'm only taking one class anyway.

Edit: I also can't have tramadol as it interferes with my anxiety medication. Who would have guess I was anxious? Haha

This turned into a huge rant. I just feel like life is leaving me behind as I sit here in continued agony, knowing that it will never be completely fixed.

On the plus side, my future kids will get to ride on my wheelchair and once I get my sticker I will be able to park close to the shop. Bit odd, but I need to keep smiling somehow.

Edit: I also can't have tramadol as it interferes with my anxiety medication. Who would have guessed I was anxious? Haha", "I use a wheelchair. I can walk. But I have fibromyalgia and it causes pain, as well as fatigue. I can't walk far. So the chair helps me get out in public, because staying home is depressing", 'Volume scroll between posts

['Soma is amazing - the fact that people regard it as one of the weaker tracks just shows how good Is This It really is', 'Daily Song Discussion - Entertain Me (The Great Escape) 
 Next song up in the discussions is the synth driven Entertain Me, and I‚Äôd call this track one of the more experimental songs the band has done so far. Like many other tunes on TGE the lyrics focus on boredom, as the narrator of the song describes a man who is unhappy unless he is drinking alcohol. Not even a girlfriend can seem to lift him out of his weariness and boredom.

Musically the song features some quite abrasive guitar playing from Graham, which along with the earlier mentioned synths help drive the song along. Alex‚Äôs bass work here is also sensational, and is almost certainly the highlight of the entire song.

Lyrical highlight: ‚ÄúA car, a house, both in a street, The boredom of a sober week‚Äù

Musical highlight: Bass work, synths

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>', 'Exactly. He suited DM well but I can‚Äôt really imagine him doing Cast No Shadow or Wonderwall justice.', "Daily Song Discussion - 1992 (13) 
 Next song up in the discussions is 1992, a song that dates back all the way to the days of Modern Life Is Rubbish. The song was recorded as a demo in 1992 (hence the title) but was lost until Damon found it on a tape six years later. The lyrics of the song do carry the trademark melancholy of the MLIR album, but are quite oblique and up for interpretation. Some have theorised that the song is a reflection on the breakdown of Damon‚Äôs relationship with Justine Frischmann, with the line ‚ÄúYou'd love my bed, You took the other instead‚Äù perhaps being the most direct reference to this.

Musically the song does bear some similarities to Blur‚Äôs MLIR-era material, but is overall much different from the songs of that time. The use of piano and drums at the time gives the song a sense of forward momentum, while Graham‚Äôs guitar playing becomes louder and more experimental as the song goes on. After the 2 minute mark the song becomes purely instrumental, and this very long outro provides a snapshot of how much of 13 will sound. Damon‚Äôs vocals are also worth mentioning, as he delivers some of the most heartfelt and sorrowful vocals we‚Äôve ever heard from him so far in Blur‚Äôs career.

Lyrical highlight: ‚ÄúWhat do you owe me? The price of your peace of mind, You'd love my bed, You took it all instead‚Äù

Musical highlight: Guitar work, drum work, piano

Best performers: Damon, Graham, Dave

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>"]

 He used to live with his wealthy parents in a suburb.

A couple years later I bought a place and he moved in with me. It's slightly better

Now I want to breakup with him, I cannot stand him anymore.

He's working as a server at a high class restaurant, but he wouldn't be able to live here unless he lives with others (roommates)

I don't think he would be able to fit in, and I don't want those poor innocent souls (his potential roommates) to suffer

['I miss them already, somehow. 
 I‚Äôll admit, I haven‚Äôt been watching TG/GT for very long. Last summer, my best friend asked if I wanted to watch Top Gear. ‚ÄúIsn‚Äôt Top Gear that silly British car show? I‚Äôm not much of a car person.‚Äù He convinced me to watch just one episode. Why not, I‚Äôll humor him. At the end of the episode, I had the biggest smile on my face. He asked me what I thought, but he can read me well enough to know that I wanted him to play the next episode. 

Each time a new episode of GT is released, he and I watch it together, usually paired with our favorite dinner foods. The platform that we know and love is gone, but I couldn‚Äôt be more excited about what the future holds. I‚Äôm going to miss the way it was, but I am so proud of what they have accomplished so far and I‚Äôm eagerly waiting to see what comes next. 

The past year or so has been absolute hell for me, but having my best friend and TG/GT in my life has made every day more bearable. It gives me something to look forward to every week, y‚Äôknow? The only thing I wish is that I could tell them in person how much their shows mean to me. 

I‚Äôm done ranting now - I needed to get that all off my chest. Thank you for reading, if you did. <3', 'Confused and a bit agitated 
 Host speaking! I‚Äôve been talking to my therapist for around a month about possibly being a system. She knows I have little to no control of switching and dissociative states (I can feel them coming on and sometimes can get to an isolated place where I‚Äôm safe). Still, she‚Äôs unsure of whether I‚Äôm actually a system or if this is a fantasy-based coping mechanisms. 

Even hearing her say it made me upset. I KNOW that she wants to exhaust all possibilities before jumping to conclusions and I respect that about her... but the fact that so little is known about dissociative disorders makes me very sad and angry. I just want to know more about what my brain is doing. I want a diagnosis, an explanation, ANYTHING to make me feel valid in what I experience. For now, I just feel like a fraud and a fake.', 'you are GORGEOUS and he doesn‚Äôt deserve you. now go chop his dick off.', 'they have no odor! which i‚Äôm very thankful for, because i‚Äôm super sensitive to smells.']

["How do you feel with the seasonal depression? 
 Seriously, I have never met so many people with seasonal depression as I have here in Melbourne. If I could hibernate all winter like a bear, Melbourne would be the best, but alas, it's so cold and bleak and grey. How do you guys deal with it? Occasionally I cheer up when I see someone wearing a funky colourful winter coat but other than that it really gets under my skin.

Edit: to all of the people telling me to toughen up - no.", "I'm sorry you had to go through that, but I'm glad that you've found someone who gets it.", "Nice people put others' needs above their wants, but don't let others put their wants above your needs.", 'I used to browse all the "wardrobe essentials" and "10 clothing items every woman needs" blog posts until I realised that there are a lot of staples that just don't work for me/my body/my vibe/my lifestyle. I love seeing others in glamorous dresses and heels, or a simple t-shirt with black skinny jeans and boots, but my personal go-to is a simple top, long flowy skirts, and shoes I can slip on and off easily. I encourage you to go on a little journey with yourself to discover what is going to work best for you so that you feel great, look great, and have a wardrobe that suits your day-to-day. Clothing really isn't one-style-fits-all!']

["It gets better. 
 Hey there friends and comrades. I want to share a message of positivity with you this evening/morning/whatever it is whenever and wherever you read this.

3 years ago, I was addicted to cocaine, alcohol, and painkillers. I was in a really dark place in my life. I was deeply depressed and my anxiety was through the roof. I swallowed a bunch of painkillers and drank way too much whisky in hopes of killing myself. It didn't work. Whether that was for a reason I was unsure. I moved cities a few times, always trying to escape myself, under the ruse of escaping a situation (abusive parents, abusive girlfriend, etc.) and while that may be true I came to the realization I was really just running from myself. Now fast forward a lot of pain and suffering and I'm at where I am. I'm currently laying next to a girl who I love with my entire existence. She's the one. As I listen to her snore, and feel her cuddle in a little closer to me, I realize how much better my life has gotten. I have amazing friends who have supported me through everything, a few family members left who truly care about me and a job I love. So please. If you're feeling depressed or even suicidal, hang in there. It gets better. Maybe not today, or tomorrow or the day after that. Hell it may take 3 years. But one day, the sun will rise on a new day and you're gonna be so glad you stuck around. And in case no one has told you, I am proud of you and I love you.", "Already Started Match 
 Can Infinity Ward introduce a mode where if there's less than say 20 kills left for a match to be done it can't be joined? I just joined 3 consecutive matches on Shipment 24/7 where I was in game for maybe a minute, fucking with my KDR", 'Parents 
 TW: rape, drugs, alcohol

My parents are extremely toxic. My dad put me through years of physical, verbal, mental, and emotional abuse. My mom just the verbal and mental. I'm 26 now and my mom is trying to have a better relationship with me. My dad will still barely say two fucking words to me. I refuse to call him my father cause that's no name he deserves. I went to his birthday this year as a semi peace offering. He said 3 words to me the whole dinner/dessert and would straight up ignore questions. When we were leaving the restaurant he was talking with our neighbours (family friends) and I hugged my family by. When I went to say bye to him he just straight up ignored me and kept talking.

I'm so fucking exhausted. Cause part of me doesn't give a fuck about my parents and don't give a shit if I have a better relationship cause they refuse to apologize for any wrongdoings. The most I've gotten is my mom said "I know we weren't the best parents" which is a huge understatement. But part of my just wants my parents back.

I haven't had a seemingly normal relationship with them since I came out as gay at 12 years old. I've been hooked on drugs, become an alcoholic, got clean+sober (I only drink about once a week now and it's usually a single beer), got raped by an ex, and they know nothing cause they don't wanna form a relationship with me.

When I left home they said itd be nice to have some time alone and basically blamed their toxic marriage on me. Now they take my baby sister on trips around the world almost constantly cause they can afford it now, as when I grew up we were poor af. Put food on the table, but barely.

Thinking or talking about my parents just makes me so exhausted and I can't help but to feel like I would be better off without them in my life.', 'Man that movie. It got dry in the middle but holy shit is that ending worth it']

["They/them, help with name 
 So someone on <SUBREDDIT> suggested I should come here for my question. I am genderfluid and my pronouns are they/them and I am searching for a new name since I don't feel like my current name is my own..I am looking for a more neutral and maybe a bit masculine name I had three names in mind that I like: Ace, Aiden and Zayn.. What do you all think? And any other suggestions?", "If you would go strictly by definition:

Bi: attraction towards 2 or more genders (can be both binary and nonbinary)

Pan: attraction regardless of gender

Tho they can be similar, especially if that person thinks there are only 2 gender, there are differences.

Pan people don't have a preference, they don't care about your gender and are genderblind

While bi people also can also not have preferences, that isn't always so.. Some bi people have preferences.

From what I read in the comments of you as well, this person thinks there are only 2 genders (correct me if I am wrong) Which would make her bi because this probably means she doesn't believe in those people and probably wouldn't date nb people (again, this is an assumption, correct me if I am wrong)

But she says she is genderblind as well and is bi, that's fine.. If she prefers the label bi even tho her definition also could say she is pan, she doesn't have to call herself pan.. 

But she is in no position to invalidate others because she believes they are fake.", "Yes you can be pangender, and you can feel one gender stronger than the others as well

If you want a more specific term, I recently came across plerugender.. but if you prefer pangender that's fine as well, just keep in mind you are valid no matter what you identify as :)", '[switch] Long term play mate 
 Hello! I am a 16y/o person and I am looking for a long term play mate on stardew valley, it will be seperate money and I prefer the four corner farm but that can be debated. I usually play around 7pm-10pm GMT+1 on weekdays and on the weekends I am available starting from 11am to around 10pm. And I am available almost everyday... I hope there is someone out there who would like to start a farm with me :)']

['The Sandy Tomb 
 I've been a bit hesitant to share this one as I usually like to be the hero in these stories but no one was entirely in the right here. This was a campaign run by Steve the Cleric from one of my <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>. The setup was pretty good, a call for heroes came out from a major port city on the edge of a desert country (don't question it) as an ancient tomb at the city's center suddenly became unlocked. The place is filled with undead, seems to reset every night and no one who's gone in has come out. Our job was to get in and make it stop being unlocked before the undead decide to leave. For the record, we were using a slightly looser 3.5 ruleset.

Sorry if this whole thing is a bit disjointed, I am a man with bad memory working off memories of a game from 5-7 years ago that wasn't much fun.

Enter the player characters:  
My first ever joke character and second TTRPG character ever, Gnomish Tuba Bard Katzmcgee Waffletoff, later replaced by raciest High Elf Sorcerer Ezekial Ravadera

My stepdad's worst character ever, the elf... something, Carzan

A halfling druid and human cleric who's names I have forgotten because they aren't important

and The Guide, human ranger/sorcerer and the only genuinely fun character to come out of this story.

So, the party get together and head into the tomb, all of the doors are double wide and open by swivling at the middle, creating two smaller doorways. A couple of rooms in, Katz finds a basket of undead bees, they attack him, of course, and Carzan just shuts and spikes the door, leaving him to die. Somehow, he didn't die but I was still mad about it. When Katz asked Carzan why he did that Carzan replied "I'm an elf you know". This quickly became Carzan's catchphrase. It was bad.

Our first expidition into the tomb ended with the party finding a pair of urchins who had somehow survived inside overnight and trying to convince them to go with us, Katz was an incompetent bard and could not inspire courage, my realization of this is what led to him being replaced after the first session with my own elf, who was the worst. Also, Carzan kidnapped one of the kids and forced him to basicly be his boyservant.

Enter Ezekial Ravadera (henceforth known as Zeke) who's first act as a player character was to watch his own mother be stabbed and then disperce the guards she'd brought along to find the culprit, loot her corpse and then leave, never to care again. He was the edgiest character I've ever played by far. Zeke was specialized in social manipulation magic because I thought it would be interesting, low and behold, every enemy was either undead or elemental for the entire campaign and every one of the very few NPCs he interacted with had an exceptional bonus to will saves and the ability to detect spells being cast on them at any range. Additionally, after an incident where he drank a tiny water elemental like a fucking idiot, Zeke became the exclusive target of every single elemental we came across the rest of the campaign, they were DEDICATED to killing him and only him. We never found out why.

The human cleric was soon replaced by a dwarf cleric for reasons I have forgotten, his introduction to the party happened around the same time as Zeke's, which is to say: moments before a guard made a passive agressive remark towards Carzan, prompting the elf to kill the guard, which attracted more guards, so Carzan sat down and called for guards. Zeke and the dwarf slinked away together even though they were both raciest against eachother, prefering to be with eachother rather than near Carzan.

Once Carzan, The Guide and our druid were done dispatching like 10 guards they retrieved the rest of us and we elected to return to the tomb as a group. For reasons I forget Zeke had a yellow rose tatoo on the back of his hand that glowed on contact with things he already knew were magical and I thought this was a cool trait. In my defense, I was like 14 at the time. After this ground breaking revelation, the new dwarf suggested using his pickaxe to make some temporary shortcuts for us, only to find that EVERY wall and door of the entire tomb had an inner layer of some kind of indestructable, non-magical, heat proof metal that was entirely structurally stable in spite of being paper thin. 

That was really the last event that occured before the campaign just kinda stopped, because everyone had a bad taste in their mouths and the only character liked by anyone other than their player was The Guide.




TLDR: Everyone was bad, I was among the worst and the campaign fizzled out.', "Strange repositioning issue 
 So, replaying the whole series recently, I found that I can't reposition units before a battle starts in the second game, but this problem only applies to Rook's crew, I can reposition members of the ravens just fine. Is there any kind of explanation for this?", 'Whenever you make toast there will be a single eye on each side of the bread, the eyes always turn to look at you, this does not effect your ability to consume the toast in any way.', "In my case? when the DM messages you between sessions to try and force a romance subplot on you, even though you're playing the most hateful member of the party."]

['This. I do not choose to pursue the "feeling" that others say they experience. If it is God's Will through the Holy Spirit, I shall experience it. If I do not, so be it.

This all being said, I felt something I never have before when I entered my first Catholic (Tridentine Latin) Mass after attending Wesleyan services for all my childhood and early adulthood. The first mass made me absolutely BALL my eyes out as I witnessed what was true majesty and God's beauty gifted to earth. I felt... Something I never had before, and I am convinced the Holy Spirit came upon me to declare "this is the tune that shall ring in you". And so, I shall continue to listen. My spiritual and intellectual realms have expanded tremendously since the start of my journey, and I could not be more thankful for the sensations I have been gifted with.', 'Christianity has never sorted out the question of whether the Church or state has more political authority. Islam is an example of a religion in which the Church and the state were the same concept--you were governed by the policies of the faith. In Christianity though, the pendulum has swung for centuries. Roman Emperor Constantine's call for the Council of Nicea in 325 AD gave the political ruler the power. When the Western Roman Empire collapsed, the Papacy in Rome became the de -facto political authority. Meanwhile in the Eastern Roman (or Byzantine) Empire for much of its time, the Patriarch of Constantinople was appointed by the emperor. 

The West constantly had this problem. (Read about the "Investiture Controversy", which was a standoff between the Pope and Holy Roman Empire over who has the authority to "invest" Holy Roman bishops with their positions.) The question of what is the Faith's relationship to politics remains unanswered today in the form of "separation of church" as a concept, and secularization. It is a question that will likely never be answered, just like "what is the ideology of the Christian?"', 'That would make this election flip even more than it already has. The chaos would be rich.', 'Thanks so much, I now have my answer! :D']

['Okay thanks! Maybe I‚Äôll email the vet to be safe!', 'Love it! Hope you wear it dancing. That looks very excellent for twirling.', 'Planning on coming out to my partner as non-binary tonight gahhhhh 
 I am very nervous about it but I think it‚Äôs time! I‚Äôve been working with my counselor on this. I‚Äôm not quite sure what to say. I think he will be supportive but it‚Äôs also a lot to process so I‚Äôm not sure. It‚Äôs confuuuuuusong and a bit nerve wracking.

We‚Äôve been together 6 years. I came out as bi about a year ago and he was supportive. But this is a bit different! I buzzed my hair, and I have a binder, though I haven‚Äôt worn it around him yet.

Could use any good vibes (or advice!) you have to share!', 'Any other trans or non-binary folks here? 
 Hey all,

I posted on some LGBT groups, but thought you all might help. I‚Äôd posted on here before in a throwaway. Anywho, I‚Äôm hoping some fellow enbys or trans folks might be able to offer advice on chest binding safely.

I have mystery chronic hip and back pain. It seems like it is some sort of musculoskeletal issue, but possibly psoriatic arthritis. I have developed mild scoliosis in my low back from whatever is causing this extreme muscle tension. Recently started with a rheumatologist who is great and started PT today and he is also great.


My first binder arrived today woot! But I want to make sure I don‚Äôt worsen anything. I‚Äôm a bit nervous to ask my doctor about this. I am completely judging him with no basis for it and definitely being ageist, but he is in his 60s and I‚Äôm worried he won‚Äôt really be understanding or open about binding. My new PT seems great, but it‚Äôs just nerve wracking to talk about.

I know no one can give medical advice but I‚Äôm curious if anyone has experience with this. Or if you have tips for approaching this with my healthcare team? I really just want to have a flatter chest and am worried my flipping hip and back will ruin that.

Thanks for any advice!']

['My wife was really grumpy after we went shopping together and a dress she really liked looked way better on me than her XD', 'Sorry I don't know an answer to your original question, but:

What do you mean by "tried becoming unstuck"?  Is there some method to reboot boob growth if it plateaus?', 'The first season is incredible in all aspects.  The second is an amazing concept piece.  The third feels more like a victory lap.', 'One thing that usually gets past my "they're just trying to be nice" filter is when a cis woman expresses interest or jealousy over something feminine I have/do.

Examples:  
- My wife regularly complains when we find cute clothing that looks better on me than on her (almost always because of a large difference in bust size).  
- I frequently get asked where I get my hair done, or if I have a perm (I have natural curly hair, shout out to <SUBREDDIT> for making it look good).  This often comes with some comment like "I wish I had hair like that"  
- I've gotten asked about what makeup I use by cis women, or where I found articles of clothing

The other thing that can't really be controlled is just genuine reactions.  Before I was out, I was dressed as a woman for a halloween party, and I had a male friend turn around and say "dammit, I keep thinking you are a chick" on multiple occasions through the night.  Another was when a homeless person called me "ma'am" while I was dressed androgynously.

So I guess my advice is to find feminine things she has/does better than you, and express that you wish you had/could do that thing.']

Down there they found a dead body floating in a stagnant area under the train bridge. When I was a freshman we not only did the canoeing unit, but we went back to that spot under the bridge. <HEADING> 2: when I was in the 5th grade my mother told me about a boy whos siblings were about my age (I don't think I went to school with them, but I can't remember. Four of our close friends have said that they will not come over while he is home, and we like to entertain, when we‚Äôre not social distancing.

The lease ended yesterday. We put an extra lock on the door that ensures it can‚Äôt be opened from the outside. He‚Äôs been trying to tell my fianc√©e that he‚Äôs going to be living here for the rest of the month but we‚Äôre not taking the lock off when he gets here no matter what he says. ['Jesus fucking christ how STUPID can people be', "Being enby is difficult lol 
 Im afab. For a little while, in the beginning of all the questioning, i thought I was a guy. I thought I was a trans man. It made sense, I've never really felt like a girl, so I must be a guy, right? I was so confused. I'm non binary and I just didnt have a word for it. I have always been uncomfortable being on the outside. I've always just wanted to fit in. I think, in a way, if I had been a trans guy, I would have fit in, at least among other trans dudes. I dont mean this in any offensive way, but being enby is just so different. Yes, I'm sure there are some people in the world who feel the same as me, but for the most part? I'm on my own. I'm a complete anomaly and I really dont like that. I've always wanted to color in the lines but that's always been hard for me, ya know? I've just never <ITALIC> really fit in anywhere. But that's because I tried to be like them, rather than finding people who would like me regardless. I tried to shove myself into a box that I didn't fit in so that someone would look at me like I was normal. But all I've done is make it harder for myself to be me because now those folks are going to realize that I'm not who they think I am.", "There are not a lot of scientific studies of the effects of marijuana on the adolescent brain, but common consensus is marijuana stunts growth and causes problems with memory down the road.

["How to keep singing (as a paid performer) with mental health issues? \n I'm lucky enough to get regular gigs at a nearby cabaret bar and so far have absolutely adored it, but during the past few weeks I've gotten a bit depressed and no longer feel any pleasure in singing. It's absurd because singing has been my passion since I was a child, but now I just feel like I want to cancel all the gigs I'm booked in for an give up. My boss is very serious about committing to the gigs you're given so I know I can't just cancel, but I don't have time to put together new material and every time I try to rehearse my regular material I just can't stand to listen to it anymore. I feel like my voice is suffering and my confidence along with it, which it like a negative cycle because without the confidence I can't hit the notes I used to. Has anyone else been in this position? What should I do?", "Journaling made a huge difference bc it helped me keep track of how I'm feeling and not just exist on autopilot. I also think going for a little walk outside everyday or even just sitting in the sun can be really beneficial. Eating properly/sleeping properly/exercise is like the triad of feeling better but isn't always easy to do when you're having a low time, but try to create good habits when you are able bc it helps when you're not. Another thing is I always make sure I have these things in my bag - lip balm, tissues, breath mints, water, comb, earrings, scarf. This way when I'm in a low if I leave the house feeling like shit and realise on the train that I'm dehydrated, got dry lips, didn't brush my hair/teeth, whatever, I can fix myself up and feel a little better.", 'People who got back with their ex after a few years apart, what happened?', 'The protagonist of Throne of Glass is tough, yet still loves fashion, beautiful things and smutty romance novels! I got a kick out of it. Also, not a protagonist but Nina from Six of Crows duology is pretty girly.']

["It will end because at some point your body will stop incessantly demanding extra calories to not only run what it needs to run but also fix any damage done during restriction. Plus it's possible your intestinal system has slowed down (gastroparesis) which is muddling hunger cues - this also resolves itself. 

The ED Institute has a few articles on it. <LINK>


<LINK>

From what I've read weight gain goes faster earlier in recovery than later, and I don't remember the speed but I don't think it's the speed that the average person would call exploding. Technically if it does explode into 10 pounds of actual weight a week (not that that's possible) until your weight restored that'd just sort of be a real world hack for making recovery go faster, even if it does suck in other ways. 

Anyhow, the hunger cues are messed up because your body needs calories. 6k-8k a day is common, and I've seen 12k a day on other posts. Good luck and I hope you feel better soon.", 'Finally see someone saying an area even remotely like Ohio, thank you', "The unemployment we have now is only going to get worse, and the money from the federal government isn't planned to be a monthly thing. Maybe we should get the mayor/local government to freeze rent? 
 I mean, rent will have to be frozen if this goes on long enough (and it will go on for a while) without that government check money coming monthly. We really can't have a worse homeless epidemic in the middle of a pandemic. Not everyone has paid time off or paid sick leave. Plus local businesses are going to have to try to afford \*their\* rent while having much less business (a lot of people go to Angel Falls to sit down, not to carry something out, and it's not exactly a franchise). What should we do?", "In Akron, not as bad as bigger cities elsewhere but not good either. First protest was fine for hours and the mayor even agreed with us, then someone was run over by accident (they're okay) and all hell broke loose. A coffee shop burnt down. There's more graffitti than usual in Highland Square and some stickers from nazis around too. At least people were social distancing at first.

I'm still shocked they tear gassed people in Akron and Columbus. Columbus may be a big city but every Ohio city and town is sleepy in its own way. If they were personified they'd automatically have -10 points to Charisma. It's OHIO for fucks sake. It can't be that hard to manage a protest. 

A friend online got tear gassed in Nashville for no reason. They weren't violent in the least until that happened and from his description I'd fight someone who tear gassed me too."]

TBH I think the worst insults are those who are wrapped up as compliments or sympathy.', 'At least dairy is very genetic, and it is very individual how much is ¬´too much¬ª. Look at the traditional diets/kitchens of your ancestors to find out what amount and products you are likley to tolerate in your diet. Start there and experiment to find out what is good for you. 

Some general/simplified notes: People of scandinavian ancestry usually tolerate dairy very well. It was almost the only thing their ancestors had to eat during the winters, so they are adapted for a dairy heavy diet. Europeans generally handle dairy well, but some people only tolerate certain amounts, and fermented products like yoghurt are a lot easier on digestion than ¬´normal¬ª unfermented milk. In the middle east and India, fermented products are common, but drinking a glass of milk is not too common (harder on digestion and spills quickly in heat). In southeast Asia, dairy products have traditionally not been a big part of the diet. Sub saharan Africa is HUGE and there are big local variations depending on whether farming cattle has traditionally been common or not. 

This map gives some indication on local variations today, but it may still tell us something about how common dairy was traditionally:
<LINK>', 'I wish I looked that cool at that age.']

['It is allowed as it is my only choice and chance to become who I want to be, who I feel inside.', 'Please keep posting updates! You are such an inspiration to me and what I can become. You already pass far better than I ever could imagine I would! Your face structure is similer to mine and it gives me so much hope! Thank you!', 'Summer is a strong woman yet keeps herself grounded to the earth and nature. Her service to her country proves her strength as she walks, head held high and proud, through deserts in places far away. Farther than she ever thought she would ever go as a child. After returning from deserts far and foreign to a desert familiar to her, the desert she calls home, the Sonoran Desert. A place barren yet teeming with hidden life, a place where her neighbors greet Summer with a cheerful and bright "Morning Miss Summer!". She has grounded herself there striding through the deserts on her hikes with long and graceful steps only stopping to fish at her favorite fishing hole for awhile. She often sets her pole among some rocks to hold it so she can read her newest book while she keeps an eye on her pole at her peripheral. She loses herself in her book until its late. "I had better get my pretty little self back home" she thinks. She changes her mid though once she see\'s the sun reflecting off the water, she decides to draw the scene in front of her, the shimmering water reflecting the brightly painted sky, the propped up pole, all of the beauty nature offers her. She draws it all, tip of her tongue barely sticking out of her shapely lips  in concentration. Its finished at sunset, "One of my best works" she laughs out, her laughter ringing out and echoing like a silver bell over a frozen lake. She gathers her things and leaves with the sun at her back, an amazonian goddess striding through desolation, as beautiful and deadly as the desert itself, "I think I will bake something for dessert tonight" she thinks to herself as she nears her car, back-lit by purples and blues bordered by deep reds, she cuts a gorgeous figure. "But what to make? A pie, a cake, cookies..." she softly says melodically as her voice trails away as she leaves.', 'Yes it is a bit of a tight spot and has been complicated by so many other personal things. Not being independent sucks but at least I do have people I can talk to. Thank you for the well wishes <USER>!']

["Wierd reaction? 
 So ever since I started wearing liquid foundation, I've always had this issue that if I put it on my lower neck/chest, I get hives. It's fine on my face or if I put it on my arms or legs, and I've tried everything from different brands to organic makeup and even changing up application methods. The hives go away after an hour or two. Doesn't happen with primer or powder.

['(SPOILERS) Hell's Kitchen Power Rankings - Episode 9 (Dec 14) 
 Hello again, everyone. I hope you had a fantastic week and are preparing for a wonderful holiday season. It was a rather predictable episode this time 'round, with one major exception. Rankings are starting to get much tougher because there's no longer any contestants I would classify as consistently poor performers. Without any further sentences, let's do this. Note - there's no "last time" rank beside the name this time, because there were no rankings last week.

<ITALIC> What this is: If you didn‚Äôt catch these earlier in the season, these are my power rankings after each episode. It‚Äôs essentially who I believe to be the strongest down to the weakest. These do not necessarily reflect who I think is going home next, and aren't scientific or insider-y. Without further ado, let's get going! (Spoilers for the entirety of the most recent episode, obviously)




<BOLD> 1 - Ariel

The longer this series has gone on, the more Ariel has impressed in nearly every way. She's a strong leader, a consistently good performer in both challenges and service, and seems to be fairly popular in the "personality contest."

<BOLD> 2 - Motto

Consistently underrated to this point, Motto has been very consistent to the point where I can easily see him going to the final two or three. <STRIKE> He's also younger and seems to learn well, which is always a plus.

EDIT: He's not as young as I thought, but he still shows a great will to learn. 

<BOLD> 3 - Mia

There have been recent slips in consistency lately, and the leadership side of things hasn't been going as easily as it seemed it would have earlier in the season. Still though, a strong candidate for black jackets.

<BOLD> 4 - Jose

He almost got sent home, but I think the potential he's shown so far made him easily the safest bet of the three to stick around.

<BOLD> 5 - Bret

He's gotten more consistent as time's gone on, but he'll just have to have a few more shining moments to really take him further. I think black jackets are very possible though. Also, the punishment pass reference by the editors was superb.

<BOLD> 6 - Kanae

Kanae is still a big personality that clearly has a ton of talent, but she's yet to have the overwhelmingly positive nights like Mia or Motto have had, or the subtle compliments that Jose has seen.

<BOLD> 7 - Heather

Heather's been much more consistent lately than around the start of the show, but she's still had those shaky moments, which is very dangerous when veterans are on a shorter leash.

<BOLD> 8 -  Trev

If Trev makes black jackets, I'll be very impressed. That said, his team's patience for his personality seems to be wearing thin. I can see him going further than it seems though.

<BOLD> E - Scotley

I've spoken about Scotley's bullying enough in previous lists, so I'll keep it short here. I think it was the right call to send him home.




As always, if you disagree/agree with me, please let me know below. Enjoy the upcoming holiday season!', 'If you‚Äôre surprised by this, you weren‚Äôt paying attention. Love him or hate him, he‚Äôs been pretty consistent about who he is.

Okay, fairly sure I phrased that neutrally enough so no one will yell at me..', 'This feels unfair to the Ghosty Adventures games tbh', 'Guess Who? - Mod Announcement 
 Hey everybody!

I'm guessing it's been a while since you've seen this pop up in your feed, whether it be in the "new" section or otherwise. Actually, this subreddit has been dead for quite some time. It was set to "restricted," and the majority of the posts were, I assume, by the old mod - someone who has since deleted their reddit account. So, I've decided that this community, and this character/world, deserve better.

So, who am I? I'm Kat! Happy to see you back now that we're public again in here. I'm also the moderator over at <SUBREDDIT> and am one of the two moderators over at <SUBREDDIT>. My immediate plan is to mostly start over this as if it was a brand new community, albeit with you folks already here. I'd love to see this grow! 

As a final note, rules will be modified over the next few days, as will the New Reddit design of the subreddit, which is something I've already started working on. There will be a megathread for sharing both classic episodes and ones from the new 2016 series.

(\*If you're on "Old Reddit," I may make some changes, but I'll likely leave it pretty much as it looked before unless you make a specific request.)

Thanks for reading, and here's to the future with this community!

EDIT: Flairs are going to be a thing here soon, so if you have any ideas for the list, let me know!']

['How to properly dispose of empty T vials / how to get rid of empty T bottles 
 I volunteered with syringe exchange programs for many years now. At syringe exchange programs, we learn the proper way to dispose of used needles, syringes and biohazards. I also have a degree in public health. Putting empty glass vials of used medications in syringe containers is an appropriate way to get rid of some thing that A: will be sharp if it breaks and B: should not be put in a regular landfill where the medication can get into the ground water.

Again, glass vials of testosterone will be sharp if they break in a regular trashcan. This puts waste management workers at risk of injury. Do not throw your empty small breakable glass vials of testosterone in the garbage.

Additionally, testosterone can be absorbed through the skin if you come in contact with it. It is also an environmental pollutant that can affect wildlife. Do not put it in a landfill where it can get into the soil/groundwater. Putting it in your sharps container where it can be safely incinerated with other medical waste is appropriate.

You can also use alternate containers than sharps containers if you have no other option and are looking for a way to safely get rid of your used sharps. Look for a bottle made of thick plastic that cannot be punctured by needles. I would recommend laundry detergent bottles because they are large, easy to find, and very sturdy. I have also heard of others using thick plastic milk cartons. Make sure to duct tape the lid shut when you are done using it. Write biohazard on the container in large letters so that others know not to open it. Dispose of it in the same locations as you would a regular sharps container.', 'Applied for 3 jobs today! 
 I applied for 3 different jobs today! I‚Äôve been putting it off for a long time. I haven‚Äôt been working due to mental/physical health problems for the past few months, so it‚Äôs a big step for me to get back into the workforce. I even wrote cover letters. Fingers crossed I get a call back, sounds like they are all urgently hiring so my chances are good.', 'I love your energy! V funny, 10/10 chef kisses', 'Considering not interviewing for a job because of being outed in an email 
 This happened to me yesterday. A colleague outed me in an email of a job referral. I let him know I was trans the first time we met. He shared that I am trans when giving me a referral to the HR person at his homelessness shelter for a job. I‚Äôm open about it so I don‚Äôt necessarily mind him mentioning it. The wording of makes me really uncomfortable though. Edit: for context, I have a public profile photo of myself on my gmail account and my LinkedIn.

He also mentioned I am the son of a donor to the shelter. I have proven my merits by actually working with him on a previous project, regardless of my dad‚Äôs financial support of the shelter. (More info below the TL; DR). Here‚Äôs a paraphrasing of the recommendation email:

‚ÄúHe recently transitioned so  appearance might catch you just for a second. Son of [my dad] who is major donor to [the shelter].‚Äù

TL; DR I feel really skeaved out about the wording of the recommendation email. Idk if I want to work with his organization after hearing this from him. Thoughts? The shelter job would pay $4 per hour better than the one I was just offered at a hotel, 




Context: the director of the shelter and I have know each other professionally for about 6 months. Last spring I evaluated a public health grant program that partially funds a homelessness shelter in my town. I ensured that the homelessness shelter have the data to back up this program that provides $5000 in sponsorship money each year. In the process of doing this research, I interviewed the director of the shelter. So this director knows me and my work directly, not just through my dad.']

["My team and I created a concept to improve aftercare for abuse victims, coould you help me by saying if you like the concept or not (and maybe why you like/dislike it) 
 The concept idea is to create an exhibition of garments  called ‚Äò‚ÄôDARC‚Äô‚Äô that visualize and represent the stories of domestic abuse victims who have been in an abusive relationship. With each clothing piece the audience can hear the corresponding stories of the victims; their experiences, feelings and emotions endured during this period. As well as information that provides facts, research and numbers that substantiate the topic, which educates the audience on the topic of abuse further. The premise is to educate the audience on how to recognize abuse and how to act when identifying abuse. The goal is to improve the aftercare for abuse victims and their overall mental wellbeing.   
This exposition is in collaboration with GGZ, their victims, Raf Hermens and museum de Pont. The goal of this curated exhibition is to open conversation regarding the topic, put light on the experiences, as well as educating the audience on what measures they can take to help. 

During the exhibition, upon hearing a story at every stop, the audience will get the option to answer questions regarding the topic. This data will be collected and used to measure the social impact of the goal; improve the quality of life and after care of the victims.  After going through the exhibition, the audience is welcomed into the museum shop where they get the opportunity to donate to Veilig Thuis by purchasing a token, Veilig Thuis is an organization that helps victims. The profit made with DARC will also go to this organisation. Furthermore, the audience will receive a form where they can fill in feedback on how we can ensure that this is a good experience. 

<BOLD> Impact: To recognize abuse and knowing how to act on recognizing abuse.

We would be very grateful if you'd commented, with kind regards!", 'So this is like a first world problem. But what if your poo became invisable. Like if you wiped you wouldn‚Äôt know if everything was clean...', 'my team and I are working on a concept to improve aftercare for abuse victims and are wondering if people would like this idea. could you please help us by saying what you like or not?

Back story

They are terrible to put it straight. My family is kinda f'd up. My mother is great but she doesn't understand. My best friend is American, older then me and studies psychology on the side. So, I attempted suicide on Christmas day, but I didn't do it because of my bff. Family didn't even notice. I've been to a&e before for it but they sent me home because they didn't have enough beds. I hurt myself a lot, I smashed my head into my wall and, quote from the convo, it was because 'Actually its because I wanted to break my skull opened so I could die in the way I was supposed to. Bloody and painfully.' I want to murder someone. I think one of my family, my mom probably. I love her but still. I'm not sure what to do. I hear and see things and its getting MUCH worse. My friend said I should do the CAMHS live thing and try to get to the psych ward. Any advice? Idk what to do. Thank you all.

TL:DR I'm suicidal, murderous [?] And hear/see things. Its getting worse and I might have to go to the hospital.", "Hospital?

["I just started the fourth week of my masters program and I'm really liking my classes. My favorite though has to be my class on Constantinople from Constantine the Great to Suleiman the Magnificent. So far we have gone through a brief history of the city but the class is soon going to take a more thematic approach by examining various aspects of the city such as provisioning the city, the Great Palace, relics and icons, churches and monasteries and finishing up with the transition under the Ottomans.\n\n I've learned a lot of interesting things about the city. For example, today I learned about the differences between the Latin (Crusader) Imperial and Venetian sections of the city. The Venetian section of Constantinople saw more economic and urban growth, while the Latin Imperial section saw decline and little to no restoration efforts. I'm really excited to learn more about the city.", "Seeing this glorious icon of Saint Jiub and finding Young Scroll's SAINT (EP) are just signs from the universe telling me to get Morrowind again.", "They had a signup on their website and I applied to it months ago. ['Is Contra anti-non-binary?

 The Contraversy has really blown up and I‚Äôm angry. As an enby I hate pronouns circles too in some circumstances. In trans specific spaces I‚Äôm all for it. But I‚Äôm very private about my gender identity and mostly hope to be read as male (I‚Äôm AFAB and taking blockers, still deciding re hormones). ["what's so bad about looking at a flag that says someone is happy to be who they are even though people hate them for it that it made you feel the need to complain about it", 'FH4 has the details in place for lootboxes which could include entire cars in them. 
 Maybe I'm just being paranoid, but I noticed this stuff and I found it really concerning, and even more so that I hadn't seen a post about it yet. Demo otherwise has been great aside from stuttering the longer I play it in typical PC port fashion; driving is solid, visuals are outstanding as usual, cars seem to sound better than FH3, and I love love <ITALIC> love the roads.

However, some screenshots I captured in the garage really worry me. <LINK> Here, I show the rarity details listed on two of the cars in the garage and on the horns, with the McLaren labeled "legendary" with an orange rarity and the Lancia labeled "epic" with a purple rarity. What I didn't picture are the blue cars all being labeled with a "rare" rarity. I just don't see why cars would be labeled with the same rarity system as horns and various cosmetics other than lootboxes, considering gaming trends. It could possibly be a change to wheelspins (which were already shit and stupid to begin with) but I feel like a rarity system in wheelspins is so out of left field, and nothing anybody asked for, or at least not any time I've seen, that it wouldn't make sense to spend time implementing when they're already having to delay features like the route creator to finish them. (source <LINK>/)

If cars are packaged in purchasable lootboxes with real currency then I honestly am thoroughly impressed by the cynicism of Microsoft and their subsidiaries. How could you make a game in your beautiful home country as this wonderful passion project and have the gall to spit on your consumers as you do it? This is, of course, in addition to other contemptuous practices like day 1 pre-order DLC and car passes that, assuming they follow the same standards. don't include all cars, and also a season pass.

Depending on how lootboxes are implemented into this game, I might not find it absolutely gross. I mean, I think implementing gambling to exploit people that lack self control is gross too, but if it ends up being unobtrusive and only affects shit like horns and player cosmetics then it's pathetic but I can get by, especially with the route creator supposedly being so robust. But if this game harps at me constantly like most Microsoft-published games do about their DLC and microtransactions then I'd be happy to refund a purchase and do something else. It'd be a pretty bold move on Playground's part as well considering the potential for a very difficult market in their home in the EU following Belgium and the Netherland's legislation on this form of gambling in games.

We'll see what happens. Maybe Playground will have something to say about this, but I'm not thrilled about this stuff. Considering Turn 10 has been nothing but stiff and dismissive with criticism and concern over FM7, its launch, optimization, and its monetization, I'm concerned to see how that attitude may stem to their child studio. Apologies for the wall of text, but I found this worth covering. Here's hoping this game with such immense potential doesn't turn itself into a cynical joke.', 'I love the giants so fucking much, this is sick as fuck!!!', 'What is this death??? 
 I cried so hard at that moment. I still feel horrible. Oathbringer really fucked with my emotions.

FUCK MOASH FUCK MOASH FUCK MOASH FUCK MOASH']

["[Fluff] Tummy Friendly Celebration Cake. 
 This is a recipe I have used on multiple occasions for dogs that have sensitive stomachs or are very picky. It is a big hit, is gluten free, low fat, only has 3 ingredients, safe for humans and is very easy to make.

Ingredients

<ITALIC>  One mango, size of cake will depend on how big your mango is.
 One egg.
* Enough oat four to make a thick batter around 1/4-1/3 cup.

Method

<ITALIC>  Pre heat oven to 180C (350F)
 Mash mango well to sightly chunky consistency.
<ITALIC>  Add egg and mix well.
 Add oat flour till a thick batter is reached.
<ITALIC>  Line an appropriately size baking dish and bake until a skewer in the middle comes out clean or with only a few crumbs (45-60 minutes).
 Cool and serve, serves around 3-4 depending on dog size.

Today's batch is for my rescue dog Bones who is celebrating his one year arrival day (the day he came  home to me)", "It was great for about a year but I started feeling like an idiot and now that I've come off it and been off it for a while I realize that I'm not the angry, impatient person I felt like.", 'True, this person clearly never grew out of it.', "TW: The way eunuchs were made was an act of extreme violence.

Young boys were taken from their homeland and castrated without any pain relief, sometimes the penis was also removed and as such the eunuchs carried porcupine quills in their turbans so they could urinate.

['You girls are amazing! Omg soo cute! ‚ù§', "Thank you for the advice!‚ù§
I'm working on growing my hair out as well", "I love all of you and your support 
 This community has helped me a lot, and I'm still on the road to myself, I'm struggling because I think I'm giving myself excuses to not transition, and I do believe I am actually transgender now, I just pushed it down for so many years with drugs and trying to make a failed relationship work (8 years)... Now I'm off drugs and alcohol, im free of a restricting relationship and all I can think is how happy id be if only I were female

Ita a scary road in which I feel fearful of not passing, and just overall getting unwanted attention. It's not like my male presentation is bad its just not feeling right..

I guess this is more of a journal log for myself", 'In high school I didnt know what was going on with me, so I smoked weed and drank alcohol to "fit in" and cope, I purged clothing a lot, and then got more. I was very much attracted to women and still am so I thought I just had a "kink"  so I moved in with my girlfriend and we lived together for 8 years, 3 years in I had reoccurring dreams that I was a woman, I was so depressed when I woke up and it wasnt a reality. I told her about these dreams and she said if thats what I was she couldn't be with me anymore, I didnt want to give up on our relationship and our "stability" so I insisted it was only dreams and thats not me, so I pushed it down. The years became harder, I became way less attentive as a lover and person in general, I isolated. I smoked weed as soon as I got home from work and just sat mindlessly. She cheated on me a year ago, we broke up. Yesterday was my first appointment with a gender therapist and I was diagnosed with gender dysphoria. I'm scared but excited for the future. I'm 30, and I wish I did this sooner.']

['Thrift stores are great.  I do most of my shopping at good will.  It oddly enough has way better selection than the mall at way cheaper prices and is very trans friendly.

I can relate to the other issue though.  I had a sundress I bought that sat in my closet for probably 1-2 years before I finally wore it out in public.  It did kind of make me anxious when I saw it in there, wanting to wear it and pull it off so badly, but not having anywhere near the confidence to do it.

It sounds like you at least have a safe place at your SOs where you could prep for a night out at some point.  I've always found it way easier to present female when nobody knows me, so maybe choose somewhere that you won't run into friends/family that you aren't out to.

I also did the Halloween/cosplay crossdressing "as a joke" to get more comfortable with presenting female in public.', 'I just wanted to relate to the over-acceptance thing.  The management at my company seems to be in a pissing contest over who is more woke.  Constantly asking people what their preferred pronouns are.  Pretending our customer base is like 50% female, 25% LGBTQ, using "customer profiles" of non-binary people, when in reality our base is 90% cis male.

As someone who is definitely trans, but not ready to be out yet, it's real upsetting to have to keep answering "he/him" when that's not what I want to answer, but I don't want all the attention and pressure of coming out yet.

Rant over, let's focus on you.

Have you tried telling your bosses to chill?  It sounds like they are trying to be supportive, and not realizing that being too aggressive about it is affecting you negatively.  If they are trying this hard to be supportive, I'm sure they will be willing to try to scale back for you.  I think a lot of cis people don't realize that trans people don't want a ton of attention on them.  They just want to live a normal life as their preffered gender.', "You'll get there!  It's a hard road to walk, but it's worth it.", 'Nier might be fun.  Overwatch does have a lot of cute characters, but they tend to be quite complicated, especially Mercy who is my favorite =p']

['Thanks for the information! I really appreciate your reply. I‚Äôm very encouraged by how helpful online AAers are. I look forward to talking to more irl and having people to call. I think I will ask if there are any willing temporary sponsors. My meeting is smallish, maybe I can ask about bigger meetings and that sort of thing while I work on finding my permanent sponsor.', 'Thanks for the recommendation. I have the app and use it. Last Friday I called about a new to me meeting, but chickened out of going. My slip was something I‚Äôd been toying with mentally all week.', 'Thanks for your thoughtful response! Now that I reread my post I see made it sound like I have been going to A.A. My title should have included tomorrow after the word AA. Nervous about going and I guess my instinct is still to drink, even if the urge is faint compared to prior urges. Anyway, your points are all well taken and I look forward to learning the steps and doing hard work to better myself. Taking some deep breaths and trying to see my first meeting nerves as excitement. Truth be told I went to a single meeting years ago, but I was so emotional and was kinda forced to go that I am not counting it. I don‚Äôt feel like I am all that angry, but I have plenty else that requires spiritual healing.', 'Thanks for the reply, rationally it makes total sense. The desire for instant gratification or relief is still very present in my mind, even though the relief I used to engage in was a cycle of ruining my life and my family. Alcoholism didn‚Äôt start overnight and it‚Äôs not going to end overnight, but I just get overwhelmed by its aftermath and the fact that it started as a symptom of other issues I need/needed to fix.', 'Thanks for the information. I will keep going to meetings. I didn‚Äôt think it sounded right that you had to hurry and just pick a stranger after knowing them a handful of separate hours. If I ever get one I‚Äôd probably want my brother with the ultimate internal bs detector to meet them, idk if that‚Äôs allowed. I sound untrusting, but without alcohol and with living in a new city my social anxiety is back tenfold. I‚Äôm thinking I probably need a therapist besides meetings and the steps. Being in a hurry (for instant gratification/numbing) all the time is how I became an alcoholic. Also found the audio version this evening of the Big Book, though I already own a hard copy. Sometimes it helps to both hear and read in my case.  I don‚Äôt have the 12 traditions book yet. I am not sure what it‚Äôs about, is it just a more streamlined BB?']

['1) I‚Äôm a woman with multiple face piercings (can be seen in my post history for reference). I was serving a gentleman that looked at me- very disgustedly- and said ‚Äúhmm piercings... must be very limiting for relationships‚Äù. I was 15. 

2) I work on a very traditional food market that‚Äôs been running for the past three generations down a family line (I am not part of the family, I just work for them). During the whole panic buying pandemic, it was VERY busy at work. This one women decided to take up my time- whilst people where queuing- to argue to me about the fact we don‚Äôt accept card payments. It went like this

Me: thank you that will just be ¬£12.43 (idk the real amount but it was something like that)

Customer: <ITALIC> goes to hand me her card 

Me: oh sorry we don‚Äôt except card however there is a cash machine right there and I am happy to hold your stuff for you if you need to get money out! :)    (The cash machine really was right there, 15 seconds walk away) 

Customer: no?! you accept card! 

Me: sorry for the inconvenience but we don‚Äôt 

Customer: but that‚Äôs why i came here, because you accept card 

Me: sorry maybe you have us mistaken for another stall? we‚Äôve never accepted card- ever 

Customer: that‚Äôs ridiculous I know that you do- it‚Äôs why I came here! You did last time I came!! 

Me: I‚Äôm sorry but I don‚Äôt know what else to say, we simply don‚Äôt 

Customer: oh don‚Äôt be fucking ridiculous woman, I thought we were living in the god damn 21st century!  

<ITALIC> proceeds to get then money out of her purse which had plenty of cash in anyway!!!! 

Me: <ITALIC> stares across into my coworkers eyes, she understands my pain immediately 

Her: and I won‚Äôt be coming back- this is a disgrace! 
 
Luckily my boss is the best and doesn‚Äôt feed into that ¬´\xa0customer is always right\xa0¬ª bullshit. I told her what happened because I was a bit shook up by how unnecessarily rude she was. ["Incline pushups are a great start. Work up to bent knee and then standard pushups.


You can do a lot of curls and presses from home, and if you don't have weights, a bottle of water weighs about a pound. Maybe start with bicep curls, hammer curls, shoulder press, chest press, skullcrushers. Branch into lateral and forward arm raises, and external/internal rotations if you have an exercise band.


Armpit rows, standard rows, and bent over rows are great as well. If you're able and willing, try warming up with jumping jacks and crunches and squats, so you work your whole body and get your heartrate up--if the rest of your body is strong and solid, you should be maintaining that as well.


Start with 10 reps and 1 pound, listen to your body, don't push too hard at first. If it's easy, do more or increase the weight!


Good luck, bro!", 'Pre-everything. Age, gender? First post here, a little nervous, looking forward to honest opinions and tips!', "That's really impressive honestly, good luck and I hope finishing everything goes well for you! 

I've been learning a lot about myself and trying new things and doing a lot of cooking, so I'd say it's going really well for me too :)", 'Brother and sister, bonded pair. They love to cuddle but he always ends up putting his feet all over his sister üò≠', "Thank you very much üò≠\U0001f970 It feels really fitting in a sentence like that. I'm hopeful!"]

["Does anybody have tips for better roleplaying? 
 I am a beginner at LARP. Last summer I went to my first event and joined as an NPC.
Since that event was four days of utter fun (at least for the NPCs, since we basically got to play maniacal minions and punish players for walking around alone in the woods), I decided to join their next event. Again as an NPC.
The roleplaying was less difficult than I expected, but I am still very, veeery new at it (which is why I think playing an assigned role is more comfortable for me).

However, since I wasn't a complete disaster at playing last time, they gave me a bigger role for this next event.
I am going to play, basically, a pacifist paladin. She is the paladin of a goddess for peace and harmony, which I find really cool.
This is, ofcourse, very different from a crazy, bloodthirsty minion. This is an actual character with depth and history.
So, would any of you have any tips for playing such a character? Or for roleplaying in general?", 'A large commission I did for my larp group: rule illustrations for classes and races!', 'That's okay, nothing wrong with borowing good content and making your own twist on it! (And you're probably more creative than you give yourself credit for! In the least, you have a great taste in books)

Actually in art school, one teacher told us: "It's better to steal something good, than to make something bad."

Nothing is entirely original, it's always just people sharing and borrowing stuff from others who came before them :)', "I myself am I heavy user of sarcasm, and so are most of my friends and family. However, I don't always get it when someone else uses during conversations. It happens a lot, that I react seriously to a sarcastic remark, and then usually we have a bit of a laugh about that (because what else can you do?).

Sarcasm remains an interesting beast. I love it, but I don't always get it."]
