['Been loving my new flowery smelly body wash!', 'Me after I call someone "she" but then he corrects me:', 'I'm definitely not a standard type of plural. 
 I don't consider myself a plural at all. Or a "system" or a, what was it... "member"? But the about section said this was for all forms of multiple people in one head, which I guess this counts as, so I'll share anyway. I only just found out about this sub, and it seems a tad strange to me, to be honest, but if this is the situation you're in, I won't judge. 

I love bullshit meta writing. Characters aware that they're characters, stories interacting with the reader, pushing the boundaries between the reader and an observer, self referential writing, omnipotent self inserts, you name it. I read homestuck, it was confusing as hell, I ate that shit up and begged for more. I wrote my own. I wrote a dialogue for school. Two characters speaking, the thoughtful one and the optimistic one, both aware of the fragile and dubious state of their existence, or perhaps nonexistence. They spoke to eachother, developed for a while, interacted with metatextual concepts. After a while, the thoughtful one switched the document to single spacing to conserve space. They abandoned their quotation marks when they spoke, and at one point, I let the thoughtful one write a section of the narrative. But they weren't really seperate people. All the thoughtful one is is me pretending to be her. A character like any other. I consider what she'd do and I type it out as if I were her. Right before she wrote the part of the story, she told me "Of course, you'll still be writing it, like you've written everything I've done, but you'll be writing it as if you were me. Entirely me, like you're writing right now, as I say this, as opposed to you being you, and me being a part of you."

So that's what they are. Segments of my consciousness I can pull up to figure out what I think they'd say. I'm not sure I'm right though. I might not be writing them well and consistently. So, some time passes, I make a writing portfolio for class, and I put the dialogue in it. In the reflection portion of the portfolio, I let them out and do some self analysis through them. Come next year, I'm writing my college essay. Not one I'll actually be submitting to colleges, I just had to write one for English class. I write it with them, having a conversation throughout. I realize I haven't been treating them properly. I gave them self awareness, and even though they're less complex, less sentient than I am, I should still let them out. So I wrote them an ending. I placed them in a fictional instance of Earth. The thoughtful one chose the name Callie, and the Optimistic one chose the name Eliza. Or really, I chose for them. Because that's the only thing I can do. Callie becomes an author, and she does <ITALIC> not write metafiction because she knows better than anyone that's a whole can of worms. We still talk. I can write a conversation with them any time I want. On their end, It's written as the phone in their house ringing, and I'm on the other end. In the final draft of my essay, I did something absolutely bullshit. I shared the essay with them. The one that they're in. It was weird, and confusing, and it just wouldn't work. Callie told me this couldn't be my college essay. It's too bullshit, too confusing. I told her I thought I could fix it. That this was me. This was what I was like. It finished off with: 

‚ÄúPatch, this is really important, college is going to affect your entire life. Just once, can you suck it up and just write something normal about the time your pet died or something?‚Äù

I can‚Äôt

So that's basically the whole thing. I guess AMA? You can also ask Callie and Eliza anything I guess, too. I'll try to answer as well as I can. Hey, are you two ok with that?

E: "Yeah, alright. I guess we're in a unique situation. Shoot."

Nice. Callie, you?

C: "Yeah. I think this is all unnecessary and you're overplaying this with people with no real relation to this, but sure. Whatever."

Were you always this cynical?

C: "I don't think I was, really. I was very emotionally supportive. That's just kind of what you've boiled my personality down to. You've been doing me pretty wrong. I guess there's one thing you got right, even in the ending. I love Eliza."

Fuck, I have, haven't I? Oh, shit I'm so sorry.

C: "doesn't matter. I'm not real, remember?"

But you a... yeah. I guess you're right. By which I mean I'm right, of course. Even when I'm wrong I can't bear to let myself not be right.

==========================================

Edit: They're not the only ones either. But most of the others are more "short lived". And they're usually versions of me, quick dips into a hypothetical world. For example, for a long time now, my Nintendo 3ds has been suffering touch screen issues because if sand that got inside it. I've been asking my dad if we could try taking it apart to clean it out for a while. Recently, I'd had enough and asked him if we could please open it up and fix it now. He said ok, and we took it apart, put it back together, and it wouldn't turn on. I was pretty upset, but my parents ended up giving me a new one that they already had because they were saving it for Christmas because they knew I'd been having touch screen troubles. But, if I couldn't turn my old one on, I couldn't transfer my data. I'd basically have to start over on all downloadable games. So we were all feeling a lot of regret. Me, for being so desperate to do something so stupid and reckless, and them for not just giving it to me when I asked to fix my old one and being able to transfer my data. So, I thought, "If I had just asked them, this whole thing would have been avoided." So I placed myself in a hypothetical situation, in my mind:


I walked into my parents room. "Hey, I've really been having problems with my 3ds," I said. "Can we handle that?"
"Uh, yeah." My dad said. "I'll get the tools."
"Hey, uh, you know, this might actually make it worse. If we end up breaking it, I might lose my data permanently. Can you just give me the one you're saving for Christmas now to avoid a whole mess?"
"How did you know about that?" My mom asked. <ITALIC> Fuck. How did <ITALIC> I know about that? Well, they showed me. Right after I broke my- "Oh goddamnit I put myself in a hypothetical situation again, didn't I? I'm sorry, mom and dad, but none of this is real. I'm just, or rather my external self, who already broke his, is thinking about what might have happened if I just asked for the new one now." "What? Come on, that's rediculous." They said. "Yeah, I'm so sorry, but now that I've realized this, our universe is about to break down and we're all going to stop existing."

Outside, I thought, "oh my God, this is getting too meta. I gotta stop." I made myself stop thinking about it. 

And this happens <ITALIC> all the time I'm constantly making other versions of myself, and then they become aware of their confinement and the metanarrative structure breaks down. I'm like Dirk fucking Strider with all these splinters. I've constantly got little brain ghosts running around in my head.

Recently, while questioning if I was trans, but still undecided, I wrote a conversation between myself and my impression of what a potential, future, trans version of myself might be like. She had self awareness, she knew she was just my guess at a hypothetical future. After she told me her story, which I made up, and we finished our conversation, I asked her if she wanted to go live with Callie and Eliza now that she has self awareness. She turned me down. The way I think, the way I keep making versions of myself, they're used to not being the real me, and then fading away back into my greater self. Here's the dialogue, I guess. 

"No, I think I'm gonna stay here."

What do you mean? Where even is "here"?

"In the future, I guess. It's hardly the first time you've thought like this. You'll always have potential future selves, you've even wondered before what they'd say to you if you could talk to them. I'll be ok."

Heh, alright. See ya around.\xa0

I guess she's still with me. Every time I look ahead. But, the future she told me about has already proven to be slightly untrue. Does that mean she's dead, and other, future selves are all different people?

I even tried writing porn for the first time recently. I thought it was good, but apparently I can't even resist making my porn meta.', "Put your real gender, and if you haven't figured that out yet, put questioning or something like that."]

['I want a family, but i hate spending time with other people. What do I do? 
 So i am a pretty introverted young woman. I have always been very independent, and a bit of a lone wolf. From early childhood i got used to doing absolutley everything by myself, and finding all the answers myself. I had very few friends as a child. 

As an adult, I dont mind spending days alone, and i often prefer solitude to interactions that are either boring or stressful. After work i usually spend my time alone browsing the web, reading, drawing or watching films. Years fly by like this.

At the same time, i often cry because even though i feel fine in the moment, i feel that life is moving past me ¬´in the long run¬ª. Others are getting married and having children while i sit here in front of my computer all alone. Year after year. 

The problem isnt that guys dont give me attention. The problem is that i cant make myself enjoy their company, love them or feel attracted to them. I feel that a relationship is such a huge sacrifice of my space and comfort, and that there are so many expectations and pressures that would make my life worse. Since i love being alone, there are very few immidiate advantages for someone like me in being with someone, and i dont know if I am ready for making my daily life ¬´worse¬ª in order to get the long term advantages of a family and children. Still I cry about this a lot. Is it possible to feel ¬´lonley about the future¬ª? Because that is the best descriprion i can come up with about how i feel... As you have probably guessed, this is a problem when it comes to friends and family too. I would really love to have more friends, but at the same time i hate hanging out with people... 

Anyone else feel like this or have any ideas about what i should do?', 'What pop/rock track, besides Africa by Toto, would you concider one of the best ever made? 
 Edit: What pop or pop/other genre track (or tracks) would you concider the best ever made?', 'If I get corona, get cured and donate blood afterwards. Will the person who recieves my blood become immune?', 'Nobody picked Dream Dream Dream, but Hugo regards it as the best song he made']

['Yes, but the 2DS looks terrible. I would prefer the 3DS.', 'You would want to go to <SUBREDDIT> for that.', "Question about the Fantastic Fan and having a pet. 
 I know a lot of people that live in their vans have a pet and I know a lot have animals, but I haven't seen any that do both. Recently I learned that the Fantastic Fan has a thermostat and can be made to turn on by itself to keep the van at a regular temperature. 

My question is if you have a cat, and work a 4-8 hour job would keeping the fan on like that drain the battery. If not would it be enough to keep the cat cool enough during the day?", "Medicine, emotions, and medical marijuana. 
 So I've got a few questions about epilepsy. My first seizure was when I was about three months old and didn't have another until I was 10 and now I have them about every two or so years. 


My question is does your medicine mess with your emotions? Does it make you depressed almost? Apparently in 7th-8th grade I was a really happy and outgoing person according to a lot of my friends, but they now say (and I can even tell) that I've gotten almost emotionless and depressed. I am trying to figure out if that's connected to my medicine or even if being epileptic itself could cause it. 


Also those that have had this problem and switched to using medical marijuana, did any of your emotions change for the better? Did you become happier? 


I plan on talking to my doctor next month about all this to get a more professional opinion, but I would like to know what all of you have to say to.", "Where do you get your custom driver seats? 
 So I've finally narrowed it down to which van I am getting, a Chevy Express, but the problem will inevitably be the stock seats. 

I know a lot of people switch out the stock seats with custom ones, I even saw a bus build that had put in what looked like basically a small couch.

So where does everyone get new seats that will fit your specific van?"]

['A broken angel, by me 
 He was whole and she was broken, 

He was strong while she shattered.

She was cracked and he held her 

Broken wings 

And kissed them, 

Held them though they cut his hands, 

Held them while the crimson blood trickled from between his fingertips.

He was luminous and she was extinguished, 

She was his angel though her soul had been torn, shattered and shredded and left to 
Fade at his feet. 

He was patient while she crumbled, 

He held her hand while she became her own agony, whispered to her while the monsters came and when she shattered, 

He gave her the light from his heart to guide her on her way without him.

But he knew it wasn‚Äôt enough.

Because though he smiled and gave and held her, his angel had fallen.

And there was nothing he could do to bring her back.', 'I struggle with psychosis, among other mental issues. I drew this and I felt it really illustrates what it‚Äôs like to be in my head.', 'No problem! It‚Äôs a great guitar, plays very well and the neck is thin so it‚Äôs easy to shred on. ['I have a degenerative knee condition - it‚Äôs not particularly pleasant. I don‚Äôt think that using ‚Äúdegenerate‚Äù is inherently ableist, since it‚Äôs not really used as an insult against those of us who have them - no one has at any point called anyone I know a degenerate for having a degenerative condition; usually we get called crippled instead. (The left does have a huge problem with tossing cripple around lightly.)

I‚Äôve heard it‚Äôs different in other countries though. I know ‚Äúspaz‚Äù is considered a pretty serious ableist insult in Britain, but I don‚Äôt know anyone in the American community who particularly cares about it. 

(Either way, the concept of ‚Äúreclaiming‚Äù it is silly in this context - the OP doesn‚Äôt have a degenerative condition, so they couldn‚Äôt reclaim degenerate if it was an ableist slur. But I would be more inclined to refer to it as a queerphobic slur if I were to refer to it as a slur at all, in that it‚Äôs most frequently aimed at the queer community.)', 'It‚Äôs just a kit, and I still need to put it in a case, but I‚Äôm glad to see it working!', 'Looks amazing! If you like vegan/vegetarian sushi, I really recommend the book Sushi Modoki! It has a very similar tomato tuna recipe in it.', 'Cis women are actually considerably less likely to experience sexual assault at a young age than any other demographic than cis men, and even between cis women and cis men, the gap is smaller than you‚Äôd think. (This is because people who sexually prepubescent and pubescent kids are less likely to have a gender preference in doing so; what science exists on the subject suggests that it‚Äôs because secondary sex characteristics, which are what drives the experience of gendered attraction in most people, haven‚Äôt developed yet.)

This is a pretty small part of your point, but frankly it really irks me how cis women center themselves so aggressively in these conversations; it makes it increasingly difficult for people who are not cis to find space, even though they make up a sizable portion of the community. Around half of all binary trans people (very little difference depending on gender) experience childhood sexual assault; statistics on cisgender people vary hugely depending on how the question is asked, but between 2%-18% of cis boys<ITALIC>  and 10-20% of cis girls are victims. Trans women are way way* more likely to be victims of childhood sexual assault than cis women. 

*If you ask boys if they‚Äôre victims of pedophilia specifically, you get a very low rate. If you ask boys if their first sexual experience was when they were below the age of consent and involved an older individual, you get a very high rate. Meta-analysis puts the most likely rate at around 8% for cis men and shy of 20% for cis women, making cis men a bit less than a third of the CSA survivor community yet completely unheard of in most CSA spaces online.

It also feels like you‚Äôre assuming all femme women are cis and that your experience as someone perceived as a masculine women would be similar to those experienced by trans women, but I often go to conferences and did before I started passing, as does my (transfemme, feminine) friend, and the way she‚Äôs treated is completely barbarous compared to anything I ever got. It‚Äôs important to have solidarity, yes - but it‚Äôs also important to realize you may not be aware of the experiences of others not looking much like yours.']

['Mods fell asleep without their Stands, kill them', "<QUOTE>

3, at least in the Crystals build. You can instantly discard it with Transcendent Crystals (the Skill) to search Sulfefnir if you didn't open it or Recycler, effectively giving you 9 copies.

<QUOTE>

Not necessarily, 2 I feel is fine/optimal, but running 3 if you lack the back row is okay. I used to run 3 up until 3/4 of the way through the 2nd stage of the KC Cup, but mostly because I needed to squeeze more backrow in, so hopefully that's some assurance.

<QUOTE>

The primary purpose of Lance is protect your monsters from S/Ts like Fiendish Chain, Canadia, Dark Magic Circle, etc., especially those that don't target and can't be stopped with Impact like Floodgate Trap Hole and Cybernetic Overflow. With that in mind, you'll want substitutes that serve the same purpose. Backrow removal to pre-emptively protect your monsters from S/Ts such as Cosmic Cyclone and Night Beam usually comes to mind.

Lance also helps weaken enemy monsters as Crystrons tend to lack in raw power (strongest monster is Quariongandrax at 3000). This purpose doesn't take as much priority as S/T protection does as Crystrons usually take things out with effects rather than battle anyway, and World Legacy Clash (which I assume you have) does the job well.

However, if you can get Forbidden Lance, I recommend it.", "That's typically my answer, but in the context of Crystal Crystrons, your only Tribute Summonable monster is Sulfefnir, who is usually the one you try to get in the GY as soon as possible. Even if you do manage to save a duplicate copy in hand or search it with Thystvern (which is usually a wasteful use of its search if you already have Sulfefnir in the GY), it's actually detrimental to your play because Sulfefnir will end up eating a zone that could've/should've been used to allow the Tuners to SS pull something. You'd need to immediately go into a high level Synchro during <ITALIC> your turn just to get rid of it, assuming it doesn't get flipped by another Floodgate or Canadia right after.

That's also part of the reason why I think a second Lancea is a good idea; in addition to preventing Invocation from using my monsters and banishing Aleister for the recycle, I also have a back-up Tribute Summon that can thankfully tribute itself next turn. <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>. Seriously, I unintentionally completed both a Superheavy Samurai deck <ITALIC> and most of a Cyber Dragon deck (just need Concentrating Current) before I get another Lancea.", 'I Got Sent to the World of Skyrim the Day Before The Elder Scrolls VI Releases, and the Only Way To Go Back To My World is to Complete the Main Quest Line but I Keep Getting Distracted by the Side Quests']

Goodbye Internet"]

['When I was in hell I decided to beat the system by being Satan. Then I was having a pretty good time.', 'It\'s important to find other things to make you not "boring". Hobbies, interests, passions. People who are only "interesting" because they are mentally ill and only talk about their illness aren\'t super interesting really.', 'Does anyone else have a spiritual or religious belief that helps them through bipolar? \n I recently became Buddhist, and the four seals of Buddhism really resonate with me. That all emotion is pain. I try to stop chasing happiness because it just leads to mania which leads to destruction. Every emotion is pain. If I could represent that phrase as a symbol I would love a tattoo of it. Also the impermenence of everything helps me believe that my current situation will change, no matter how depressed I am. I often get trapped in forever thinking. And meditating on the impermenance of "I" helps me dissuade the hypomanic egomaniac I often become. And just generally meditation and yoga brings me a lot of peace. Any other Buddhists, Muslims, christians, or other general peace seekers?', "Does anyone have advice about how to send professional emails without always sounding like a jerk? ['Where would you suggest living? I know practically anywhere is train + bus :/', 'My (23F) boyfriend (26M) moved around a lot as a kid: could this be why he hasn't said "I love you" yet? 
 My (23F) boyfriend (26M) of 4 months hasn't said "I love you" yet. This confuses me, because most guys have told me that they loved me around the 1-2 month mark, and this is when I started to feel it for him. I love him more than anyone I have ever loved, which maybe sounds ridiculous to some but it's a gut feeling type of thing.

Anyway, he moved around a LOT as a kid/young adult because of his family. Doesn't have close friends outside of me. Said he considers everyone in his life as temporary but that I am his best friend. He's had two long-term relationships that ended badly, and I'm wondering if maybe he hasn't said I love you because he thought of them as permanent and then they also left.

He always looks at me like he loves me, seems to almost say I love you ("I---" and then make a joke), and says "I like you a lot" and "you're my favorite".

For anyone with experience with this, could him moving around a lot/having people always come and go be why he hasn't said it?

TLDR; My (23F) boyfriend (26M) of 4 months acts like he loves me, but hasn't said it yet; he moved around a lot as a kid, considers everyone as temporary but that I am his best friend, and has had traumatic relationships... could his moving around be why?', 'I overdosed on fake Molly 5 years ago. What drug do you think it was? 
 5 years ago at my after prom I had what I think was a near death experience. I decided that it was a great idea to take "Molly" from a guy in an open Hawaiian button down on a boardwalk. His friend spent a lot of time upstairs and then came down with a ton of white powder and told me to chug it in water. He also told me "Yeah, it's Molly. It showed up as straight purple on a test kit." So I chugged it.

20 minutes later I start freaking out. All at once my vision gets blurry, heart is racing, lights are zooming past, I fall down. We go on the bus and I'm slurring, can barely speak or walk. Everyone on the bus is concerned for my life. I black out and apparently kept repeating the same phrase over and over.

I wake up in the motel room an hour later with a cool compress on my head sweating through the sheets. I was terrified. The next day I couldn't remember my phone number and was spacey for a few days.

I've always wondered if this was Molly or what it could have been. I had tried molly before and it didn't feel like that. Any opinions?', 'Wow, go you. Did you land that position in the PhD program?']

['I think it‚Äôs just due to Gratisfaction, Metabolism and (mostly) You‚Äôre So Right that a lot of fans don‚Äôt like Angles. The band did play Gratisfaction and You‚Äôre So Right live though, which to me suggests that they thought those two songs were pretty decent tunes', 'Daily Song Discussion - B.L.U.R.E.M.I. (13) 
 Next song up in the discussions is B.L.U.R.E.M.I., which definitely ups the pace a bit after the measured 1992. The lyrics of the song seem to reflect upon the music industry, and how pop groups are just part of cycle that are dealt away by record companies once their popularity wanes. This is also shown in the title of the song being a combination of the band‚Äôs name and it‚Äôs record company, EMI. Damon‚Äôs criticism of sampling in the song‚Äôs lyrics is also somewhat ironic considering he himself would be undertaking sampling in Gorillaz just a few years after this album was released.

Musically the song starts with somewhat creepy vocal sound effects by Damon, before throttling into full gear with a fast tempo and loud guitars. Graham leads the attack here with guitar playing that calls back to previous songs such as Globe Alone and Chinese Bombs. Alex also delivers some nice bass playing while Dave holds it all together with some uptempo drumming. The song‚Äôs length sets it apart from most of the album, as it clocks in at only a little over 2 minutes. Afterwards we get a short but pretty ambient hidden track that bears similarities to the work of artists such as Aphex Twin, with the hidden track leading well into the next song on the album...

Lyrical highlight: ‚ÄúCompleting the cycle, Until the teenage maniacs, They bring it all back‚Äù

Musical highlight: Guitar work, bass work

Best performers: Damon, Graham and Alex

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>', 'I went to look at some statistics and yeah the Killers have been the far more commercially successful band. 

If we just look exclusively at the US sales of The Killers five albums, we get:
- Hot Fuss: 3.75 million
- Sam‚Äôs Town: 1.3 million
- Day & Age: 774k
- Battle Born: 344.158k
- Wonderful Wonderful: 111k

For the Strokes:
- Is This It: 1 million
- Room On Fire: 597k
- First Impressions Of Earth: 310k
- Angles: 221k
- Comedown Machine: 77k

Somewhat surprised that the Killers have been that commercially successful, but ultimately yeah you‚Äôre right, they are the bigger band', 'I can‚Äôt imagine not having ‚Äòyeah you‚Äô following ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs up to you‚Äô - it‚Äôs such an iconic part of the song']

['You are included too!!! I‚Äôm an enby myself :)', 'Hey friends, I have a question about dysphoria vs dysmorphia (maybe trigger warning? also probably gonna be tmi idk) 
 Hey y‚Äôall. I identify as non binary for starters. 

I have a side note that I‚Äôm gonna say first. I‚Äôve never felt like my name belongs to me. My name has always been a source of distress for me, realizing my name is <ITALIC> me and such is always really uncomfortable. Can this be considered dysphoria in a way?

Now to my actual point.

I had really severe dysmorphia when I was 14. I was binding every day for a month with ace bandages (yeah...don‚Äôt do that), wishing and praying and hoping I‚Äôd just wake up with a dick and a flat chest. I thought I was trans for sure. My mom was weird about it though, so I kinda trashed that part of me, but there it stayed and stirred in the garbage bag of my brain for 5 years. 

I‚Äôm 19 now. Dysphoria has, for the past month or so, been kicking me in the butt. 

HOWEVER. 

It‚Äôs different this time. It‚Äôs just about my chest (and my hips and butt but whatever). I just wish my chest was flat. Having female sexual organs is not a source of dysphoria anymore for me. Like sure, I think about it sometimes, and <ITALIC> sometimes I wish I had a dick, but I‚Äôm not uncomfortable having female sexual organs. It really just is my chest. I‚Äôve tried losing weight to get them gone but it‚Äôs never worked. I‚Äôve been looking at a lot of top surgery photos and surgeons and such lately, and seeing the photos give me a sense of peace I guess? Cause it‚Äôs something that‚Äôs achievable?

Now, I don‚Äôt <ITALIC> loathe having breasts. I really hate the way they look and the way they‚Äôre shaped, though. Maybe I‚Äôm just used to having them? Sometimes they‚Äôre fun to squish but that‚Äôs about it. I don‚Äôt think they look good on me. I don‚Äôt feel like they <ITALIC> shouldn‚Äôt be there, but I also don‚Äôt feel like they <ITALIC> should. If I woke up tomorrow with a flat chest, I‚Äôd probably be a billion percent stoked, and knowing I‚Äôm not gonna wake up without boobs tomorrow is kinda disappointing in a way? I dunno. 

Am I feeling dysphoric about my chest? Or am I just feeling dysmorphia? I honestly can‚Äôt tell at this point. Probably both. I‚Äôve always hated my body anyway? I wish my whole body was just more androgynous. I wish I was a few inches taller and had that skinny body type. Nah. I was cursed with a pear shaped body (anyone reading this who has a pear shaped body, you‚Äôre beautiful and perfect I just hate <ITALIC> mine). 

I dunno I‚Äôm kind of rambling at this point,  so...

TL:DR; Is hating my chest and body and wishing so bad I had an androgynous body, but not hating or feeling out of touch with my actual sexual organs, dysmorphic or dysphoric? Help?', 'Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è Im 20 and just hoping I can land a job in the next little while so I can get out', 'Nah I just got a fucking jackass bully in my chat. Fuck u, Toasty1995.']

["Tend to fall into a depression after mania and boredom can be a part of depression where it's so persistent and empty.", "About how long does it take for you to get devastatingly tired of your field of work? Is switching jobs constantly a bipolar trait? \n It's almost exactly three years for me. I've applied to three different programs at my graduate school and was really tired of my undergrad field after three years as well. It's been three years studying volcanoes , and while I objectively know it's a pretty cool topic, I just want to quit so bad! I only have one year left in my program but I really just want to be an illustrator. I know it's not directly a symptom of bipolar, but I've found that a lot of bipolar people tend to switch jobs and passions a lot. And I am definitely like that. Maybe it's the obssesive side of hypomania or something and the lack of sustainability in obsessions.", "I have bought Seroquel without insurance before and it wasn't that expensive. Do you think that is an option?", 'I used to be hypomanic for half of the year every year. It was exhausting and I was always so embarrassed of myself after. Just so full of myself and falsely confident. And I was kind of a bitch. Just so irritable and rude to people. Everytime people on this sub wish to be hypomanic, which seems to be a lot, I just think of how difficult I was to be around and that I never wish for it to return.']

 So I don't entirely know how to explain this, but I'll do the best I can. 




I had a seizure the other day, the first one in about three years I think. It happened maybe three or four days ago, I really can't remember anymore. Usually by now I am feeling better and everything. For the most part I do feel fine nothing feels "wrong" I would say except for I just feel "off". 

I have a lot of mental health issues, depression, social anxiety, stuff like that. I also dissociate a lot, but it seems like ever since I had this seizure I have been doing it a lot more often. ['I don‚Äôt not believe that, it‚Äôs definitely a thing. But when a white man rapes, he often gets off like Brock Turner.', 'Yes, that is racist. Leave it to the blacks to act the way they do? That simply and obviously implies that black people in general act unruly or bad. That situation sounds awful, but you don‚Äôt stereotype an entire race because the people who did wrong happened to be black. That is the definition of racism, basically. If you didn‚Äôt mean it that way you need to watch how you talk. I found THAT comment to be rude, and, well, not Christlike. Sorry if it seems over the top to read your comment history, but I don‚Äôt see how judging someone for being black is any less sinful than being gay. I do not think Jesus would like that either, but what do I know. He hung out with prostitutes and tax collectors. He‚Äôd hang out with ‚Äúthe blacks‚Äù also.

It sounded like you were judging all ‚Äúliberal‚Äù ideas as unchristlike. Again, maybe that‚Äôs not what you meant, but it didn‚Äôt come off well.', 'I am visiting him in rehab on Sunday. 
 I feel weirdly okay about it.

We‚Äôve been corresponding on the phone every few days and he really wants me to come. I get it, he‚Äôs doing super well now but he‚Äôs still lonely, and wants a good person he knows well to see him.

After going to a few alanon meetings I feel more at peace. I know we both need time. He shouldn‚Äôt jump back into a relationship so soon, and I don‚Äôt need any added stress of BEING with him so soon, regardless of if he can stay sober. I can be his friend for a while, if not indefinitely.

What I‚Äôm most grateful for is he‚Äôs on meds now. They put him on a mood stabilizer and antidepressant. I KNOW it‚Äôs not a cure all, definitely not. But it could make a difference for him. 

I‚Äôm not as hopeful for our relationship as I am for his future, which may be completely separate. And that‚Äôs okay.

My mom once told me she‚Äôs never seen somebody as good at compartmentalization as me. I can put pieces of my life into boxes pretty easily. It can be hard but his life is separate from mine.

I just want him to know someone cares. And I‚Äôve been doing super well these last few weeks focusing mainly on myself.', 'i'm nonbinary and even i agree.




also pronouns like "nym/xe" are RIDICULOUS.']

['I don‚Äôt know when this changed for me, but it‚Äôs definitely true that now, in my 40s, my arousal is largely (though not exclusively) centered around what about HIM turns ME on, while when I was younger it was centered on what about ME turned THEM on.

I think part of what caused the change was my conscious decision to start asking for what I wanted in bed. For most of my adult life I was hesitant to do this. When I started speaking up, I also became more conscious of what aroused me in men.', 'I moved to NYC because of the romantic image and lived there for six years. I found out the hard way that if you don‚Äôt have money, living in NYC is not romantic.  Even a life of squalor costs more than most humans can afford. If you want to be able to go 24 hours without smelling strange men‚Äôs urine,  you literally have to be a millionaire. 
I have some money now, and I enjoy visiting NYC a few times a year. But I still wouldn‚Äôt live there. I don‚Äôt make enough to live the piss-odor-free NYC life.', 'THANK YOU. This is true but MBTIers routinely flip when it‚Äôs pointed out.', 'Oh, I wouldn‚Äôt  say absolutely always ‚Äî it‚Äôs possible he might say, ‚ÄúHon, I‚Äôm tired ‚Äî can we do it in the morning?‚Äù And I would feel free to say the same to him. 

In practice we rarely say no to each other, and I think that‚Äôs because we are sensitive to each other‚Äôs moods and body language, so about 90% of the tine we can tell without asking whether the other person would be open to a sexual advance. If he cuddles me kind of suggestively and I don‚Äôt respond right away, he backs off. And he wouldn‚Äôt make a pass if it was obviously not a good time for me. (If I was upset, for example.)  I similarly wouldn‚Äôt make an advance toward him if I saw he was stressed or distracted, and I wouldn‚Äôt insist on groping him if I touched him and got no reaction.']

["Meh, a bit of shaming never does any harm. We shouldn't come to a point where being on benefits isn't something shameful.", "With good reason, can't afford to share too much border with the Huns in case they decide to attack once more.", "I'm becoming increasingly pro-open borders 
 I just get more and more disheartened at the thought that people endure violence, poverty, war, corruption/authoritarianism, and more when at most an 8-hour flight could bring them to a much better place, a much better life. That someone who is born 1km below the Mexican border is forced to endure a significantly worse standard of living than one born 1km above. 

We always talk about how we need to spread democracy, institutions, lower corruption and more, but why do we go through this much hassle when people could just move to a wealthier country? Why should people endure for a few decades as a country's economy stabilize and its institutions stabilize/strengthens when all they could do is move to a wealthier country now?

I believe that our current view of immigration is probably one of the most unethical things we can do as a country. So much suffering in our world could be alleviated by just letting people move to better places and gain greater opportunities thanks to it. And frankly, seeing so many people against it, or even vilifying you for believing that it's the right thing to do, the ethical thing to do, is pretty disheartening.", 'Either this guy is truly gay and extremely repressed, or he has a LOT of internalized biphobia']

GNC isn't trans.", 'I swear to god if I see 1 more transguy say: "1 reason why cis girls should date transmen is because we know what a period feels like üòÉ". I'm going to <ITALIC> S N A P 
 You really aren't making us more appealing. You're actually triggering even more dysphoria for us. I'm gay but if I was a straight dude I'd be mortified if my girlfriend would press me on about having periods. I'm not trying to make some guys ashamed of getting their SW but I've said this before and I'll say it again. Periods should be talked about (on a societal level) for cis women ONLY. If its not medical, LEAVE US OUT OF IT.

Edit: Ok I wanna clarify something because a few people here seem to be misunderstanding what I'm trying to say and I don't want people to leave here upset.  Also TW: I'm gonna be talking about blood and natal parts, obviously.

I'm not at all telling guys to be shameful about their SW. What I'm getting at is that when it comes to something that's notable for women 99.9999% of the time. Its annoying and incredibly dysphoric to me (and I'm assuming for some other transguys out there) to be reminded that I'm still a woman down there once a month because someone like Cass Clemmer wants to shout on their rooftops that "men get their period too". 

I, the cis man I am in my head, do not want to be reminded that I am a woman <ITALIC> at all. Even if they try and "de-gender" periods (you can't). Its still gonna make me wanna die because cis men <ITALIC> do not bleed down there once a month. Therefore, when I do, it makes me extremely upset. The only time I talk about it is when I have to like let's say at a doctor's appointment (medically). But when I'm out in society amongst my friends, acquaintances and family. I do not want to be reminded of it because again. <ITALIC> I AM A CIS MAN IN MY HEAD. 

Again, I'm not trying to say to you guys "oh your on your cycle? GET BACK IN THE CAGE". No of course not. If you're having a genuine problem of course speak honestly about. Just don't post on social media a photo of your bloody tampon/Maxi-pad and put <HEADING> boisgetperiodstoo. There's a difference between having a problem and looking for some help and <ITALIC> deliberately shouting on the top of your lungs that your body is going through a biologically woman-ly thing and your proud of it bc bleeding out of your vagina is fun üòÉüòÉüòÉ', "That's not what we all do but whatever"]

["We still have to pay for surgery. I will have to pay approx. $3000 for top surgery (male chest conturing isn't covered. And travel expenses) Not including the 4-6 weeks I'll be off work.

My T costs approx $60 a month. 

I have to travel to get blood work done every month to check my levels ($10ish, plus time off work)

I know a MTF person having bottom surgery in a few months. She's getting ohip coverage and it is still going to cost her around $10,000-$15,000. 

She told me facial surgery isn't covered.


A skilled worker isn't just someone who can work. It is someone who is in a specific trade and has worked at least full-time in that trade for at least a year. And has a job offer in Canada.

<LINK>

Your best bet may be to get a student visa and go to school in Ontario. You won't have coverage, but you can still access healthcare out of pocket.", "That is quite interesting, I'm going to have to do some research.", 'I know, it sucks that people will listen to a "cis white male" over a trans person. 

It's a similar issue with the autism community, people listen to their parents over the kid with autism.

I will use my cis white maleness for good I promise. With great power comes great responsibility ;)', 'I started T in October without telling my parents. They've known I've been trans for 13 years, I finally grew a backbone and am transitioning without their "permission".

I spent 13 years considering their point of view and doing what they wanted. (Keep in buried, just dress like a boy, don't tell anyone, you're too young, it's a phase) 

The moment I started T any, and all doubt of me doing the "right" thing went away. This is my life and this is what I want. 

A month later my parents found out. All hell broke loose. There was a lot of yelling, a lot of crying, I was accused of not loving them, being selfish, not thinking of them. Yet, surprisingly, I didn't feel any guilt. 

Long story short, I'm basically being forced to move out. And am in the new year. 

I stood my ground. They said I was going too fast. I was honest, I told them if I waited any longer to transition, I doubt I'd be here much longer. This is my life, I will deal with the consequences.

They told me I wouldn't be able to attend family events, I'm going to loose a lot of family.

I haven't come out to my family yet, I did compremise and am not 100% transitioning until the new year.

My managers know and are 100% supportive and we have a transition plan at work for the new year.

I will say, before I started T I had a worst case scenario plan. I had a place to stay with a friend of I got kicked out, so I could stay somewhere until I found a place of my own. I didn't get kicked out thankfully, but it's good to be prepared. 

You need to look at your situation. If your parents found out would they kick you out? Do you have a place to stay? Can you afford an apartment? Food, cell phone? 

My home life is hostile right now, I'm being guilted and scolded daily to say the least. Can you handle that? Can you stand your ground?

Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst. Is my motto.

Best of luck to you']

["Hiya! I'm Oanh Li Nguyen and I can draw portraits in a semi-realistic or even very realistic style if that's what you desire. You can see my work on <DESCRIPTION> <LINK>, and send me an inquiry at [oanhlinguyen34@gmail.com](mailto:oanhlinguyen34@gmail.com). Please let me know if you have any questions, I can't wait to hear from you!", 'Make sure to presoak in advance! When I made lentil pasta, I used my usual Irish Italian spaghetti recipe but just replaced beef with lentils. I think the one think I noticed is that the lentils sucked up a LOT of sauce... so personally I would either precook the lentils and fold them in at the end to make sure you still have sauce', '<BOLD> Irish Spaghetti
<ITALIC> Easy, 1 hour.

<BOLD> Ingredients:
1 can of campbell condensed tomato soup

1 can of campbell‚Äôs cream of mushroom soup

1 lb ground beef

1 onion, diced

1 portion of pasta (read: however much pasta you feel like)

1 ¬Ω tsp Chili powder

1 ¬Ω tsp Hot sauce 

1 tbsp Fish sauce (...?!)

Chicken/vegetable stock cube

Salt, Pepper

Butter

Parsley 

Parmesan, grated 

<BOLD> Directions:
Thaw ground beef if it is frozen. 

Dice 1 whole white onion into ~1‚Äù cubes, though specifics don‚Äôt really matter. 

Have two pots on the stove, one filled with water and one with a tab or so of butter (roughly 1 tbsp). Heat the pot with butter over medium-high heat-- the water pot will be heated later when it‚Äôs time to cook the pasta.

When the butter has melted and the pot is adequately hot, add in your ground beef. Break up the beef with a spoon. Allow the beef to brown (not too brown just yet!) before adding in your diced onions. Allow all the flavors to get to know each other, add another tab of butter. Allow the onions to get a beautiful translucent coloration. 

Then, add your soups. Add in chili powder, hot sauce, and fish sauce. Stir until the mixture is homogeneous. Lid and stir occasionally for about 45 minutes. Scrape the bottom of the pan to ensure no burnage. 

About halfway through, start boiling the pasta water. Add your vegetable/chicken stock cube and a few hefty pinches of salt to the pasta water, stirring evenly. When the water has reached a rolling boil, add in your pasta, and boil for as long as your package directs you to/as long as you‚Äôd like. 

If you‚Äôve timed it properly, your pasta sauce and pasta should be finished at the same time; fret not if this is untrue, just turn off the heat for your pasta sauce/pasta water when its no longer necessary and risk overcooking. 
Add a couple tablespoons of pasta water to your pasta sauce, this adds a little saltiness (keep in mind we haven‚Äôt added salt/pepper to the salt itself at all) and allows the sauce to stick to the pasta noodles. Stir, salt & pepper to your taste.

Serve your noodles. Whatever you do, DO NOT RINSE YOUR NOODLES! Serve sauce on top. Add as much cheese as you‚Äôd like, and a little sprinkle of freshly chopped parsley for the ‚Äògram. 
Enjoy! The sauce should keep for roughly a week at most.', "hard to approach them when they just destroyed and broke up the labor of love you've been working on for 3 weeks now... but i'll try. maybe i'll move it a bit forward a bit", "\[CE\] because you just wanna see em crash and burn. I'm Viet too though, can you teach me some?"]

['I have been a big fan of writing down my obsessions, compulsions, triggers, and then creating a plan to cope with each trigger. It takes a lot of time but it has really helped me be aware of my obsessions and compulsions. Now instead of immediately performing a compulsion, I ask myself what triggered the obsession. If I am able to identify the trigger, I refer to my list of coping strategies, activities, and coping statements. A lot of the time the first step is delaying the compulsion in some way so I have time to think about things. Then, I focus on ways to deal with the trigger. If there is no apparent trigger I treat the obsession as being an intrusive thought that I don't have to act on. If I do act on it, instead of beating myself up about it I try to reflect on what I can do in the future to prevent the compulsion.  


I don't know if this will work for anyone else, but it has been super helpful to me. I am in the process of creating a "coping guide" for myself, and making it available physically and virtually.', "Dog trainer for reactive dog that has reasonable pricing 
 I am on ODSP, so I can't really afford most fees places are asking for upfront, but my dog needs help he is very reactive. Any recommendations for a good trainer that is priced reasonably or able to do a payment plan?", "Close-up of my befores and afters. 7 months 20mg starting 40mg ending. ['Just know that what I am saying is coming from my own experience as a now 27 year old woman who lost her father to suicide when she was 11. 

I wish someone said one thing to my father before he took his own life. I wish someone asked him if committing suicide would be the example he wanted me to follow when I felt so overwhelmed with the challenges in life. 

The pain you are feeling is nothing compared to the pain, suffering and psychological damage your suicide will inflict on those kids. They will spend the rest of their lives wishing you were there to share in their special moments. Their self identity will be forever changed and they will spend years blaming themselves for your death. 

Not only that - They will have to go through therapy to recover fully from that kind of loss, and that kind of therapy is difficult and expensive. 

It took me over 10 years AND experiencing suicidal thoughts myself to even begin to understand that my father was in overwhelming pain which wasn‚Äôt my fault. It was hard to learn how to use ‚Äúradical acceptance‚Äù in such a painful situation but eventually I figured it out. With that being said, I still feel intense disgust and disappointment towards the people who knew that my father was planning to take his own life and failed to not only prevent it but didn‚Äôt even bother to help him. I still blame them for why I will never know him like my peers know their fathers. I still blame them for why I will never be able to have my father be there when I eventually get married. 

I understand how dark of a place you are in right now to be considering suicide. Heck I attempted suicide and was in hospital for a month straight in May of this year. But please, take a few days to really consider the impact this will have on your kids AND the lesson/example it will teach them about handling the darker periods in life.', 'Showed this to my priest while on our way to the ROCOR diocese assembly last week, he laughed loud enough for there to be an echo in the airport and said ‚Äúthat is you Marina!‚Äù üòÇüòÇ', 'You can make refined quartz by putting a chunk of white quartz you find on the ground in the mines  into a furnace :)', '...and here I am warning my Orthodox boyfriend that my Romanian grandfather WILL inspect his teeth to ensure I am not dating a vampire üòÇüòÇüòÇ']

['Not the best but it was all I could do with spluttering Home Depot cans', 'Weeds easy to quit cuz it‚Äôs not addictive. Start with weed first', 'CONTROLLER GUIDE (V2) 
 Hello <SUBREDDIT>! I am addressing the notoriously common "what controller should I buy" question with an unbiased guide for controller buyers.

NOTE: This guide only includes the best currently produced or commonly found controllers, so for this reason older controllers like the DDJ-RB, SB2, and RX are not included.

<BOLD> ENTRY LEVEL (200-400 USD)

DJing has never been so beginner-friendly, with the majority of the revenue of DJ companies currently stemming from their entry-level products. Each major company offers something for a 200-400 dollar budget. Although these controllers offer many features and can almost compete with a controller double their range feature-wise, they are little more than plastic boxes with MIDI buttons and suffer from very poor sound quality and durability issues. 

<BOLD> (<HEADING> 1 Choice) Pioneer DDJ-400 ($250)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK> 

The DDJ 400 is arguably the best DJ controller for beginners and anyone else on a budget. The pro-style FX loadout, relatively large tempo faders, and included Rekordbox Pro license make it an absolute powerhouse for mixing. 

PROS:

<ITALIC>  (Relatively) large tempo faders for easy beatmatching
 Nexus-style FX layout eases the transition to CDJs
* Full Rekordbox DJ license

CONS:

<ITALIC>  Smaller jog wheels than other options
 Almost uncomfortably small form factor




<BOLD> Pioneer DDJ-SB3 ($237)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK> 

The SB3 is the maternal twin brother to the DDJ 400. They are almost the same price, offer roughly the same features and were released at a similar time. The SB3 boasts full controller-sized jog wheels, classic controller FX, and a Serato Lite license.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  5.5-inch jog wheels
 Virtual 4-deck capability

CONS:

<ITALIC>  Small pitchfaders
 No full software license

<BOLD> Native Instruments S2 Mk3 ($330)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The S2 Mk3 has perhaps the best jogs out of any intro-level controller. They lack the light, plastic feel of other options, giving a feeling of inertia and a metal build. The controller comes with Traktor which has been a viable, although (in my opinion) strangely laid out software for a long time. The pitchfaders are also very nicely sized, matching roughly to the length of a DDJ-400's. The controller also has a nice build to it, feeling quite premium for a 2-deck. The lack of a dedicated Beat FX section may be problematic for more experienced DJs, though. The controller also supports STEM files as all Traktor controllers do, which allow independently toggleable and filterable drum, bass, lead, and vocal layers.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Fantastic, tactile jog wheels
 Large pitchfaders
<ITALIC>  Good build quality
 STEM ready

CONS:

<ITALIC>  No Beat FX (although Mixer FX do have tempo-related features occasionally)
 Higher price point (hardly a con as you receive better build quality in exchange)




<BOLD> Numark Mixtrack 3 ($149)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The Numark Mixtrack is something of a middleman between the ultra-budget range of controllers and the entry level. It is the lowest-priced controller that I would be willing to recommend as a learning tool. It does have pads, a cue button, beat FX, and all the basic features of a controller, however.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Very low price point
 Long pitch faders
* Touch Strip

CONS:

<ITALIC>  Only 4 pads per deck
 Flimsy build quality
* Bad sound (even by entry level standards)




<BOLD> Roland DJ-202 ($290)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The Roland DJ 202 is somewhat identical to controllers such as the DDJ RB or SB3 on first glance. However, on closer inspection it possesses better jogs and more advanced volume control (cue mix and sampler knobs) than the Pioneer options at a slightly increased price. 

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Light but tactile and responsive jogs
 Advanced volume control 
* Virtual 4-deck

CONS:

<ITALIC>  Laggy pads
 Small pitchfaders




<BOLD> MID-RANGE

The mid range is where choice matters the most. No two controllers perform alike here due to a hugely varying price range. Most DJs don't start with mid-range gear and often upgrade to it. 

(Tie for <HEADING> 1) <BOLD> Pioneer DDJ SR2 ($700)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The DDJ SR2 is a conceived upgrade to the SB3. It has a touch strip for shuttling between tracks, LED jogwheel indicators, a heavier build, larger faders, and better sound. It is capable of similar performance of high-end controllers minus four-channel capability.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Good sound quality
 Touch strip
* Cost-efficient

CONS:

<ITALIC>  No color FX (filter only)
 Primitive jog indicator can be hard to use for precise scratching and juggling

(Tie for <HEADING> 1) <BOLD> Pioneer DDJ 800 ($800)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The DDJ 800 was concived alongside the 400 as an upgraded version, however it ends up outperforming it's sister controller, the SR2. Several things cause this, namely multiple color FX (the SB2 only has a filter,) internalized beat FX (meaning all the FX are built into the soundcard as opposed to running on the computer,) full-size tempo faders, and a jog wheel display (as opposed to the LED ring on the SR2). 

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Nexus-style FX and loop controls
 Hi-res jog display
* Complete Pioneer standard FX

CONS:

<ITALIC>  Expensive
 No touch strip

<BOLD> Traktor S3 ($650)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The Traktor S3 was added into the Traktor Kontrol S lineup somewhat recently. It is essentially a 4-channel S2, serving as a midway between that and the pro-level S4. It features 4 channels, a unique feature for this price point. It's jog wheels, identical to the S2's, do not serve as a perk now as other controllers at this range have wheels of similar quality. A major downside to this controller is the lack of a beat FX unit, which was understandable for the S2 but a serious flaw at this range. It does play a trick by only taking one external input, as well. The controller also supports STEM files.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  4 channel mixer with 1 external input
 Dedicated loop and beat jump knobs
<ITALIC>  STEM ready
 Low price

CONS:

<ITALIC>  No beat FX
 Not a full 4-channel mixer
* Rubber play/cue buttons

<BOLD> Roland DJ-505 ($600)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The DJ-505 is a very unique controller. In addition to possessing a somewhat standard feature layout at this range (2 channels, metal jogs, outer-ring jog LEDs, full-sized up and cross faders,) the 505 has one very intresting feature that screams Roland: a built in drum machine. The DJ 505 condenses the controls of a TR-8 drum machine (Roland's infamous drum synth) into a sequencer strip, 606/707/808/909 selector, level knob, and BPM counter. The rest of the controller holds up to standards, not really offering anything unique but not carrying any major flaws either.

PROS:

* Internalized drum machine

CONS:

* Small tempo faders




<BOLD> PRO-LEVEL

Competition here is tight. DJs expect the functionality of a Nexus CDJ setup for as low a price as possible. Thus, only a few controllers made the cut. 




<BOLD> (<HEADING> 1 choice) Pioneer DDJ-1000 ($1100)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The DDJ 1000 is the One Controller to Rule Them All. It takes "nexus functionality" quite literally and actually plops the 7 inch (every other controller on this list besides the DDJ 400 has 5.5 inch) jog of their beloved CDJ 2000 line down into this controller. This includes the hi-res display in the center. It also features the same FX as the DJM-900 mixer.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  7-inch, tension-adjustable, ultra-responsive jog-wheels
 Full-sized tempo faders
<ITALIC>  Nexus-style FX
 Jog displays

CONS:

* None

<BOLD> Traktor S4 Mk3 ($1000)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The S4 Mk3 is the pinnacle of motorized jog technology. It's jogs not only rotate with an impressive torque and use a slipmat simulation that uses variable tension to simulate the effect of touching a record, they are also haptic, meaning you feel a \*click\* as you scratch over hot cues. This is infinitely useful for scratching as it allows you to feel your beat juggles and cuts in addition to hearing them. The controller also offers standalone mixer capability, dedicated loop and jump wheels, onboard displays that show waveforms and samples, and a sleek, ergonomic design outdoing the no-frills, almost messy Pioneer designs. The controller also supports STEM files as all Traktor controllers do. A downside to all Traktor controllers that becomes more apparent at this range, however, is the lack of multiple pad modes. There is no roll or slicer and the use of samples requires a dedicated track. There is also no mic channel.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Fantastic motorized jogs
 Dedicated loop and jump knobs
<ITALIC>  Hi-res waveform display
 STEM-ready

CONS:

<ITALIC>  Limited pad modes
 No dedicated mic channel

<BOLD> Roland DJ-808 ($1300)

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The Roland DJ-808 combines the drum machine of the 505 with a full-fledged 4-channel controller. The drum machine allows whole new levels of creativity and fun, now with more control over the sound of the sample (ASDR, individual sample, pitch, etc.) The controller part features sub-standardly sized jogs that are still highly responsive with dual indicators (on and around the wheel.) The controller includes four sound color modes, Serato-style FX, independent mic control, and full-sized tempo faders.

PROS:

<ITALIC>  Internal drum machine with enhanced sample control
 Complete features in addition to drum machine

CONS:

* Small jogs

<BOLD> Honorable mentions:

<BOLD> DDJ-RZ

(no link)

This controller has been discontinued with the launch of the DDJ 1000. However, it still offers more features than any other controller on the market with touch strips, a large form factor, and a built in filter/pitch variable oscillator for generating sweeps. It was very expensive, however, and will still run more than a new DDJ-1000 used.

<BOLD> DDJ-SX3

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

This controller, although currently being manufactured, is virtually useless. It was designed as an upgrade to the SR-2 and has features comparable to the 1000. However, it costs more, has less capable FX, no jog displays, and smaller jog wheels. 

<BOLD> DDJ-RB

(no link)

Another discontinued controller, the RB was almost identical to the SB3 despite being for Rekordbox. It only had one fx slot per deck, however. It is still a very solid controller and can be found used but did not make the list due to being discontinued.

<BOLD> Denon MC series

The Denon controllers have always been wacky. They didn't really offer anything unique and have confusing layouts and less features than other comparable controllers. The MC4000 entry-level, for example, only has 4 pads and uses a strange radial layout as opposed to the left-to-right of many controller deck sections, despite costing significantly more than any other entry controller. The only unit I considered would be the MC8000, but that is a standalone unit which is thus not a controller. All-in-one standalones are a different thing and come with a whole different set of issues to compare.

<BOLD> DDJ 200

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The DDJ 200 "smart controller" is a wireless IPad controller designed to be ultra-lightweight and small. It runs for around the price of a Numark mixtrack, a full-fledged controller, and for this reason, I cannot recommend it. I/O lag, lack of onboard features, and tiny size make this unit unfit for learning properly on and not worth the price tag.

<BOLD> Numark Party Mix

<DESCRIPTION> <LINK>

The Numark Party Mix is the best ultra-entry controller on the market, seriously outperforming smart and micro controllers. I did not include this in the main list becasue it would be out of place (being nearly a third of the price of most entry level controllers,) but it is fine to learn on despite being very very very basic. It covers what it needs to for the basics and if it is all someone has then that's fine. I would reccomend saving if possible to upgrade to a Mixtrack, however, which has similar features but a much larger form factor (the Party Mix is uncomfortably small.)




To conclude, I hope this helped. This is a very common question and I want to provide as much info as possible on the subject. I wrote a similar post a while ago, but there were some things the community suggested I change. I hope to have the cooperation of the mods in sidebaring this post to help prevent redundant questions.', "I'm so proud of you sister! You overcame such a hard struggle and pulled through! I'm looking forward to when I can graduate too"]

['Maybe just verbally acknowledge with her that expectations for maintaining a ‚Äúspark‚Äù in the current circumstances need to be a little different than in face to face dating. If you‚Äôre still interested in seeing each other post-Corona, ask if she‚Äôd like to pick up where you left off and the leave the door open for yourself. 

You could also look for new things to do or learn together. Gaming. Some sort of nerd sub culture. Online chess. Something....I dunno. 

Good luck. üçÄ', 'Also- if you‚Äôre wanting to do this as ‚Äúresearch‚Äù in preparation for the transition (I assume MTF), as a trans man myself- sex with cis men and trans men isn‚Äôt really comparable, IMO it would be better and more authentic to start thinking about learning how to have sex with your PARTNER instead of focusing on the gender, sex, or presentation. üíï', 'I‚Äôm out!! (Almost) 
 Nothing about my sexual or romantic attraction has changed, no big ‚Äúrevelations‚Äù over here- I‚Äôve always fallen for a person‚Äôs personality and vibe, and was open to a relationship with anyone I clicked with. The sex part is just logistics \U0001f937üèº‍‚ôÄÔ∏è BUT I didn‚Äôt realize this wasn‚Äôt the norm! That knocked me on my ass- was in denial about my queerness BIGTIME after becoming more aware of it. Then came the dreaded closeted stage. I was almost angry about the idea of ‚Äúcoming out‚Äù because nothing about me was different! I still felt/thought the same way!! And then the imposter stage (this was a worse feeling than rejection after coming out, IMO). I felt anxious/worried/guilty about calling myself part of the LGBTQIA community, like maybe I hadn‚Äôt earned being here because I hadn‚Äôt suffered enough- I have privilege and safety as a passable cis-straight, white, woman. (I‚Äôm white, but that‚Äôs as far as it goes. Lol. Closeted Enby over here). 

I‚Äôm rambling at this point. Sorrrrry!! 

Long story short, I came out to my most trusted and dear family member- who didn‚Äôt believe me, said I was just stressed, and then checked back later to see if I had come to my senses üôÑ. That hurt. A lot. We haven‚Äôt spoken sense. 

Happy ending tho (or beginning rather)- yesterday, I decided to really embrace this and communicate with the world who I am by owning being pansexual + demi. I came out officially to 3 close friends, and my highschool mentor who I haven‚Äôt seen in 14 years (who is lesbian). The response was so warm, celebratory, and validating! It felt amazing ü§ó. I had so much peace!  They all said ‚Äúduh, you‚Äôve always had queer vibe. Welcome to the club!! Let‚Äôs find you some hotties! ‚Äú üåà üòÇ

I‚Äôm really looking forward to moving forward without self-imposed restrictions and feeling more authentic. I‚Äôm still a little sad that for the most part I‚Äôll have to have a split life; the little family I have is old school Irish Roman Catholic and will never accept it. I‚Äôve always been a black sheep, this won‚Äôt help. I can‚Äôt even imagine trying to explain to them that I am a man, in a very pretty petite white girl wrapper... but that‚Äôs a hurdle for another day. 

Does anyone have advice or experiences to share about how/if they came out on social media or in account profiles? I‚Äôm still scared \U0001f97a 
üíñ üíõ üíô', 'Ooh! Love that polish color too! Very nice!']

["Oof, my feels!

I feel ... like you're incredibly cute!", "I appreciate the compassion. I'd love to be your friend!", "It's actually mostly blonde with a splash of that sort of teal, and then my brunette roots growing in under it. I'd prefer blonde, but the teal could be super cute too!", "I don't know if this belongs here but these are my thoughts on my current state of questioning. I'm looking for clarity. 
 So much of my identity has always been a reaction to how others see me, how they themselves react to me. I guess that's kinda what gender is, really, a set of conventions that others expect from you in presentation. Maybe that's why in 25 years I never realized I might be trans. This past year it's clouded my thoughts and unleashed storms that I've solemnly waited out until just recently I let it all wash over me and it felt so wonderful, so clarifying. What a grand affirming gesture it was to come out to myself! Then I came out to people I care about. I have the luxury at my age of having people I care about but don't owe anything. I've never felt close to genetic family because of this sense of obligation. My chosen family responded pretty well, though it's obviously been pretty difficult for my girlfriend, which has made it more difficult for me. I'm 6 months into the best relationship of my life and happier than I've ever been. And I've always considered myself a very happy person; I put the happiness of myself and others above everything else, in this short-sighted sort of way that has led me to never plan for my future and waste all my supposed talent and potential in college. What a luxury it is to be happy. I wonder why I think that. I think that's something we're all made to internalize, and that makes the process of transitioning even harder as we feel like what we're doing is superfluous. But I've rejected this thinking. Being happy is the most basic human right. I deserve it. Everyone deserves it. Fuck I don't know what I'm doing. Why am I even writing this? My stream of thought bounces around at such a pace with such dime-drop pivot speed, I wonder how I ever get anything done. Sometimes it really seems like I've never gotten anything done. So how the fuck am I supposed to turn myself from a soft but subtly manly boy into a beautiful woman? I usually don't have dysphoria. It almost feels like wanting to be a woman has led me to appreciate the manly elements I'd always thought I'd lacked. But I fucking hate them when I try to present femme. I'm vapid like that. I'm shallow. I wanna wake up looking like a porn star. I regret that so much of my gender questioning origins are tied into porn. What I crave is validation, the sense of truth that comes with a concensus reaction of belonging. What deeper validation is there than lust? What greater height of desire? I know, I know, there's so much more to being a woman. I want to discover that. But it's dizzying and unknown, so of course I return to something familiar. Perhaps each trans person's experience is inherently tied to and based around whatever we find most strongly appealing about our true gender. That's part of what makes NBs so cool. They're pioneers of a new gender horizon. I think I'm a bold and unique person in many ways and often wonder if I am my own sort of non-binary. But sometimes being a whole-ass goddamn woman just has such strong appeal to me. It's just so difficult to understand what I want without being able to visualize it, and it's tough to be able to visualize it without being able to present it, but it's tough to be able to present it when I don't know exactly what it is that I want. Thoughts like these circle around and form the vortex which sucks me into uncertainty again. And I'm back at the start, alone in my thoughts, with no progress made. I wish that I could just think it out, just focus and deliberate alone until I understand what I am and what I want. But so much of my identity has always been a reaction to how others see me."]

["I'm so happy for you and congratulations on being on HRT for 8 months", "This is so cute and no matter what I'm so happy for you", 'My mom came out to me 
 Background: I'm a trans girl who is attracte to a narrow range of masculine people and a wide range of femmes but because I would never date a man for a lot of reasons I identify as a lesbian. 
My mom is in her mid 40s and has always said some things that struck me as super gay ie. "I go to Hooters some times because the girls are so pretty" "my friend x is really attractive I'd date her if something ever happened to my husband" she also grew up in a very repressive household and her dad is a sexist asshat. 

Anyways my whole life she always kind of struck me as like definetly queer but I couldn't place it. We were running Christmas errands the other day and she started asking me question about mine and my partners relationship and my sexuality. I explained to her men yes but actually no, girls yes. Then she told me something along the lines of 
"Well I find some women attractive and have my whole life. Doesn't mean I'm gay just because I'm attracted to them. And like I would date friend x if I could. 

So I tried to explained to her like bisexuality and like how she doesn't find all men attractive that doesn't mean she doesn't find men attractive. Plus I kind of used the Kinsey scale as a descriptor and stayed away from some of the problematic parts of it. By the end of it she asked me "so I could be bisexual even if I don't find all women attractive and am mostly attracted to men?" 

It was a really pleasant conversation and I'm glad I got to have it with her. She doesn't ever plan on coming out since she's basically married and doesn't really want to come out, which is totally valid. I'm just really happy for her.', "Remember pride is inclusive and TERFs don't belong in pride or Queer circles"]

['Yeah, if you shove a mans dad violently to the ground, then attack him and put him in a chokehold <ITALIC> while he‚Äôs trying to back away and get away from you - you deserve to have him use every means of self defense he can on you.', 'LPT: Move social media apps to a secondary device (like an iPad) to give yourself some distance without having to quit them entirely. 
 This past week I have been as outraged as anyone else, and been in the streets protesting and sharing as much as possible to all my friends across a variety of platforms.  
  
But a few days ago it just all kinda got to me.  The 24/7 cycle of outrage and abuse just became too much and I needed some distance lest my anxiety take over completely.  
  
So I moved all my social media apps (Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, Reddit) to my iPad instead, and deleted them from my phone.   Now I still have the option to go and check what‚Äôs happening several times a day, but gone is the constant <ITALIC> need to be constantly plugged in and refreshing things 24/7.  
  
Plus this frees up a lot of brain cycles for other things I need to accomplish in my life.  For anyone who is feeling a bit overwhelmed, consider trying this.  You‚Äôre not losing anything, as all your apps are still within reach - they‚Äôre just no longer intimately integrated with you.', 'Got back into the game a week ago. Just checked my Reddit user page, saw my karma and instinctively thought ‚Äòoh damn i should spend that on something‚Äô. 
 But honestly this would be an amazing idea for a social network.', "<ITALIC> ‚ÄùWhat they're saying is ignorant hateful, but taking away their right to say it doesn't solve anything. You won't change their mind by silencing them. If anything you should try to tell them why they're wrong.‚Äù  
  
This is what she said.  Like, if you‚Äôre interpreting that this means she believes they shouldn‚Äôt be allowed on Reddit, then I don‚Äôt know how to have a discussion with you because we are obviously not interpreting reality the same way."]

["I thought about this, and I really I want them to relate to me as a woman.

I think my real reservations are that I won't pass well enough and people will think of me as somewhere in between =(", "I still find myself having moments of doubt 4 months into HRT, living full time.  I find it more funny than distressing at this point.  So you've got this to look forward to.

I've found that each time it happens it gets easier to remember the overwhelming evidence that, yes, I'm trans and this is the right decision for me.  Just think about all the reasons that got you to where you are now.", 'You realize he polls <ITALIC> dramatically better than any of the other dems against trump, right?', "I mean, this year is going to suck, but try to focus on the end goal.  Being 20 means you've still got like 60+ years left you can be yourself after this.

Try to start including things that you are going to want to do as part of transitioning anyway to keep yourself motivated.  Start practicing your voice while you aren't around your parents.  Keep yourself in shape, lots of cardio and low weight, high rep stuff to tone your body.  You can even lie to your parents about this part claiming you are trying to be more masculine if that makes it easier.  Maybe see if you can meet some others like yourself that maybe live in more accepting homes or by themselves so you have a safe place to go for times when you really can't suppress."]

['I want to come out to my partner but I‚Äôm so anxious 
 I posted yesterday on <SUBREDDIT> that I was planning on coming out to my partner (cis straight male). I chickened out and I am feeing disappointed. My counselor and the one friend I am out to have been very helpful and supportive. I know for me, when something is on my mind and I don‚Äôt express it, I get extremely anxious.

I‚Äôve buzzed my hair, and I have a binder that I tried on for five minutes and loved it. I know for me I need to do this. But I‚Äôm really uncertain how my partner will react. He is very supportive of LGBTQ rights (I‚Äôm bi and he supports me in that). But I don‚Äôt know how he will feel about me presenting more androgynously, which is my goal. I don‚Äôt want to take T or anything, but I might want a breast reduction in the future (if I‚Äôm ever not poor lol), and would like to wear my binder sometimes. I think I‚Äôm okay with she/her, but I also like they. And I‚Äôd prefer he call me his partner instead of girlfriend.

I‚Äôm just afraid that he will not want to be in a relationship anymore. He is not rash so I know he won‚Äôt do it instantly. And I know I need to be myself. But I‚Äôm nervous. For context - I am 30, he is 32. We‚Äôve been together for 6 years and lived together for about 5.

Any encouragement or advice is very much appreciated.', 'How do you know what you like? 
 I have a very hard time knowing myself - not sure if this is ADHD related or more anxiety...or just me being weird. I tend to enjoy whatever others around me are doing. Not that I want them to think I‚Äôm cool or anything, but I like everyone to be happy. And I genuinely enjoy a variety of things!

This makes it hard for me to know what I personally want or the kind of person I want to be. I get all up in my head. Do I just want to be unfocused and eclectic?‚Äù Do I want to be super into fitness and cooking?‚Äù ‚ÄúDo I want to be into film and literature?‚Äù Like I cant always separate what I like from what others in my life like.

Can anyone reset to this? Any tips?', 'Tarot spread for clarity? 
 Cross post from <SUBREDDIT> !

Hey all,
I‚Äôve been struggling quite a bit with mental/emotional overwhelm. I‚Äôve been doing daily spreads, but want something a bit deeper I think. I usually ask an open ended question and read the cards pretty intuitively. I pull the number of cards that feels right, then read the cards as a whole rather than assigning particular meanings to each card.

However, I feel like I just want a spread to answer ‚ÄúWhat the fork is happening in my life?‚Äù Or ‚ÄúHow do I stop being anxious af and confused all the time?‚Äù

Would a Celtic cross make sense for this? Or another spread? Also, do you find particular decks more useful for this type of question or just what I‚Äôm giving with? Lately I have been loving The Crow Tarot. I also have Mystic Mondays and a RW deck. I have The Light Seer tarot as well, but haven‚Äôt connected with that as much.

Note: I also have the mundane stuff going on to help with this, I.e. working with my doctor and counselor!

Thanks for any advice friends!', 'If you want to cut your hair, do it 
 Hey all,
I posted on here a bit on a throwaway, but y‚Äôall are so awesome I made a real account. Like a lot of folks, I posted on here about how I was nervous to buzz my hair.

To anyone who feels the same DO IT. I spend a long time being anxious over my hair. I knew I wanted it buzzed, but was concerned about how people in my life would react. I buzzed today, and feel a thousand percent better. Even if I might feel sad or anxious that someone doesn‚Äôt like it, I know it will be way better than disliking myself every time I look in the mirror.

Wear your hair however you love it! Of course with the caveat that you will be safe if you express yourself this way!

Stay beautiful friends.']
